revision.text:
==Ingredients== * 1 head purple [[kale]], washed * 4 Belgian [[endive]]s, washed * 2 lrg seedless [[orange]]s, peel and section * 1/2 cup [[pecan]] halves
== Directions == # Place a couple of leaves of kale on each of 4 individual salad plates. # Equally divide the endive and oranges on each plate, sprinkle pecans on top, and add a spoonful of dressing. I suggest vinaigrette.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian endive Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]]

time it takes: 10 minutes
== Ingredients == * One [[tomato]] * One [[cucumber]] * Half an [[onion]] * One [[lemon]] * [[Salt]]
== Directions == # Dice the vegetables; mix # Cut the lemon in half; squeeze # Salt to taste
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Quick and Easy Side Dishes]] [[Category:Quick and Easy Snacks]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]]

==Cook Time== 10 minutes
== Ingredients == * 1 cup [[raspberries]] * 2 cups [[strawberries]] * 1 cup [[blueberries]] * 1 cup [[blackberries]] * 3 cup [[grapes]]
== Directions == 1.Blend grapes until coarse, spilling out excess juices.
2.Add other berries, mixed, to grape shreds.
3.Serve cold, with optional whipped cream if you want this to be a dessert. If you want it to be a side dish, I suggest cutting an [[orange]] in half and scooping the fruit out, using it as a cup.
[[Category:Dessert Recipes]] [[Category:Fruit Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Snack Recipes]]

page.title: Green Beans, Tomatoes and Pine Nuts

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/85.12.79.6|85.12.79.6]] ([[User talk:85.12.79.6|talk]] | [[Special:Block/85.12.79.6|block]]) to last version by [[User:85.12.80.80|85.12.80.80]]
revision.text:
==Info- POO== '''Cook Time''': 10 muinutes
'''Serves''': 10
== Ingredients == * 1-1/2 pounds fresh [[green bean]]s, trimmed and rinsed
* 3 tablespoons [[olive oil]]
* 1 large [[shallot]]s (or one small [[onion]],) peeled, halved and thinly sliced
* 2.5 tablespoons [[pine nut]]s
* 1 cups [[cherry tomato]]es, halved
== Directions == 1.Bring a large frying pan of water to a boil. Add the beans and cook for about 2 minutes.
2.Drain beans and immediately immerse in cold water to instantly stop cooking. Drain in a colandar then gently pat dry.
3.Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and sauté until golden brown. Add pine nuts and cook for about 3 minutes.
4.In a medium sized serving bowl, add the beans, tomatoes, shallots and pine nuts then gently toss until combined then serve.
== Source == * [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/greenbean-salad.htm Green Beans, Tomatoes and Pine Nuts] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' -- original source of recipe, public domain government resource
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/chickensalad.htm Almond Chicken Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle and King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[asparagus]] tips, diagonally cut * ¼ cup low-calorie [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup plain, non-fat [[yogurt]] * 1 teaspoon [[curry powder]] * 1 teaspoon fresh [[lemon juice]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ⅛ teaspoon fresh ground [[pepper]] * 2 cups cooked skinless, boneless [[chicken breast]], chopped * ½ cup [[red bell pepper]], seeded and chopped * ¼ cup fresh [[cilantro]], chopped * 2 tablespoons sliced [[almond]]s, toasted * [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Steam asparagus for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. # In a medium bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, yogurt, curry, lemon juice and salt. # Add asparagus, chicken, bell pepper, cilantro and almonds and toss to coat. # Serve on fresh lettuce leaves.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Asparagus Salad with Lemon Soy Vinaigrette

revision.text:
==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/asparagus-salad.htm Asparagus Salad with Lemon Soy Vinaigrette] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle and King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, government resource in the public domain * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 1¼ lbs [[asparagus]] cut diagonally into 1½ inch pieces * 10 [[scallion]]s, trimmed with some green * 1 scallion, chopped and set aside * 1 tablespoon [[vegetable oil]] * ¼ teaspoon fresh [[ginger]], grated * ½ cup nonfat, reduced sodium [[chicken broth]] * 1 tablespoon [[rice wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon low-sodium [[soy sauce]] * ½ teaspoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 1 tablespoon fresh-squeezed [[lemon juice]]
== Directions == # Steam asparagus and scallions in a steam basket over boiling water for 5 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender. # Remove from heat and rinse with cold water in a colander to stop the cooking. # Drain and let cool. # Make the vinaigrette: in a small saucepan, heat oil over medium-high heat. # Add ginger and cook until it begins to brown. # Add the reserved chopped scallion and cook for 15 seconds then stir in the chicken broth, vinegar, soy sauce and sugar. # Remove from heat and set aside. # In a large bowl, toss steamed asparagus and scallions with the vinaigrette then add ground pepper and lemon juice then serve.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

page.title: Balsamic Chicken and Brown Rice Salad

revision.text:
[[File:IMG_75501.jpg|right|300px|link=]] ==Info== '''Cook Time''':
'''Serves''':
== Ingredients == * 1 recipe Balsamic Vinaigrette (recipe below)
* Nonfat cooking spray
* 3 skinless and boneless [[chicken breast]] halves
* 1 15.5 oz. can [[green bean]]s, French-cut, drained
* 2 cups cooked [[brown rice]], cooled
* 1 cup shredded [[red cabbage]]
* 1 medium [[carrot]], shredded
* 1 green [[onion]], sliced
* [[Lettuce]] leaves (optional)
* ===Balsamic Vinaigrette===
* (makes about 1/2 cup)
* 2 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]]
* 1/4 teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]]
* 1/3 cup [[olive oil]]
* 1/2 teaspoon [[water]]
== Directions == === Vinagrette ===
1.Place vinaigrette ingredients in an airtight container and shake until combined or use a whisk to combine in a bowl then set aside.
=== Salad ===
1.Preheat broiler. Adjust oven rack to about 4-5 inches from heat.
2.Place 2 tablespoons of the vinaigrette in a bowl then brush chicken halves on each side.
3.Spray a broiler pan with cooking spray then place chicken on pan. Place pan on oven rack and cook chicken for about 15 minutes or until no longer pink in the thickest part of the meat and juices run clear. Turn halves to other side halfway through the time to ensure even cooking. Cut chicken into 1/4-inch slices and set aside.
4.In a large bowl, toss together the green beans, rice, cabbage, carrot and green onion. Add remaining vinaigrette and toss until well-coated.
5.Place lettuce leaves on salad plates. Add a serving of the rice mixture in the center and top with chicken slices.
== Source == * [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/balsamic-chicken-salad.htm Balsamic Chicken and Brown Rice Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle and King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, government resource in the public domain
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Brown rice Recipes]] [[Category:Cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Pear, Walnut and Roquefort Cheese Salad

revision.text:
==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/pwrsalad.htm Pear, Walnut and Roquefort Cheese Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource
'''Serves''': 6
== Ingredients == === Vinaigrette === * ½ cup canned whole-berry [[cranberry sauce]] * ¼ cup fresh-squeezed [[orange juice]] * 1 tablespoon [[vegetable oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon fresh [[ginger]], minced * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]]
=== Salad === * 4 cups salad [[greens]] * 2 ripe [[pear]]s, cored and sliced * 2 tablespoons fresh-squeezed [[orange juice]] * 1 small [[red onion]], sliced * ⅓ cup [[Roquefort]] cheese, crumbled * 2 tablespoons [[walnut]]s, coarsely chopped
== Directions == # In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together all vinaigrette ingredients. # Arrange salad greens on six plates. Toss pear slices with the 2 tablespoons of orange juice then divide pears and onion slices among the salad plates on top of greens. # Top each serving evenly with crumbled Roquefort cheese and walnuts. # Drizzle each plate with vinaigrette to desired amount.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Roquefort Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Pear Recipes]]

page.title: Roasted Eggplant, Tomato and Arugula Salad

revision.text:
==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/eggplantsalad.htm Roasted Eggplant, Tomato and Arugula] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 2 medium sized [[eggplant]]s, cut into ¾ inch slices * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon fresh [[lemon juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[cilantro]], chopped * 1½ cups red or yellow [[cherry tomato]]es, halved * 1 teaspoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 2 [[garlic]] cloves, crushed * 4 tablespoons [[feta cheese]], crumbled * 3 cups [[arugula]] * 4 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]]
== Directions == # Preheat oven to broil. # Place eggplant on a foil-lined broiler pan and brush with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil then drizzle lemon juice over slices. # Broil eggplant for 8–10 minutes, turning once until tender and golden, then sprinkle with cilantro. # In a medium sized skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of the olive oil to medium-high heat. # Add tomatoes, sugar, garlic and sauté for 1–2 minutes until softened but not mushy. # Reduce heat to low. # Arrange eggplant on salad plates. # Divide feta cheese and mound on each plate on top of eggplant. # Divide tomatoes and place on top of feta cheese then top with arugula leaves. # In the skillet, under low heat, add the remaining oil and balsamic vinegar and heat through for 30 seconds. # Drizzle dressing over each salad.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]]

[http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/chickenfruitsalad.htm Chicken, Fruit and Celery Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[chicken]] breast, chopped * 1 cup chopped [[apple]]s * ¼ cup seedless [[red grapes]], halved * ½ cup chopped [[celery]] * ½ tablespoon dried [[dill]] (or 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped) * ¼ cup low-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon non-fat [[sour cream]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # In a large bowl, toss the chicken, apples, grapes, celery and dill. # Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, salt and pepper and stir to combine.
== Serving Suggestions == # Serve on a bed of mixed greens garnished with slivered toasted almonds. # Use as a filling with your favorite bread to make a sandwich.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Red grape Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/citrusshrimp.htm Citrus Shrimp Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 1 clove [[garlic]] * 3 tablespoons fresh-squeezed [[lemon juice]] * 1 tablespoon low-sodium [[soy sauce]] * ⅛ teaspooon [[red pepper flakes]] * 1 teaspoon fresh ground [[black pepper]] * 1 pound medium peeled and deveined [[shrimp]] * 1 cup [[watercress]], chopped * 1 medium head [[cabbage]], shredded * 1 [[carrot]], peeled and grated * ⅓ cup fresh-squeezed [[lime juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[honey]] * non-fat [[cooking spray]] * 2 tablespoons fresh [[basil]], chopped (optional) * 2 tablespoons roasted [[peanut]]s, chopped (optional)
== Directions == # In a food processor, add the garlic, lemon juice, soy sauce, red pepper flakes and blend until smooth. # Pour lemon juice mixture into a medium sized bowl then add shrimp. # Toss to coat evenly, cover with plastic wrap then marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. # In a large serving bowl, add the watercress, cabbage, and carrot and mix until combined. # In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice and honey then pour over salad mix. # Toss until well-coated. # Spray a small skillet with nonfat cooking spray. # Pour shrimp with the marinade into the pan and cook over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes or until shrimp is completely pink in the center. # 6. # Place cooked shrimp in center of salad and garnish with optional basil and peanuts.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Shrimp Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]]

==Description== [http://foodie.wikia.com/index.php?title=Elocina%27s_Stacked_Vegetable_Salad Stacked Vegetable Salad] from the ''Public Domain Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 1 medium-sized [[eggplant]] * 2 medium-sized [[portobello mushroom]]s (about 4-5" in diameter) * non-fat [[cooking spray]] * ½ cup [[arugula]] or mixed salad greens * 1 large [[tomato]], sliced * ¼ cup [[chèvre|goat cheese]] or cheese of your choice * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon [[balsamic vinegar]] * fresh [[oregano]] (optional)
== Directions == # Preheat broiler. # Slice eggplant lengthwise, about ¼-inch thick then cut each slice crosswise in half. # Remove stems from portobello mushrooms then wipe the smooth surface of the mushroom with a paper towel to remove any excess soil. # Spray a cookie sheet with nonfat cooking spray. # Place eggplant pieces and mushrooms (gill-side up) on the sheet then lightly spray vegetables with cooking spray. # Broil about 5 inches or 2nd to the top shelf level of the oven from the broiler for about 7–10 minutes or until eggplant starts turning golden brown. # Remove roasted vegetables from oven. # Place the portobellos, gill-side up on salad plates. # Add a layer of arugula or greens then a slice of tomato. # Spread 1 tablespoon of the goat cheese on the tomato then add an eggplant slice. # Repeat starting with the arugula or greens 3 more times. # Drizzle each stack each with ½ tablespoon olive oil and ½ tablespoon balsamic vinegar then sprinkle with desired amount of fresh oregano.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Portobello mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

__NOTOC__
== Description == [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/tabbouleh.htm Tabbouleh Salad with Lemon-Garlic Dressing] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * ¾ cups uncooked fine-grained cracked [[bulgur|bulgur wheat]] * 1½ cups boiling [[water]] * [[#Lemon-Garlic Dressing|Lemon Garlic Dressing]] * 3 [[tomato]]es, chopped * 6 [[green onions]], chopped * 1 medium [[red bell pepper]], seeded and chopped * 1 cup chopped [[cucumber]] * ¾ cup fresh [[cilantro]], chopped * 3 tablespoons chopped fresh [[mint]] * 1 can (15 to 16 oz.) [[chickpea|garbanzo beans]], drained
=== Lemon-Garlic Dressing === * ¼ cup fresh squeezed [[lemon juice]] * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon fresh ground [[pepper]] * 3 cloves [[garlic]], chopped
== Directions == === Lemon-Garlic Dressing === # Using a whisk, combine all dressing ingredients below in a medium sized bowl and set aside.
=== Tabbouleh === # Place bulgur in a medium bowl and then add boiling water. Stir then let stand for 1 hour. Pour off any excess water and fluff with a fork. # Stir in vegetables and garbanzo beans with the bulgur then toss with the dressing.
[[Category:Bulgur Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Middle Eastern Appetizers]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Vegan Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/turkey-cranberry.htm Turkey & Cranberry Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 10 ounces, cooked [[turkey meat|turkey]] breast, cubed * 1 red [[apple]], cored and cut into bite-sized pieces * ¼ cup [[dried cranberries]] * 1 [[orange]], peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces * 3 tablespoons sliced [[almond]]s * 1 cup jellied whole-berry [[cranberry sauce]] * ¼ cup, thawed frozen [[orange juice]] concentrate * 4 cups [[lettuce]], torn into small pieces
== Directions == # In a medium bowl, combine the turkey, apple, cranberries, orange and almonds. Toss until combined. # In a small bowl, whisk together the cranberry sauce and orange juice concentrate then pour over turkey mixture and mix until well-coated. # Arrange lettuce leaves on 4 plates then place an equal portion of the turkey mixture on top then serve.
[[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]]

==Description == [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/currychickensalad.htm Curry Chicken Salad] from the ''Public Domain Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 6
== Ingredients == * 4 skinless, boneless, cooked [[chicken]] breast halves, chopped * ½ cup low-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 1 teaspoon [[curry powder]] * ¼ teaspoon fresh ground [[pepper]] * ¼ cup [[celery]], chopped * ½ cup [[bell pepper]] (any color), seeded and chopped * 1 [[apple]], peeled, cored and chopped * ½ cup red, seedless [[red grapes|grapes]], halved * ¼ cup slivered [[almond]]s * 1 x 8 oz can [[water chestnut]]s, drained and sliced
== Directions == # In a medium bowl, combine chicken, mayonnaise, curry, and pepper. # Add celery, bell pepper, apple, grapes, almonds and water chestnuts and mix until well-coated.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Water chestnut Recipes]]

==Description == [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/turkeysalad.htm Turkey, Orange and Spinach Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 8 cups fresh baby [[spinach]], torn into bite-sized pieces * 8 ounces cooked [[turkey meat|turkey]], cubed * 2 medium [[orange]]s, peeled and sectioned * ¼ cup fresh squeezed [[orange juice]] * 1 tablespoon [[vegetable oil]] * 1 teaspoon [[honey]] * ½ teaspoon [[poppy seeds]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[dry mustard]]
== Directions == # In a large salad bowl, toss together the spinach, turkey and orange sections. # Make the dressing: in an airtight container, add the orange juice, oil, honey, poppy seeds, salt and mustard. # Cover tightly and shake until combined. # Pour over spinach mixture and toss to coat evenly then divide equally on four salad plates.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/waldorf.htm Waldorf Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 6
== Ingredients == * 4 medium sized [[apple]]s, cubed * 3 stalks of [[celery]], chopped * ⅓ cup [[walnut]]s, chopped (optional) * ½ cup low fat [[yogurt]], plain or vanilla * ⅓ cup [[raisins]]
== Directions == # Combine apples, celery, raisins, and walnuts in a bowl. # Stir. # Add yogurt and stir all ingredients together. # Chill to blend flavors or enjoy right away.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]]

page.title: Warmed Tomato Salad with Fresh Mozzarella

revision.text:
==Info== For added color, combine a mix of red cherry tomatoes with yellow and/or orange cherry or pear-shaped tomatoes.
[http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/tomatomozzarella.htm Warmed Tomato Salad with Fresh Mozzarella] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' -- original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * low fat [[cooking spray]] * 2½ cups [[cherry tomato]]es, halved * ¼ cup chopped [[shallot]]s '''or''' [[onion]]s * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * 1 teaspoon fresh [[thyme]], snipped * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon fresh ground [[black pepper]] * 1 cup fresh [[mozzarella]] cheese cut into ½-inch cubes * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * ½ tablespoon [[balsamic vinegar]]
== Directions == # Spray a large skillet with low fat cooking spray then raise heat to medium heat. # Add shallots (or onions), garlic, thyme, salt and pepper and cook for 2–3 minutes or until shallots are tender. # Stir in the tomatoes and cook for 1–2 minutes until tomatoes are warmed then remove from heat. # In a large bowl, toss tomatoes with the mozzarella. # Drizzle with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar then toss to coat evenly.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

== Description == Low in [[sodium]], this [[:Category: Salad Recipes|salad]] will more than meet your daily [[wikipedia:Vitamin A|vitamin A]] requirement. * [http://www.mass.gov/agr/markets/farmersmarkets/resources_consumers_recipes.htmhttp://www.mass.gov/agr/markets/farmersmarkets/resources_consumers_recipes.htm Farmers' Market Recipes] from the Massachusetts Department of Agricultural Resources, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 3
== Ingredients == * 1½ cups fresh, grated [[carrot]]s * 1 unpeeled red [[apple]], chopped * ¼ cup [[raisins]] * ⅛ cup toasted slivered [[almond]]s (optional) * ½ cup low-fat plain [[yogurt]] * 1½ tablespoons low-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 2 teaspoons [[lemon juice]] * salad [[greens]]
== Directions == # Combine carrots, apple, raisins, and almonds in a salad bowl. # Blend together remaining ingredients in a separate bowl and add to carrot mixture. # Serve on salad greens.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Description == [http://www.fruitsandveggiesmatter.gov/month/kiwi.html Fruit and Vegetable of the Month: Kiwi] by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[wine vinegar]] * 2½ tbsp [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 2 tsp [[basil]] * 1 clove [[garlic]] (large), minced * 1 package (8 oz) [[rotini|spiral noodles]] * 2 cups [[broccoli]] flowerets * 2 cups [[crookneck squash]], sliced * 3 [[kiwi]]fruit * 1 lb cooked [[turkey breast]], slivered * 1 cup [[red bell pepper|red pepper]] strips * ½ cup [[green onions]], sliced * ⅓ cup [[Parmesan cheese]], grated
== Directions == # Combine vinegar, oil, mustard, basil, and garlic; mix well. # Cook noodles as package directs. Add broccoli and squash to the last 30 seconds of cooking the noodles and drain. # Pour dressing over noodles, and allow to cool. # Peel and slice kiwifruit. # Toss turkey, red pepper, green onions and kiwifruit with pasta. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to serve.
__NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Crookneck squash Recipes]] [[Category:Kiwi Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Pasta Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Poultry Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Rotini Recipes]] [[Category:Wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]]

== Description == [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/pork.htm Pork Recipes] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 1 pound [[pork]] strips * ½ cup Oriental stir-fry sauce * ½ [[red onion]], peeled and thinly sliced * 2 x 10-oz. packages frozen [[snow peas|pea pods]], thawed and drained * 1 x 8-oz. can [[mandarin orange]]s, drained * 1 x 3-oz. can [[chow mein noodles]]
== Directions == # Marinate pork strips in sauce for 30 minutes. # In large nonstick skillet, stir-fry pork and onion over medium-high heat for about 4–5 minutes. # In a large bowl, toss all ingredients together.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Pork Recipes]] [[Category:Chinese Meat Dishes]] [[Category:Snow pea Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Chow mein noodle Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Meat Recipes]]

== Description == [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/fruit&vegetableI.htm Fruit and Vegetable Recipes I] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
==Ingredients== * 6 [[Red Delicious apple]]s * 1 pkg. [[dried cranberries|Craisinettes]] * 1 stalks [[celery]], chopped * ½ cup chopped [[pecan]]s * 1 small bottle raspberry pecan dressing
== Directions == # Cut apples in small chunks. # Add Craisinettes, celery, and pecans. # Toss with Raspberry dressing. # Chill. # Note: better second day.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[[File:Cauliflower-salad-with-spicy-vinaigrette.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Description == [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/fruit&vegetableI.htm Fruit & Vegetable Recipes] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
==Ingredients== * large head [[cauliflower]], chipped * [[red onion]] * [[green bell pepper]], seeded and chipped * 2 [[scallion]]s, minced * 1 tbsp fresh [[chive]]s, chopped * 1 cup cooked [[basmati rice]] * cup bottled [[vinaigrette]] dressing
== Directions == # Place cauliflower in a steamer basket over boiling water. # Cover pan and steam about 3 minutes, until almost tender. Chill. # Combine next 5 ingredients in a bowl. # Add chilled cauliflower, drizzle with dressing and serve chilled.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Basmati rice Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Side Dish Recipes]]

==Info== '''Cook Time''':
'''Serves''': 4-5
== Ingredients == * 1 env. unflavored [[gelatin]]
* 2 T. [[honey]]
* 1/4 C. [[water]]
* 1 pt. [[strawberry|strawberries]], sliced
* 1 can (13-1/4 oz.) [[pineapple]] tidbits
* 1/2 C. heavy [[cream]], whipped in syrup, undrained
* 1/2 C. [[mayonnaise]]
* 1 T. [[lemon juice]]
* Salad greens
* 1/8 tsp. [[salt]]
* Whole strawberries
* 1/2 tsp. ground [[ginger]]
* [[Watercress]]
== Directions == 1.In a small saucepan, soften gelatin in water. Dissolve completely over hot water. Transfer to 2-quart mixing bowl.
2.Add pineapple and syrup, lemon juice, salt, ginger and honey. Mix well. Stir in sliced strawberries and chill until slightly thickened.
3.Mix cream and mayonnaise; fold into fruit mixture.
4.Pour into 9" x 5" x 3’’ loaf pan, sprayed with non stick spray. (Pan will be about half full.) Freeze until firm.
5.About 30 minutes before serving, invert onto platter and slice into 8 - 10 slices. Place salad greens on 4 or 5 salad plates. For each serving put 2 slices of salad on each plate. Garnish with whole strawberries and watercress.
== Source == * [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/fruit&vegetableII.htm Fruit & Vegetable Recipes II] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Dessert Recipes]] [[Category:Fruit Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ {{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/fruit&vegetableII.htm Fruit & Vegetable Recipes II] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 6
== Ingredients == * 3 Tbsp [[cider vinegar]] * 3 Tbsp [[Apricot jam|apricot preserves]] * 1 Tbsp [[vegetable oil]] * 1 tsp [[Dijon mustard]] * ¼ tsp [[garlic pepper]] * 6 cups [[romaine lettuce]], torn * 3 cups [[watermelon]], seeded and cubed * 1/4 cup [[feta]] * 1/4 cup toasted nuts or seeds
== Directions == # To make dressing, process vinegar, preserves, oil, mustard and pepper in blender or food processor until blended. Chill until ready to serve. # Divide romaine among 6 salad plates. # Place watermelon on top of romaine. Sprinkle with feta and toasted nuts. # Spoon dressing over salad just before serving. [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Watermelon Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.fruitsandveggiesmatter.gov/month/celery.html Fruit & Vegetable of the Month: Celery and Fennel] by the US Centers for Disease Control & Prevention, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 1 medium, about 1½ lbs, [[fennel]] bulb, thinly sliced * 4 medium [[navel orange]]s, peeled and sliced * ¼ cup thinly sliced [[red onion]] * ¼ cup [[kalamata olive]]s, pitted * 2 tsp [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp fresh [[lemon juice]]
== Directions == # Combine fennel, oranges, red onion and olives. # Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. # Toss gently and serve.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Fennel Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Olive Recipes]] [[Category:Vegan Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]]

==Description== [http://www.fns.usda.gov/fdd/facts/hhpfacts/FS-CornWhKernelCanned.pdf Corn, Whole Kernel, Canned] by the US Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 6
== Ingredients == * 2 (15½ ounce) cans [[corn]], drained * ¾ cup [[cucumber]] slices * ¼ cup [[onion]], diced * 2 small [[tomato]]es, coarsely chopped * ¼ cup reduced-fat [[sour cream]] * 2 tablespoons reduced-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon distilled [[white vinegar]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[mustard|dry mustard]] * ¼ teaspoon [[celery seed]]
== Directions == # In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn, cucumbers, onions, and tomatoes # Prepare the dressing by whisking together the sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, mustard, and celery seeds. # Add to corn mixture and toss until all ingredients are evenly coated.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]]

== Description == [http://www.fns.usda.gov/fdd/facts/hhpfacts/FS-RaisinsSeedless.pdf Raisins, Seedless] by the US Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
==Ingredients== * 1 large head [[broccoli]] washed and trimmed * 1 cup chopped [[onion]] * ½ cup [[raisins]] * ½ cup chopped [[pecan]]s or [[walnut]]s (optional) * ½ pound [[bacon]], fried crisp and crumbled (optional) * ¾ cup low fat [[mayonnaise]] * 2 tablespoons [[vinegar]] * ½ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]]
== Directions == # Cut broccoli into small florets and ½” stem pieces. # Combine broccoli, onions, raisin, nuts (optional), and bacon (optional). # In a small separate bowl, make dressing of mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar. # Pour dressing over broccoli. # Refrigerate, covered, overnight to soften broccoli. # Toss before serving.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]]

== Description == [http://www.fns.usda.gov/fdd/facts/hhpfacts/FS-TurkeyCanned.pdf Turkey Canned, Boned] by the US Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 4 == Ingredients == * 4 cups [[turkey meat|turkey]], drained * ½ cup diced [[celery]] * ½ cup [[raisins]] * ½ cup [[dried cranberries]] * ½ cup slivered [[almond]]s * ⅓ cup chopped [[red onion]]s * 1⅓ cup reduced-calorie [[mayonnaise]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[pepper]] * [[lettuce]] as needed
== Directions == # In a medium size bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. # Cover and chill for at least 2 hours. # Layer a plate with lettuce leaves. # Portion each serving onto lettuce leaves; (optional) garnish with additional almonds.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__
[[Category:Christmas Leftovers]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Poultry Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Thanksgiving Leftovers]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]]

==Info== '''Cook Time''':
'''Serves''': 6 to 8
== Ingredients == * 2 quarts [[butter lettuce]] or other salad greens * 1/4 cup [[lemon juice]], freshly squeezed preferred * 1 tablespoon [[sugar]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * dash [[white pepper]] * 1/4 cup heavy [[cream]]
== Directions == 1.Gently wash and dry leaf lettuce. This is a tender lettuce.
2.Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces.
3.Place in refrigerator to chill.
4.Whisk together lemon juice, sugar, salt and pepper.
5.Whisk in heavy cream, a bit at a time, until creamy.
6.Drizzle over lettuce leaves.
7.Toss gently.
8.Serve immediately.
10.Serves 6 to 8.
12.Note: This salad sings spring and tastes so good after eating winter veggies.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Scandinavian Recipes]]

==Ingredients== * 3 cups canned [[corn]] or thawed frozen [[corn]] * 2 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 1 cup minced [[red onion]] * 2 tsp [[chili powder]] * 1 tsp [[cumin]] * 1 [[green bell pepper]], seeded, and diced * 1 [[red bell pepper]], seeded and diced * 1½ cups [[tomato]]es, seeded and diced * 4 tbsp chopped fresh [[cilantro]] * 3 tbsp [[cider vinegar]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # In a small sauté pan, warm olive oil over medium heat. # Add onion and sauté for a few minutes. # Add chili powder and cumin and sauté for 1 minute longer. # In a serving bowl, combine corn, bell peppers, tomatoes, and cooled onions. # Toss to mix. # Add cilantro and vinegar. # Toss well to combine. # Season to taste with salt and pepper, and toss again. # This recipe is best served at room temperature.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]]

page.title: Tomato Cucumber and Red Onion Salad with Mint

revision.text:
== Description == '''Serves:''' 6
== Ingredients == * 2 large [[cucumber]]s, halved lengthwise, seeded and sliced * ⅓ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 tbsp white [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * 3 large [[tomato]]es, seeded and coarsely chopped * ⅔ cup coarsely chopped [[red onion]] * ½ cup chopped fresh [[mint]] leaves * 3 tbsps [[olive oil]] * salt and [[pepper]] to taste
== Preparation == # In a large bowl, toss together the cucumbers, vinegar, sugar and salt. # Let stand at room temperature for an hour, stirring occasionally. # Add tomatoes, onion, mint and oil to cucumbers and toss to blend. # Season to taste with salt and pepper.
[[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Valentine's Day Side Dishes]]

==Ingredients== * 2 pt [[blueberries]] * 1/2 lb lg bing [[cherries]], halved, pitted * 4 lg [[peaches]], sliced * 1/4 c [[Grand Marnier]] * 1/4 c [[sugar]] * 1 pt fresh [[raspberries]] * [[Vanilla yogurt]], optional
== Preparation == Toss blueberries, cherries & peaches with Grand Marnier & sugar. Put fruit in clear glass bowl & sprinkle raspberries over everything. Serve plain or with chilled vanilla yogurt.
4-6 servings
== Contributed by: == * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry Recipes]] [[Category:Grand Marnier Recipes]] [[Category:Peach Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * 4 servings
==Ingredients== === Salad === * 4 cups clean torn [[spinach]] leaves * 2 cups sliced [[mushrooms]] * 2 cups [[cherry tomato]]es * 1 cup [[alfalfa sprouts]] * ¼ cup chopped [[green onions]]
=== Dressing === * ¾ cup [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup [[tarragon vinegar]] * 1 tsp [[honey]] * ¼ tsp [[dry mustard]] * ¼ tsp [[paprika]] * 2 tbsp [[water]] * ⅛ tsp freshly ground [[pepper]]
=== Garnish === * 2 hard boiled [[eggs]], chopped * ⅓ cup sliced [[black olives]]
== Directions == # In salad bowl, combine spinach leaves, mushrooms, tomatoes, sprouts and green onions. # In jar, combine dressing ingredients. # Shake well to blend. # Toss salad to combine and serve on individual plates, drizzled with dressing to taste and garnished with chopped eggs and black olives.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Alfalfa sprout Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * 6 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 lb [[ground beef]] * 1 (15 oz) can [[kidney bean]]s, drained * ½ cup [[picante sauce]] * ½ lb [[Velveeta]] pasteurized process cheese spread, cubed * [[tortilla chips]] * 3 cups shredded [[lettuce]] * 3 cups chopped [[tomato]]es
== Directions == # Brown meat; drain. # Stir in beans and sauce. # Cover; simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. # Add cheese spread; stir until melted. # For each serving; top chips with meat mixture, lettuce and tomato.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Ground beef Recipes]] [[Category:Gourmandise Recipes]] [[Category:Kidney bean Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]]

'''Errrrrrrrrg'''
== Ingredients == * ¼ cup fresh [[Cilantro]] * ¼ cup [[Rosemary]] * 1 cup Sliced [[Carrots]] * ¼ cup [[Basil]] leaves * 2 cups [[lettuce]]
Dressing not included
== How to make == 1st, you chop up about a handful of Cilantro and put it in a ¼ cup measurer and keep on putting some in until the measurer is full. Then, you put it in a salad bowl, but don’t be afraid to put in a little stem, because the stem is yummy, especially in salads. Then, you wash the measurer, fill it with Rosemary, and dump it in. Then you peel and chop up a carrot, put said carrot slices in the bowl, put lettuce into a 1-cup mesurer, dump said lettuce in, and repeat doing so once. To finish it, simply rinse out the ¼ cup measurer, fill it with Basil leaves, and dump the Basil leaves into the salad bowl, and you’re done.
[[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Rosemary Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 tbsp granulated [[gelatin]] * ½ cup cold [[water]] * 1 cup [[chicken broth]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * ½ tsp dried [[dill|dill weed]] * 1 tsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 cup low-fat [[yogurt]] * 1 cup [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], finely chopped * ½ cup [[radishes]], sliced quartered * ¼ cup [[green onions|green onion]], chopped finely * 2 tbsp fresh [[parsley]], snipped * crisp [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Combine [[gelatin]] and cold [[water]] in a saucepan. # Slowly heat over low heat, stirring constantly until [[gelatin]] is clear and liquid. # Add [[chicken broth]], [[salt]], [[dill|dill weed]], and [[granulated sugar|sugar]]; mix well. # Chill until it is of the consistency of unbeaten [[egg white]]s. # Fold in remaining ingredients except [[lettuce]]; mix carefully. # Turn into one 3-cup mold or six ½-cup molds. # Cover lightly with clear plastic wrap. # Chill until set unmold on crisp [[lettuce]].
== Nutritional information == * Food exchanges per serving: ½ skim [[milk]] exchange; cal: 44; cho: 6g; pro: 4g; fat: 0g; sod: 246; omit [[salt]]. * Substitute low-sodium [[chicken broth]].
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Chicken stock and broth Recipes]] [[Category:Christmas Vegetables]] [[Category:Dill leaf Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

This salad recipe and the others following are originals that i have been making for sometime. Most folk seem to enjoy them.
== Ingredients == * 1 x 16oz pkg frozen [[black-eyed pea]]s * 2¼ cup [[water]] * 2 tbsp chopped [[pimento]]s * ⅛ tsp [[liquid smoke]] * ⅓ cup [[cider vinegar]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * ½ tsp [[red pepper flakes]] * 1 med. [[onion]] chopped * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced * 1 tsp [[olive oil]] * ½ cup chopped red [[bell pepper]] * 2 cup [[spinach]] leaves, torn * 4 cup [[lettuce]], torn * ½ tsp [[black pepper]] * ¼ cup monterey [[jack cheese]], grated * 1 purple [[onion]], sliced in rings * ½ cup sliced [[mushroom]]s, fresh * ¼ cup chopped [[pecans]]
== Directions == # Bring 1.5 cups of [[water]] to a boil, add the frozen [[peas]], the [[pimento]], [[liquid smoke]], chopped [[onion]], [[vinegar]], and [[garlic]]. # Reduce to simmer and cook for 45 minutes. # Remove from heat, pour off [[water]], and refrigerate for at least 6-8 hours. # Combine all other ingredients in a large salad bowl. # Mix in the [[black-eyed pea]]s. # Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or more, then serve.
[[Category:Black-eyed pea Recipes]] [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Jack cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Pimento Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Makes 8 servings
== Ingredients == * ⅓ cup [[olive oil]] * 2½ tbs [[cider vinegar]] * 1 tbs spicy brown [[mustard]] * 2 tsp finely grated [[yellow onion]] * ½ tsp each salt and ground [[pepper]] * 2 cans 15½ oz each [[black-eyed pea]]s, drained and rinsed * 1 [[yellow bell pepper]], finely diced * 1 large [[tomato]], seeded, diced * 4 ribs [[celery]], thinly sliced * 2 [[carrot]]s, peeled, finely diced * 2 tbs chopped [[parsley]]
== Directions == # Whisk oil, vinegar, mustard, onion, salt, pepper and honey in a bowl, add peas, bell pepper, tomato, celery, carrots and parsley. Stir to combine. # Cover and refrigerate 24 hours before serving.
[[Category:Black-eyed pea Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Yellow bell pepper Recipes]]

Red Neck Salad == Ingredients == * 2 15-Oz. Cans Shoe-Peg [[corn]], Drained * 2 15-Oz. Cans [[Black-eyed pea|Black-Eyed Peas]], Drained * 1 [[tomato]], Diced * 1 [[red onion]]. Sliced * 16 Oz. Bottle Zesty Italian Dressing
== Directions == Combine corn And peas in Bowl. Add [[tomato]] And [[Onion]]. Pour About Half The Dressing Over Mixture, Add More as Needed And Refrigerate 4 to 5 Hours.
== contributed by == * [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Black-eyed pea Recipes]] [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

revision.comment: Robot: Changing Category:Hearts of palm Recipes
revision.text:
White Fish on Black-eyed peas (Senegal). '''L'Assiette des Assiettes''' means "the dish of dishes." In Senegal the term is used to refer to the appetizer of appetizers
== Ingredients ==
* 1 bed of [[lettuce]] * 3 Tbs. cooked [[Black-eyed pea|Black-Eyed Peas]] * 3-inch square piece cooked fish ([[Haddock]] or [[Halibut]]) on the [[Peas]] * 2 [[tomato]] slices * 3 [[cucumber]] slices * 1 or 2 pieces [[hearts of palm]] * 1/2 hard-boiled [[egg]] * bottle tomato [[ketchup|catsup]] * 1 tsp. [[worcestershire sauce]] * 1/2 cup [[white vinegar]] * 3 Tbs. [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1/2 cup [[onion]], chopped finely
== Directions == # Arrange 1 bed of [[lettuce]]. # Place 3 Tbs. cooked black-eyed peas in center of plate. # Place a 3-inch square piece cooked fish ([[Haddock]] or [[Halibut]]) on the [[Peas]]. # Surround with: tomato, cucumber, hearts of palm, and egg # Mask the fish with the following dressing (enough for 8 portions): # Combine tomato catsup, [[worcestershire sauce]], [[white vinegar]], [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], and [[onion]] # Chill thoroughly before serving.
[[Category:Appetizer Recipes]] [[Category:Black-eyed pea Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Fish Recipes]] [[Category:Haddock Recipes]] [[Category:Halibut Recipes]] [[Category:Heart of palm Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 6 servings.
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled to room temperature * 1 x 17-ounce can whole kernel [[corn]], drained * ½ cup diced [[poblano pepper|chile poblano]], peeled, and seeded * ½ cup chopped [[green olive]]s with [[pimento]]s * ⅓ cup chopped [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * ⅓ cup chopped [[red bell pepper]] * ⅓ cup sliced [[green onions]] * 1 teaspoon [[red pepper flakes|crushed red pepper]] * 3 tablespoons [[lime juice]] * 3 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 1 teaspoon [[garlic]], crushed * 8 ounces [[queso blanco|queso fresco]] '''or''' a very mild [[feta]] cheese, crumbled * [[lettuce]] leaves * 2 small [[tomato]]es, cut into wedges, for garnish
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[corn]], [[chile peppers|chile]], , [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], red pepper, [[onion]]s and [[red pepper flakes|crushed red pepper]] in large bowl. # Mix [[lime juice]], [[oil]] and [[garlic]]; add to [[rice]] mixture. # Just before serving add [[cheese]] and toss lightly. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves; garnish with [[tomato]] wedges.
[[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green olive Recipes]] [[Category:Poblano pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Queso blanco Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Apple Spinach Salad with Nuts and Dates

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ == Description == [[File:Spinachnutssalad.JPG|right|link=|300px]] Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Makes 6 servings.
== Ingredients == === Dressing === * ½ cup [[walnut oil]] * ¼ cup [[apple cider vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[molasses]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * ¼ tsp [[pepper]]
=== Salad === * 1 x 12 oz. bag of baby [[spinach]] * 12 sliced [[dates]] * 3 [[apples]], thinly sliced * ½ cup [[walnuts]]
== Directions == === Dressing === # Whisk all ingredients until blended.
=== Salad === # Toss together with ¼ cup of the dressing.
=== Serving === # Serve immediately with the ½ cup walnuts, toasted and coarsely chopped, sprinkled over the top. # Serve the remaining dressing alongside the salad.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Dates Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 6 C. Torn [[lettuce]] * 6 Oz. [[spinach]], Torn Into Pieces * 8 Oz. Cooked [[Turkey]], Cut Into Strips * 8 Oz. Cooked [[Ham]], Cut Into Strips * 6 Oz. [[Swiss cheese]], Cut Into Thin Strips * 1 C. Broken Melba Cracker Rounds * 8 [[cherry tomato]]es, Halved * 8 Pitted Black or [[green olive]]s, Halved * Hard Boiled [[egg]]s, Cut Into Slices
== Directions == Combine All Ingredients in Large Salad Bowls or Divide Ingredients Among Individual Salad Bowls. Garnish With Hard Boiled [[egg]] Slices if Desired.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

A nice balance of sweet and tangy in this turkey salad. It tastes even better after refrigerated. == Ingredients ==
* 2 pounds cooked [[turkey]] * 1 jar honey [[Dijon mustard]] * 2 teaspoons [[Creole mustard]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 3 [[celery]] stalks, diced * 2 Vidalia [[onions]], chopped * 3 [[garlic]] cloves, chopped * 4 hard-boiled [[eggs]], chopped * 3 teaspoons [[cayenne pepper]] * 4 teaspoons [[black pepper]] * 1 teaspoon [[lemon juice]] == Directions ==
# Mix all ingredients well in a large bowl and serve.
[[Category:Christmas Leftovers]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]]

revision.comment: /* Directions */clean up, replaced: [[cayenne pepper|red pepper]] → red pepper
revision.text:
==Ingredients== * 1 cooked broiler-fryer, boned, * 1 cup small [[macaroni]] * 3 [[tomato]] * 1 cup [[celery]] * 1/2 cup red [[bell pepper]] * 3 tbsp [[green onions|green onion]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * 1/2 tsp [[black pepper]] * 1/4 tsp [[oregano]] * 1 cup [[chicken broth]] * 1 [[garlic]] clove * 1/4 cup [[wine vinegar]]
== Directions == # In large bowl, mix together [[Chicken]] (while still warm), [[macaroni]], [[tomato]]es, [[celery]], red pepper, and [[green onions]]. # Sprinkle with [[salt]], [[pepper]] and [[oregano]]. # In small saucepan, place [[chicken broth]] and [[garlic]]; bring to a boil over high temperature and boil for 10 minutes or until broth is reduced to ½ cup. # Add [[wine vinegar]] and pour over salad, mixing well. # Chill until cold.
[[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Main Dishes]] [[Category:Healthy Side Dishes]] [[Category:Macaroni Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Pasta Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * [[Salsa]] * cooked [[rice]], chilled * cooked [[black beans]] * [[corn]] * [[avocado]], chopped
== Directions == # Mix cooked chilled rice with black beans, corn, chopped avocado and salsa.
== Contributed by: == * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * [[cucumber]], seeded and diced * frozen [[peas]], thawed * [[scallions]], chopped * sour [[cream]]
== Directions == # Mix diced, seeded cucumber with thawed frozen peas, chopped scallions and sour cream.
== Contributed by == * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 2 3/4 pounds [[red potatoes]], with skins * 4 large [[eggs]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 2 small [[chipotle chiles]] in adobo sauce, seeded and minced * 1 tbs [[adobo sauce]] * 1 tbs [[white wine vinegar]] * [[salt]] to taste * 1/2 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1/2 cup chopped [[onion]] * 1/4 cup chopped [[jicama]] * 1/4 cup chopped [[cilantro]]
== Directions == # Cook potatoes in a saucepan of salted boiling water until tender. # Drain, cool. # Cut into cubes, leaving skins on. # Place eggs in a saucepan, add enough cold water to cover eggs. # Bring to a boil, lower heat, simmer 10 min. # Drain, cool under cold running water. # Peel and chop. # Stir together mayonnaise, chiles, adobo sauce, vinegar and salt in a bowl. # Add potatoes, eggs, celery, onion, jicama and cilantro and toss until coated. # Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
Makes 8 servings
== Contributed by: == * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Potato Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}}
== Ingredients == * 2 small sectioned [[oranges]] * 1 large sectioned [[grapefruit]] * 1 cubed red [[Apple]] * 2 cups [[pineapple]] chunks * 1 1/2 cups chopped [[mango]] * 1/2 cup chopped [[dates]] * 1/2 cup plain [[yogurt]] * 2 tbsp. [[lime juice]] * 1 tbsp. [[honey]] * 1/2 tsp. grated [[lime]] peel
== Directions ==
# Toss [[oranges]] with [[grapefruit]], [[Apple]], [[pineapple]], [[mango]] and [[dates]]. # Spoon into 6 fruit bowls.
=== Dressing === # combine remaining ingredients in blender. # Whir until smooth. # Spoon over salads to serve.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Dates Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]]

==Ingredients== * 1 lbs [[chicken]] meat, white skinless * ½ cup [[lettuce]], torn into pieces * 2 med [[tomato]]es, cut into pieces * 1 can [[kidney bean]]s, rinsed and drained (15 oz. size) * ½ cup [[Cheddar]] cheese, non fat * [[hot sauce]] to taste * ½ pack [[tortilla chips]], *baked* (1 gm fat per 20 chips) * bottle Kraft fat-free [[Catalina dressing|salad dressing, catalina]] * 1 pack [[taco seasoning]] mix
== Directions == # Place [[chicken]] in a bowl and cover with waxed paper. # Cook in microwave about 5 minutes. Remove and drain [[chicken]] to remove any fat. # Prepare taco mix as directed, substituting [[chicken]] for beef. # Place [[lettuce]], [[tomato]]es, and chips in a large bowl. Add drained beans, grated [[cheese]], and [[salad dressing]]. Mix well. # Top with chicken # Serve immediately.
== Nutritional Information == Per serving: * fat 4 g | chol. 56 mg | calories 336 | protein 30 g | carb. 46 gm | 11% of calories from fat
[[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Main Dishes]] [[Category:Healthy Salads]] [[Category:Kidney bean Recipes]] [[Category:Low-fat Recipes]] [[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Corn chip Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]]

== Ingredients ==
* 1 1/2 lbs [[Tuna]] [[Steak]] * 1/2 cup fish marinade * 2 tbsp lowfat plain [[yogurt]] * 2 tbsp low fat [[Mayonnaise]] * 2 tbsp [[Onion]], chopped fine * 1/2 [[lemon]], juice only, per serving of fish * 2 cloves caramelized [[garlic]] * 1 tbsp sweet pickle relish per serving of fish * 2 [[plum tomato]]es, seeded and chopped
== Directions == Marinate [[Tuna]] for an hour in the refrigerator. Preheat the grill. Grill the [[Tuna]] on high for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Lower the heat and cook until [[Tuna]] reaches the desired doneness. Remove the [[Tuna]] and allow to cool slightly. Slice, then toss with [[yogurt]], [[Mayonnaise]], [[Onion]], [[lemon]],[[garlic]],relish, and [[tomato]]es. Serve open0faced on toasted bread or with salad greens. Nutritional Information Calories 300, Protein 39g, Fat 6 g, Sat Fat 1.5g, Cholesterol 23mg, Fiber 1g, Sodium 470mg Temperature: grill high, then low From the cookbook of George Hirsch "Living It Up"
[[Category:Healthy Appetizers]] [[Category:Healthy Salads]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tuna Recipes]]

page.title: Hearty Roast Beef, Pear and Pea Pod Salad

revision.comment: /* Ingredients */clean up, typos fixed: italian → Italian, california → California
revision.text:
==Ingredients== * 1 [[iceberg lettuce|head lettuce]] * 10 oz roast [[Beef]] * 2 [[carrot]] * 3 fresh California bartlett pe * 1 small [[red onion]] * 10 oz fresh [[Snow pea|Chinese pea pods]] * 1/4 cup pitted black olive * 8 oz low calorie Italian salad dr * 2 tsp dijon [[mustard]]
== Directions == # On serving platter or individual plates, arrange [[lettuce]] leaves. # Place remaining salad ingredients on top. # In small bowl, combine vinaigrette ingredients and drizzle over salad. [[mustard]] Vinaigrette: Mix low-calories Italian [[salad dressing]] with Dijon-style [[mustard]].
Note: To keep fruit colors bright, dip [[Pear]] slices in [[mustard]] Vinaigrette as you cut them, or cut [[Pear]]s just before serving.
[[Category:Beef Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Main Dishes]] [[Category:Healthy Salads]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Pear Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Snow pea Recipes]]

== Description == Korean cucumber salad. Serves six people. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 large green [[cucumber]]s * 3 teaspoons coarse [[salt]] * 1 cup water * 2 tablespoons mild [[vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * ¼ teaspoon [[cayenne]] pepper * 1 clove [[garlic]], finely chopped * 1 [[green onions|spring onion]], finely chopped * 3 teaspoons toasted, crushed [[sesame seed]]s
== Directions == # Peel cucumbers thinly and cut across into thin slices. # Put in a bowl, sprinkle with salt and add water. # Soak for 15 minutes, then drain off all liquid. # Combine other ingredients, pour over cucumbers. # Mix well and serve chilled.

[[Image:Broccoli and Cauliflower Salad.jpg|right|thumb]] == Ingredients == * 1 cup raw [[Cauliflower]], very finely chopped * 1 cup raw [[Broccoli]] heads, very finely chopped * 2 [[celery]] stalks, very finely chopped * 2 tsp Spanish [[Onion]], finely chopped * 1/8 tsp [[garlic powder]] * 1/8 tsp [[Onion]] powder * 1/4 tsp vegit or salt-free seasoning (optional) * braggs all purpose seasoning, or [[sea salt]] to taste * 1 tsp [[fructose|fruit sugar]] * 1 tbsp good health [[Mayonnaise]]
== Directions == Mix the ingredients together, and enjoy.
Recipe reprinted with permission from HealthRecipes.com

This recipe comes from an Estate Sale and were obtained when ''The Family Collection'' from The Wetzel Estate in Plano, Texas was purchased in 1982. Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 4 Cups [[chicken]], cooked and diced * 2 Cups [[celery]], diced * 12 [[egg]]s, hard-boiled and cut up * 1 Cup [[slivered almond]]s * 1 Quart [[mayonnaise]] * 1 Small package [[potato]] chips
== Directions == # Mix all ingredients together except chips # Place in casserole dish # Crush chips and sprinkle over mixture # Bake at 350 °F for 30 minutes
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]]

__NOTOC__
== Description == This recipe comes from an Estate Sale and were obtained when ''The Family Collection'' from The Wetzel Estate in Plano, Texas was purchased in 1982. Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 Pounds raw [[beet]]s
=== Dressing === * 1 Cup [[water]] * 1 Tablespoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 2 Teaspoons [[cider vinegar|apple cider vinegar]] * ½ Teaspoon [[cinnamon]] * 1 Teaspoon grated [[horseradish root|horseradish]] * 1 Pinch [[allspice]] * 1 Pinch ground [[cloves]]
== Directions == # Place beets in a pot with enough [[water]] to cover them # Bring to a boil and simmer for 3 hours. # Cool beets under cold running [[water]] # Peel off skin and slice or dice to your preference. # Bring 1 cup of water to a boil # Stir in [[vinegar]] and spices and pour hot mixture over beets. # Let cool. # Cover and refrigerate. # Serve Cold.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Beet Recipes]]

==Ingredients== * 3/4 lb smoked [[Turkey]] breast cut into 1/4-inch cubes * 3/4 lb [[cantaloupe]] cut into cubes or balls * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1/2 cup thinly sliced [[green onions|green onion]] * 2 tbsp chutney chopped * 1 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 1 tbsp [[white wine vinegar]] * 1/2 tbsp [[sesame oil]] * 1/2 tbsp dijon-style [[mustard]] * 1/2 tbsp reduced-sodium soy sauce * 1/8 tsp [[red pepper flakes]] * 1 clove minced [[garlic]]
== Directions == # In large bowl combine [[Turkey]], [[cantaloupe]], [[celery]] and [[green onions]]. # In small bowl whisk chutney, [[oil]], [[vinegar]], [[sesame oil]], [[mustard]], soy sauce, [[red pepper flakes]] and [[garlic]]. # Combine dressing with [[Turkey]]/[[cantaloupe]] mixture. Mix well. # Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour.
Recipe by The National [[Turkey]] Federation.
[[Category:Cantaloupe Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Salads]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. It was obtained when the family collection was purchased from the Burnett Estate in Terrell, Texas in 1981.
== Ingredients == * 1 large [[cabbage]], chopped fine * ½ [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * 1 white [[onion]] * 1 small jar [[pimento]] * 1 tablespoon [[mustard seed]] * 1 tablespoon [[salt]] * 1½ cups [[vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[celery seed]] * 2 cups [[granulated sugar|sugar]]
== Directions == # Combine [[cabbage]], [[pepper]] and [[onion]], then set aside. # Mix together pimento, [[mustard seed]], [[salt]], [[vinegar]], [[celery seed]] and [[granulated sugar|sugar]]. # Mix with vegetable mixture and pack into jars. # Store in refrigerator at least 24 hours. # Serve cold.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

Mozzarella Tomato is a simple appetizer or side dish that works with any Italian meal and takes almost no time to make. Since this recipe involves only a few ingredients, it is very important to have each ingredients in high quality.
== Ingredients == * Fresh [[tomatoes]] * [[Mozarella]] cheese * [[Olive oil]] * [[Balsamic vinegar]] * [[Basil]] * [[Black pepper]] (optional)
== Method == Start by slicing extremely fresh and ripe tomatoes. Thickness of the tomatoes is according to personal opinion, yet most commonly thick slices are more tasty. Then, slice round pieces of fresh mozzarella cheese usually a little thinner than your tomatoes. Lay mozzarella and tomato slices in a repeating pattern (cheese, tomato, cheese, tomato) overlapping each other. Drizzle the top with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Finish by sprinkling the top with basil. Season with black pepper if desired.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Side Dish Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Salads]] [[Category:Appetizer Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Appetizers]]

==Description== This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Shelton Estate in Arlington, Texas in 1992. == Ingredients == * 2 medium [[tomato]]es sliced * 1/2 cup [[olive oil]] * 3 tablespoons dried [[oregano]] leaves * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon [[pepper]] * 1/4 teaspoon dry [[mustard]] * 1 clove [[garlic]] crushed * [[Lettuce]] leaves * 4 green [[onion]]s finely chopped * 1 tablespoon snipped [[parsley]]
== Directions == # Arrange tomatoes in square glass baking dish. # Shake oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, pepper, mustard and garlic in tightly covered jar. # Pour over tomatoes then cover and refrigerate spooning dressing over tomatoes occasionally. # Chill 2 hours then arrange tomatoes on lettuce leaves and sprinkle with onions and parsley. # Drizzle with dressing.
=Contributed by :== * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]]

It serves 6 people. To serve, layer half the [[lettuce]], [[cilantro]] and drained [[tomato]]es in a serving bowl, then repeat layers.
== Ingredients == * 3/4 cup [[cider vinegar]] * 1 1/2 teaspoons [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 2 teaspoons [[coarse salt]] * 1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 1/2 cup ketchup * 3 tablespoons [[water]] * 1 1/2 teaspoons [[worcestershire sauce]] * 1 1/2 tablespoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * 1/2 cup [[olive oil]] * 4 1/2 tablespoons [[coriander seed]]s; coarsely cracked * 12 small Red ripe [[tomato]]es, peeled * 1 head [[romaine lettuce]]; cut crosswise into 1/2-inch strips * 1 cup fresh [[cilantro]] sprigs
== Directions == # In deep bowl, whisk together [[vinegar]], [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], [[salt]], [[pepper]], ketchup, [[water]], [[worcestershire sauce]], [[lemon juice]], [[olive oil]] and [[coriander seed]]s. # Prick each [[tomato]] with a fork in 3 or 4 places. # Submerge [[tomato]]es in the vinaigrette and marinate overnight in refrigerator.
[[Category:Guatemalan Recipes]] [[Category:Guatemalan Vegetarian]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Side Dish Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients ==
* 10 oz (1) pkg brussel sprouts * 16 oz (1) can canned [[carrot]]s '''or''' 5 med [[carrot]]s, sliced and cooked * 1/2 cup lemon shaker dressing
== Directions ==
# Cook [[brussels sprouts]] according to package directions until they are crisp but tender; drain. # Drain [[carrot]]s and put them in a bowl # add [[Brussels sprouts]] and [[lemon]] shaker dressing; mix well. # Cover and refrigerate 4–6 hours before using; stir occasionally.
== Nutritional information == Food exchange per serving: 2 vegetable exchanges; calories: 49; cho: 11g; pro: 3g; sod: 273 mg; cho: 0 mg; low-sodium diets: omit [[salt]] in cooking [[Brussels sprouts]] and from [[lemon]] shaker dressing.
[[Category:Brussels sprout Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]
[[Category:Healthy Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == This variation of taco salad was shown to me many years ago by my old friend's girlfriend. We used to eat it a lot at our parties, since it feeds up to 6 people. For fewer servings, just cut down on the amount of each ingredient.
== Ingredients == * 1 pound [[ground beef]] or [[ground turkey|turkey]] * 1 package of [[taco seasoning]] * 1 can of [[kidney beans]] * 1 small can of [[tomato sauce]] * 1 head of [[lettuce]] * 1 bag of shredded [[cheese]] * 1 bag of Doritos chips * 1 bottle of Catalina [[salad dressing]]
== Directions == # Cook and drain the ground beef or turkey and return to skillet # Add taco seasoning to the ground beef or turkey and stir # Add kidney beans and tomato sauce to the seasoned ground beef or turkey and stir # Remove the core from the head of lettuce # Tear lettuce into bite-sized pieces and place in a very large bowl # Break Doritos into bite-sized pieces and add to the bowl of lettuce # Pour the bag of shredded cheese into the bowl and mix the contents briefly # Pour the contents of the skillet into the bowl and stir # Finally, pour the Catalina salad dressing into the bowl and stir # Serve on plates or in salad bowls
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Kidney bean Recipes]] [[Category:Ground beef Recipes]] [[Category:Ground turkey Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Meat Recipes]]

== Description == [http://www.scda.state.sc.us/recipes/poultry.htm Poultry Recipes] by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 6-8
== Ingredients == * 1 x 10 ounce can [[chicken broth]] * ½ cup uncooked [[rice]] * 6 oz banana [[yogurt]] * ¼ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1½ tablespoons [[honey]] * 2 cans (6 oz) chopped [[chicken]] * ½ cup [[cantaloupe]], diced * ½ cup [[honeydew melon|honeydew]], diced * ½ cup [[strawberry|strawberries]], diced
== Directions == # Boil chicken broth, add rice and cook until tender and fluffy. # In small jar, combine honey, yogurt and mayonnaise. Refrigerate 30 minutes to 24 hours to intensify flavor. # When ready to serve, combine chicken, rice, fruits and dressing. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves with crisp [[cracker]]s or in toasted [[pita]] pockets.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__

“[[Rice]] to the Rescue!” Recipe Contest Winner - Corinne Portteus * Yield: Makes 6 servings.
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[medium-grain rice]] * 2 cups frozen peeled, de-veined cooked [[shrimp]], thawed * 1 cup (cut in half) [[snow peas]], blanched * ½ cup thinly sliced [[green onions]] * ½ cup julienned red [[bell pepper]] strips * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * ¼ cup [[peanut oil]] * ¾ cup oriental-flavored dressing
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[shrimp]], [[snow peas]], [[green onions|green onion]], [[bell pepper]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] in a large bowl. # Add [[oil]] and toss until mixture is evenly coated. # Drizzle dressing over salad and toss gently.

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == . === Ingredients === * 6 tablespoons chopped prepared [[mango]] chutney * 1/4 cup nonfat plain [[yogurt]] * 1/4 cup nonfat [[Mayonnaise]] dressing * 2 tablespoons [[lime juice]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]], to taste * [[butter]] [[lettuce]] leaves * 8 ounces sliced, cooked, skinless [[Turkey]] breast * 2 pint baskets California [[strawberries]], stemmed and halved * 1 cup red seedless [[grapes]] * 3/4 cup sliced [[celery]] * 1/2 cup chopped [[red onion]] * [[mint]] sprigs, for garnish * * == Directions == In small bowl whisk chutney, [[yogurt]], [[Mayonnaise]] and [[lime juice]]; season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. Line platter or 4 individual serving plates with [[lettuce]]; top with [[Turkey]], [[strawberries]], [[grapes]], [[celery]] and [[Onion]]. Drizzle with chutney dressing; garnish with [[mint]] sprigs. Makes 4 servings

__NOTOC__ == Description == Here is an easy salad recipe you can prepare for your family or take to your next family get-together. * Contributed by Paula in California at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * ½ [[onion]], chopped * 3 [[tomato]]es * 1 head [[lettuce]] * 4 oz [[cheese]], grated * 8 oz [[Thousand Island dressing]] * [[Taco sauce]] to taste * 1 bag [[tortilla chips]] * 1 large [[avocado]], opt. * 1 lb [[ground beef]] * 1 can [[kidney bean]]s * ¼ tsp [[salt]]
== Directions == # Chop onion, tomatoes, and lettuce. # Toss with cheese, dressing and taco sauce. # Crunch and add chips. # Brown meat, add kidney beans, salt and simmer 10 minutes and mix into cold salad. # Serve immediately (or prepare ahead of time and add cheese and chips right before serving).

__NOTOC__ == Description == Here is an easy salad recipe you can prepare for your family or take to your next family get-together. Keep an open mind about this Broccoli Salad recipe and give it a try. It is delicious! * Contributed by Paula in California at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 bunch [[broccoli]], cut in tiny flowers * 1 cup [[raisins]] * ¼ cup [[red onion]] * ¼ cup [[pecan]]s (or [[walnut]]s, or [[sunflower seeds]]) * ¼ cup [[bacon]] bits * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * ½ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * ¼ cup [[vinegar]]
== Directions == # Mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar. # Add bacon bits and other ingredients and mix. # Chill for a few hours.

== Directions == # Keep peas frozen until ready to use. # Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. # Chill and serve.

I like to serve this as a main dish for lunch and garnish the plate with tomato wedges, pickle slices and a good French or Italian bread. Chill for at least 12 hours to get best results. Enjoy!
Contributed by Joyce at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[chicken]] diced * 1 can [[mandarin orange]]s drained * 1 cup green seedless [[grapes]] * 1 cup while seedless grapes * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * ½ cup [[whipped cream]] * 1 cup chopped [[nuts]]
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Toss till mixed well. # In a separate bowl combine mayonnaise and whipped cream and mix into salad. # Serve with greens or plain.
[[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Grape Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Nut Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:World Recipes]]

== Description ==
The number of servings will vary depending on the size of the [[avocado]]s & [[mango]]s. This can be served as an appetizer or a side dish for a great BBQ - Try it with [[Chicken]] kebobs.
[[Image:BBQ Mango & Avocado Skewers.jpg|thumb|BBQ Mango & Avocado Skewers]]
=== Ingredients ===
== Dressing/Dipping Sauce ==
* 1/2 cup [[salad dressing]] * 1/2 cup smooth [[Peanut butter]] * 1/2 cup [[chicken broth]] * 1/4 cup [[Honey]] * 1/4 cup light [[soy sauce]] * 1/4 teaspoon [[garlic powder]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[Tabasco sauce]] * 4 [[avocado]]s, peeled,pitted and cut into 1 inch chunks * 3 mangoes, peeled,pitted and cut into 1 inch chunks * skewers
== Directions ==
# Soak wooden skewers for 1 hour in [[water]]. # Mix together the [[salad dressing]], [[Peanut butter]], broth, [[Honey]], soy, [[garlic]]& [[Tabasco sauce|Tabasco]], stir well # Thread [[avocado]] & [[mango]] alternately on the skewers # Baste with the sauce # BBQ over medium heat for apprx 4 minutes per side # Serve with remaining sauce on the side
[[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Indonesian Appetizers]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Peanut butter Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * 1 medium [[onion]], chopped * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * 1 tablespoon [[butter]] or [[margarine]] * 1 cup uncooked [[rice]] * ⅛ teaspoon ground [[saffron]] * 1¾ to 2 cups [[chicken broth]] * 2 tablespoons chopped fresh [[parsley]] * == Directions == # Cook [[onion]] and [[garlic]] in [[margarine]] in 2- to 3-quart saucepan until soft. # Add [[rice]] and [[saffron]]; stir 2 to 3 minutes. # Add broth and bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer; cover and cook 15 to 20 minutes or until [[rice]] is tender and liquid is absorbed. # Add [[parsley]] and fluff with fork.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Saffron Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * 2 tablespoons [[white wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[olive oil]] * 2 to 3 drops [[hot sauce|hot pepper sauce]] (optional) * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * ¼ teaspoon ground [[white pepper]] * 2½ cups cooked [[rice]] (cooked in [[chicken broth]] and ⅛ teaspoon [[saffron]]), cooled to room temperature * ½ cup diced [[red bell pepper]] * ½ cup diced [[green bell pepper]] * ¼ cup sliced [[green onions]] * ¼ cup sliced [[black olive]]s * [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Combine [[vinegar]], [[oil]], pepper sauce (if desired), [[garlic]] and [[white pepper]] in large bowl; mix well. # Add [[rice]], [[peppers]], [[onion]]s and ; toss lightly. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves.
[[Category:Bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Saffron Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings.
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] (cooked in [[chicken broth]] and [[saffron]]) * 1 pound flaked [[crab]] * ½ cup diced [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * ⅓ cup sliced [[green onions]] * ⅓ cup sliced [[black olive|ripe olives]] * ⅓ cup prepared Italian [[salad dressing|dressing]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[white pepper]]
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[crab]], [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], [[onion]]s and . # Combine dressing and [[white pepper]]. Pour over [[rice]] mixture. Toss lightly.

Toss lightly. # Serve on salad greens and garnish with [[tomato]] wedges, if desired.

== Ingredients == * 4 [[chicken breasts]] * 8 oz [[cream cheese]], softened * 4 stalks [[celery]], finely chopped * 1 tbsp [[pimento]], finely chopped * 1 small [[green bell pepper]], finely chopped * 1 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste * Dried [[parsley]], optional
== Directions == # Boil [[chicken]] until tender, then chop into small pieces. # Combine [[chicken]] and [[cream cheese]]; mix until smooth. # Add other ingredients and chill.
