{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * 4 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, chopped * ½ cup finely chopped [[onion]] * ½ cup chopped sweet [[pickles]] * 1 x 2-ounce jar [[pimento]], diced (¼ cup) * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 teaspoon prepared [[mustard]] * [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Blend [[rice]], [[egg]]s, [[onion]], pickles, [[pimento]], [[salt]], [[pepper]], [[mayonnaise]] and [[mustard]]; chill. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves.
[[Category:Egg Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}}
== Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * ½ cup minced [[onion]] * ½ cup chopped sweet [[pickles]] * 1 x 2-ounce can chopped [[pimento]] * 4 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, chopped * ¾ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 teaspoon prepared [[mustard]] * [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[onion]], pickles, [[pimento]], [[egg]]s, [[salt]], [[pepper]], [[Mayonnaise]] and [[mustard]] in large bowl; toss lightly. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves.
[[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Mustard seed Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

revision.comment: Robot: Changing Category:Sardines and Pilchards Recipes
revision.text:
[[Image:mimosa1.jpg|right|250px|Fish Salad "Mimosa"]]
== Ingredients == * 1 tin of [[sardines]] * 1 jar of [[mayonnaise]] * 1 [[onion]] * 100 g of [[butter]] * 100 g of [[cheese]] * 5 hard-boiled [[egg]]s
== Directions == # Separate the whites and yolks of the hard-boiled [[egg]]s. # Grate the whites into the bowl. # Grate the [[cheese]] (the 2nd layer). # Put the tinned sardines on a plate and crush them with a fork until they get soft. # Divide the crushed sardines into two halves, and put a half into a bowl, making the third layer. # Cover it with half a jar of [[mayonnaise]]. # For the next layer grate the frozen [[butter]] into the bowl. # Chop the [[onion]]. # Put the chopped [[onion]] onto [[butter]]. # Then put the rest of the sardines, and cover with half a jar of [[mayonnaise]]. # Finish by grating the yolks onto the top of the salad. # Put into refrigerator and let it stay for half an hour.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sardines and pilchards Recipes]] [[Category:Seafood appetizer Recipes]] [[Category:Ukrainian Appetizers]]

revision.comment: /* Ingredients */clean up, replaced: [[cayenne pepper|red pepper]] → red pepper
revision.text:
==Description== Italian Style [[Eggplant]] Appetizer. Very versatile. It's equally good served warm or at room temperature with crusty [[Italian bread]], as well as hot over [[Pasta]] or chilled as a salad.
== Ingredients == * [[olive oil]] * 2 large [[Eggplant]]s or 4 small [[Eggplant]]s, small dice * 1 large red pepper, small dice * 1 medium [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], small dice * 2 medium [[red onion]]s, small dice * 3 tablespoons [[garlic]], chopped * 4 tablespoons [[capers]], divided (2 Tablespoos chopped, 2 Tablespoons whole) * 6 anchovy fillets, minced (optional) * 1 cup balsamic vinaigrette [[salad dressing]] * 3/4 cup [[brown sugar]] * 3/4 cup [[tomato]] puree * 1 bunch [[basil]], chiffonade (means finely chopped) * 2 tablespoons [[oregano]], chopped * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] * 1/2 cup [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 cup pitted [[green olive]]s (Usually come in a jar stuffed with pimentos)
== Directions == # Heat about 1/4 inch of [[oil]] in a large saute pan (as the [[Eggplant]] will soak it up). # Brown the [[Eggplant]] in the [[oil]] in small batches. # Set aside in a stainless steel bowl. # NOTE: the [[Eggplant]] is usually cooked with the skin on it adds color to the dish, however if you find the skin to be particularly tough or stringy you can peel the [[Eggplant]] and cook it skinned. # Heat more [[oil]]. # Saute [[peppers]] until soft. # Add sauteed [[peppers]] to bowl with the [[Eggplant]]. # Cook [[onion]]s and [[garlic]] until [[onion]]s are tender. # Add [[brown sugar]] and [[vinegar]] and cook 2 minutes more. # Add [[tomato]] puree and [[green olive]]s and cook until you have a thick, brown sweet-and-sour sauce. # Pour sauce over [[Eggplant]] and [[peppers]] and toss to coat. # Add [[capers]], [[Anchovy|Anchovies]] and herbs, and mix well. # Adjust seasonings to taste. # Serve warm or at room temperature with slices of crusty [[Italian bread]]. # Also excellent served hot on top of [[Pasta]] or chilled and served as a salad.
[[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Appetizers]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sauce Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian appetizer Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Desciption == This Recipe Came From an Estate Sale from The Steep Estate in Elmo, Texas in 1989.
== Ingredients == * 1 dozen hard boiled [[egg]]s * 2 teaspoons prepared [[mustard]] * ¼ cup grated [[red onion]] * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon [[milk]]
== Directions == # Finely chop [[egg]]s # Add remaining ingredients. # Mix well and chill at least three hours before serving.
== contributed by == * [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Egg Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lunch Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ {{wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Contributed by Jenn b aka Mom2sam and Tiny at [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/World_Recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups mixed [[greens]] * ¼ cup [[feta]] cheese * ½ cup [[chickpeas|garbonzo beans]] * ¼ cup [[black olive]]s * ¼ cup sliced [[cucumber]]s * ⅛ cup sliced [[red onion]]s * 2 tablspoons fresh [[oregano]] * 2 tablespoons extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon fresh [[lemon juice]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] - to taste
== Directions == # Serve with [[pita]] bread, bagel [[chips]], or fresh [[bread]].
== Great Greek Salad Videos == <youtube>2IfEfrvrAwM</youtube>
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes with video instruction]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Seafood Recipes| Salad]]
[[Category:Pasta Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == . === Ingredients === * 1 cup uncooked, small, shell-shaped [[quinoa pasta]] or [[Wheat]] [[Pasta]] * 1/4 lb. [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] or [[snow peas]] * 1/4 lb. slender [[asparagus]], trimmed and cut on the diagonal * 1 large [[English cucumber]] * 3 cups mixed young [[greens|salad greens]] * 2 cups fresh [[strawberries]], hulled and thinly sliced * 1/2 cup vegan [[sour cream]] * 1 Tbs. [[olive oil]], or more if needed * 1 Tbs. [[water]] * 1 1/2 Tbs. [[lemon juice]] * Zest of 1 [[lemon]] * Seasoning [[salt]] to taste * 1 Tbs. [[granulated sugar]], or to taste * 4 large hard-boiled [[egg]]s, peeled and quartered == Directions == 1. Bring large pot of lightly salted [[water]] to a boil. Cook [[Pasta]] according to package directions, drain, rinse under cold [[water]], drain again and set aside.
2. Bring another large pot of lightly salted [[water]] to a boil, and blanch [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] for 1 minute. Remove from [[water]], and blanch [[asparagus]] for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, place [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] and
[[asparagus]] in cold [[water]], drain and set aside.
3. Slice [[cucumber]], and place slices in salad bowl. Rinse and dry salad greens, and place in salad bowl. Add [[strawberries]], cooled [[Pasta]] and vegetables.
4. To make dressing, beat together [[sour cream]], [[olive oil]], [[water]], [[lemon juice]], [[lemon]] zest, seasoning [[salt]] and [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]]. Spoon dressing over salad, and toss. Arrange quartered [[egg]]s over top, and serve.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:English cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Sugar snap Recipes]] [[Category:Quinoa pasta Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]] [[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Pasta Recipes]]

page.title: Mixed Vegetable Salad with Ginger Dressing

revision.comment: /* Ingredients */clean up, replaced: [[lemon juice|fresh lemon juice]] → fresh [[lemon juice]]
revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
=== Ingredients === * 2 cups peeled baby [[carrot]]s * 2 cups [[Cauliflower]] florets * 2 cups [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] * 1/2 cup freshly squeezed [[orange juice]] * 1 tsp. [[orange]] zest * 1 1/2 Tbs. fresh [[lemon juice]] * 1 tsp. [[lemon]] zest * 2 tsp. grated [[ginger|fresh ginger]], or more to taste * 1 tsp. [[salt]] * 1/2 tsp. freshly ground [[pepper]] * 3 Tbs. [[canola oil]] == Directions == 1. Place [[carrot]]s in 2 quarts boiling, salted [[water]], and cook until tender, about 6 minutes. Drain, and plunge into [[ice]] [[water]]. Repeat with [[Cauliflower]] florets, cooking for about 4 minutes, or until tender. Repeat with [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]], cooking for 30 seconds. Drain well, place in tightly sealed plastic bag and refrigerate.
2. Combine remaining ingredients in plastic container, and refrigerate.
3. To serve, shake dressing well, and add to bag of vegetables. Shake contents to mix, and place in serving bowl.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sugar snap Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * ½ head [[cauliflower]], cut into florets of uniform size * 1 small crown [[broccoli]], cut into florets of uniform size * 12 pre-peeled [[baby carrots]] * 3 oz [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]], optional * 3 oz [[snow pea sprouts|snow pea greens]], optional * 1 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[lemon juice]] * 1 large clove [[garlic]], minced * 2 tbsp [[olive oil]] * [[salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste * ½ bunch [[radishes]], stemmed, and thinly sliced * 3 [[scallions]], ends trimmed, all white and about 2 inches of green, thinly sliced * ½ bunch [[parsley]], minced
== Directions == # Bring a large pot of [[water]] to a boil, and blanch [[cauliflower]] for 2 minutes. # Drain well, and rinse [[cauliflower]] with cold [[water]]. # Refill pot, blot drained [[cauliflower]] dry and roll florets up in a paper towel. # Place in a plastic bag, and refrigerate. # Repeat procedure with [[broccoli]]. # Refill pot, and bring to a boil again. # Place [[snow pea]] greens in a colander, and set aside in kitchen sink. # Blanch [[carrot]]s, and pour [[carrot]] [[water]] over greens to wilt slightly. # Repeat cold water-blot-refrigerate treatment with [[carrot]]s, [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] and [[snow pea]] greens, if using. # Meanwhile, 1 hour before serving, combine [[mustard]], [[lemon juice]] and [[garlic]] in a large salad bowl. # Whisk in [[olive oil]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. # Put all blanched and raw vegetables in bowl. # Toss, season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]] again and serve.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sugar snap Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Snow pea sprout Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Parsley Recipes]]

'''[[:Category:salad dressing Recipes|Browse All salad dressing Recipes]]'''

[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sauce Recipes]] [[Category:Condiment Recipes]]

Makes 6 servings. == Ingredients == * 1 pound ground [[Beef]] * 1/2 [[Onion]], finely chopped * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/2 teaspoon ground [[cumin]] * 1/4 teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 3 cups cooked * 1/2 [[iceberg lettuce|head lettuce]], shredded * 2 [[tomato]]es, coarsely chopped * 1/2 cup grated [[Cheddar]] [[Cheese]] * 1 large [[avocado]], peeled, seeded and diced * 1/4 cup [[sour cream]]
== Directions == # Brown meat over medium-high heat in large skillet, stirring to crumble. # Add [[Onion]] and [[garlic]]; cook until soft but not brown. Drain fat. # Add [[salt]], [[cumin]], [[pepper]] and [[rice]]. Remove from heat; cool. # Combine [[lettuce]], [[tomato]]es, [[Cheese]], [[avocado]] and [[rice]] mixture in large bowl. # Add [[sour cream]] and toss lightly. # Serve immediately with picante sauce and [[corn]] chips, if desired.
[[Category:Mexican Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Beef Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Meat Recipes]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lentil Recipes| Salads]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]]

If there is a modern favorite vegetable that you can use in salads it has to be Asparagus. This tasty and highly nutritious plant offers a perfect blend of taste, density and shape for any salad. Use it in strictly vegetarian dishes and salads or mix it up with fish or different dressings and sauces for an unforgettable taste.
[[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

Makes 6 servings. == Ingredients == * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] * 2 to 3 cups cooked roast [[Pork]] cubes* (about 3/4 pound) * 1 10-ounce package frozen [[garden pea|green peas]], thawed * 1 cup sliced [[celery]] * 1 4-ounce can sliced [[Mushroom]]s, drained * 1/4 cup chopped pimientos * 1/2 cup [[sour cream]] * 1/2 cup [[Mayonnaise]] * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon seasoned [[pepper]] * 2 teaspoons [[lemon juice]] * [[lettuce]] leaves * [[peach]] halves for garnish (optional)
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[Pork]], [[Peas]], [[celery]], [[Mushroom]]s and pimientos in large bowl. # Blend [[sour cream]], [[Mayonnaise]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]]; toss with [[rice]] mixture. Chill. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves; garnish with [[peach]] halves, if desired.
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Meat Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Peach Recipes]] [[Category:Pork Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

revision.comment: /* Ingredients */clean up, replaced: [[Salad Dressing|Salad dressing]] → [[salad dressing]]
revision.text:
Makes 6 servings. == Ingredients == * 1/4 cup [[Parmesan cheese]] * 1/4 cup Italian-style breadcrumbs * 2 boneless skinless [[Chicken]] breasts, halved and thinly sliced * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * 6 cups torn [[spinach]] leaves * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] (cooked in [[chicken broth]]) cooled * 1 pound [[asparagus]] pieces, blanched and cut into 1-inch pieces * 2 [[plum tomato]]es, sliced * 1/2 cup sliced [[red onion]] * 1/3 cup [[walnuts]], toasted * 2 tablespoons chopped fresh [[basil]] * 2/3 cup prepared vinaigrette [[salad dressing]]
== Directions == # Combine [[Cheese]] and breadcrumbs in medium bowl. # Coat each [[Chicken]] breast with breadcrumb mixture. # Heat [[olive oil]] in skillet over medium-high heat until hot. # Add [[Chicken]]; cook and stir about 5 minutes until brown. # Remove [[Chicken]]; place in large bowl. # Add [[spinach]], [[rice]], [[asparagus]], [[tomato]]es, [[Onion]], [[walnuts]] and [[basil]]; toss well. # Just before serving pour dressing over salad; toss to coat.
[[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Salads]] [[Category:Main Dish Poultry Recipes]] [[Category:Main Dish Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 pound fresh [[green bean]]s * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon [[lemon juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[sesame seed]]s, toasted * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[red pepper flakes|crushed red pepper]] flakes <ref>If you don't want to use the pepper flakes, eliminate them, and increase the pepper to ½ tsp. Freshly ground pepper is really nice.</ref> * ⅛ teaspoon [[pepper]]
== Directions == # In a saucepan, cover beans with water, cook until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse in cold water; place in a serving bowl. # Sprinkle with remaining ingredients; toss to coat. # Serve at room temperature.
== Notes == <references/>
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * 2 cups (8 ounces) [[crab]] meat * 1 cup frozen [[peas]], thawed * 1 cup sliced [[celery]] * ¼ cup sliced [[green onion]]s * ⅓ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ⅓ cup [[sour cream]] * 3 tablespoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[white pepper]] * [[lettuce]] leaves * ½ cup [[sliced almonds]], toasted
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], crab meat, [[peas]] and [[green onions]] in large mixing bowl. # Blend [[mayonnaise]], [[sour cream]], [[lemon juice]] and [[white pepper]]. # Add to [[rice]] mixture; toss lightly. # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves. # Garnish with [[almond]]s.
[[Category:Crab Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
[[File:398106665.jpg|thumb| American Sub Salad]] jSub Salad Mix
=== Ingredients === * 8 ounces Hard [[Salami]], diced * 8 ounces [[pepperoni]], diced * 8 ounces of Any Kind of [[Ham]] ( Cooked or Imported etc. ) diced * 4 ounces [[American]] Cheese, diced * 4 ounces [[Provolone]] Cheese, diced * 2 medium [[tomato]]es, [[Diced|Chopped]] * 1 medium Red [[Onion]], Chopped * 1 green [[Pepper]], Chopped * 1/2 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[garlic salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon dried [[oregano]] * I [[bread]] bowl (optional) * French bread slices (optional) * 1 (8 ounces) bottle Italian dressing (optional if not using the mayonnaise and olive oil mix)
Directions In a 2-1/2-qt. serving bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, oil, garlic salt and oregano. Pour over meat mixture and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate until serving. Serve with French bread if desired. Yield: 8-10 servings.
Nutrition Facts: 1 serving (3/4 cup) equals 395 calories, 34 g fat (12 g saturated fat), 72 mg cholesterol, 1,489 mg sodium, 4 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 20 g protein.
== See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Although I haven't tried this recipe, I thought it would be a good recipe to try to make my own dressing and possibly add some other spices. [[File:Amish Salad Dressing.jpg|thumb|Amish Salad Dressing]] === Ingredients === * 3/4 cup [[oil]] * 1 [[egg]] * 1 1/2 teaspoons prepared [[mustard]] * 2 teaspoons [[salt]] * 1/3 cup [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 1/2 cup [[flour]], plus * 2 1/2 tablespoons [[flour]] * 1 1/3 cups [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 1/3 cup [[vinegar]] * 1 cup [[water]] == Directions == Mix thoroughly the [[oil]], [[egg]], [[mustard]], [[salt]] and 1/3 cup [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]].
Set aside.
Over low heat blend [[flour]], 1/3 cup [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], [[vinegar]] and [[water]].
Bring to boil, stirring constantly until thickened.
Combine well with first mixture. === Other Links === == See also == [[Category:Mustard seed Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss Salads]]

page.title: Aromatic Rice Salad with Mango Chutney

revision.text:
== Description == Makes 8 servings.
=== Ingredients === * 2 [[mango]]s, peeled and diced * 1/2 cup [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 1/4 cup [[red wine]] * 2 tablespoons [[white wine vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons diced [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * 1 tablespoon minced [[ginger|fresh ginger]] * 1 1/2 teaspoons [[ginger|ground ginger]] * 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves * 3 cups cooked aromatic [[rice]] * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1/4 cup [[lemon juice]] * 4 [[green onions]], sliced * 1 tablespoon grated [[orange peel]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/2 teaspoon cracked [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Combine [[mango]]s, [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], [[red wine]], [[vinegar]], [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], [[ginger]] and cloves in medium saucepan. # Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat. # Combine [[rice]], [[celery]], [[lemon juice]], [[onion]]s, [[orange peel]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] in large mixing bowl; toss to combine. # To serve, spoon 1/2 cup [[rice]] salad onto serving plate. # Top each serving with 2 tablespoons chutney.
== See also ==
[[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Orange peel Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:White vinegar Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
== Ingredients == * 2 [[Asian pear]]s, peeled, cored and chopped * ½ [[shallot]], minced * 1¼ teaspoons diced fresh [[ginger]] * 1 cup [[water]] * ½ [[vanilla bean]] stick, scored in half * 1½ tablespoons [[sherry vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[mirin]] * 1 ounce [[soybean oil]] * [[salt]] * [[black pepper]] * ¼ pound [[greens|baby greens]] * ½ [[carrot]], shredded (optional)
== Directions == # In a 250 g [[saucepan]], cook [[pear]]s with [[shallot]], [[ginger]] and [[water]] over medium heat until soft. # Strain and set aside to cool. # Once at room temperature, puree one of the [[pear]]s and strain through a sieve. # Remove the seeds from the vanilla bean and mix them into the puree. # Discard the pod. # Add the [[sherry vinegar]] and [[mirin]] and process in a blender or food processor. # Slowly add the [[oil]] to emulsify. # Season with the [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. # Dice the remaining [[pear]] for garnish. # To serve, toss the baby greens well with the [[pear]] mixture. # Divide among 4 serving plates and garnish with the shredded carrot (if using) and the diced [[pear]].
[[Category:Asian pear Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:South Beach Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 8 servings. === Ingredients === * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] * 1 1/2 to 2 cups cooked [[Chicken]] cubes * 1 cup sliced [[celery]] * 1/2 cup diced cooked [[Ham]] * 1/4 cup sliced [[black olive|ripe olives]] * 1 tablespoon minced [[Onion]] * 3/4 to 1 cup [[Mayonnaise]] * 4 avocados * 2 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * [[Mayonnaise]] (optional) * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], [[Chicken]], [[celery]], [[Ham]], [[Onion]] and [[Mayonnaise]] in large bowl; toss lightly. Chill. Cut avocados in half, seed, and peel; brush with [[lemon juice]]. Spoon salad into [[avocado]] halves. Top with [[Mayonnaise]], if desired. === Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Ham Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Baby Spinach Salad with Tomato and Mozzarella

revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
=== Ingredients ===
* 5 ounces baby [[spinach]] leaves * 1 beefsteak [[tomato]], cut thinly crosswise * 1/2 cup fresh [[basil]] leaves, cut into thin strips * 1/4 pound part-skim [[mozzarella]], diced * 2 teaspoons fresh [[oregano]], chopped fine * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 2 teaspoons [[balsamic vinegar]] * [[kosher salt]] and ground [[black pepper]] to taste
== Directions ==
Alternately put layers of [[spinach]] and [[tomato]] across plate. Top it with [[basil]], [[mozzarella]], and [[oregano]]. Dress it with [[oil]] and [[vinegar]]. Season it to taste with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. Serve.
=== Other Links ===
== See also ==
[[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Kosher salt Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]] [[Category:Oregano Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:South Beach Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings. === Ingredients === * 1/2 cup canned [[coconut milk]] * 1/4 cup [[rice vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[oil]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 3 tablespoons chopped [[basil]], plus additional [[basil]] leaves for garnish * 3 cups cooked U.S. jasmine or medium [[cereals|grain]] [[rice]] * 1 pound frozen cooked [[Shrimp]], peeled, deveined, thawed * 1/2 cup chopped salted [[peanut]]s * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Whisk [[milk]], [[vinegar]] and [[oil]] together in a small bowl. Add [[salt]] and [[basil]]; set aside. Stir [[rice]], [[Shrimp]] and [[coconut milk]] mixture in medium bowl until blended. Spoon into serving bowl; sprinkle with [[peanut]]s and [[basil]] to garnish. === Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Cereals Recipes]] [[Category:Coconut milk Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Rice vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Shrimp Recipes]] [[Category:Thai Recipes]] [[Category:Thai Salads]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings. === Ingredients === * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[cider vinegar]] * 2 teaspoons chopped fresh [[basil]] leaves* * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 3 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * 2 medium [[tomato]]es, chopped * 1 medium [[cucumber]], peeled, seeded and chopped * 1 small [[red onion]], chopped * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Whisk together [[oil]], [[vinegar]], [[basil]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] in large bowl. Add [[rice]], [[tomato]]es, [[cucumber]] and [[Onion]]; toss. Serve chilled.
=== Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Cider vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Belgian Endive Apple and Almond Salad

revision.text:
[[File:Apple-almond-endive-salad-ck-l.jpg|right|link=|300px]] == Description == A nice tasting sweet [[Apple]] & [[almond]] salad for any hour of the day ! == Ingredients == 2 x Tart green [[Apple]]s, peeled, Cut into 1/2 inch cubes
3 x [[Belgian endive]]s, thinly Sliced crosswise
2 tbl [[almond]]s, peeled and shelled
Dressing:
4 teaspoons [[oil]]
1 T [[lemon juice]]
1 t minced [[garlic]]
1/4 t [[salt]]

== Directions == Mix [[Apple]], endives and [[almond]]s together in a bowl. Mix the dressing and pour on salad. Toss thoroughly and serve. Makes 6 servings. [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian Salads]] [[Category:Belgian endive Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian endive Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 4 servings.
=== Ingredients === * 2/3 cup [[vegetable oil]] * 2/3 cup [[white wine vinegar]] * 2 cloves [[garlic]], crushed * 1 tablespoon [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 1 teaspoon [[oregano]] leaves, crushed * 1/2 teaspoon [[thyme]] leaves, crushed * 1/4 teaspoon[[hot pepper sauce]]* * [[salt]] to taste (optional) * 2 cups fresh [[Mushroom]]s, sliced * 2 cups cooked [[rice]] * 2 cups (8 ounces) diced [[Swiss cheese]] * [[lettuce]] leaves * 16 [[cherry tomato]]es, cut in half * 1/2 cup [[walnuts]], chopped and toasted** * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Combine [[oil]], [[vinegar]], [[garlic]], [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], [[oregano]], [[thyme]], [[pepper]] sauce and [[salt]]. Add [[Mushroom]]s; marinate in refrigerator several hours. Drain dressing; reserve.
Combine [[Mushroom]]s, [[rice]] and [[Cheese]]. Spoon over [[lettuce]]; garnish with [[cherry tomato]]es. Sprinkle with [[walnuts]]. Serve with additional dressing, if desired.
=== Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Chile pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Oregano Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
[[Image:106108740.jpg|thumb| Bittersweet Salad Dressing]]
=== Ingredients === * 1 cup [[Mayonnaise]] (Miracle Whip would give it a sweeter taste) * 2 cups [[heavy cream|heavy whipping cream]] * 2 tablespoons [[vinegar]] (I use [[cider vinegar|apple cider vinegar]], but you could also use [[white vinegar]]; [[white vinegar]] gives it more of that)
== Directions == Put [[Mayonnaise]] into medium sized mixing bowl.
Pour [[heavy cream|heavy whipping cream]] into bowl with [[Mayonnaise]]; stir until well blended.
Stir in [[vinegar]] and season to taste.
=== Other Links ===
== See also ==
[[Category:Cider vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Finnish Recipes]] [[Category:Finnish Salads]] [[Category:Heavy cream Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:White vinegar Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 4 servings.
=== Ingredients === * 2 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled to room temperature * 1 cup cooked [[black beans]] * 1 cup chopped fresh [[tomato]] * 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded [[Cheddar]] [[Cheese]] (optional) * 1 tablespoon chopped fresh [[parsley]] * 1/4 cup prepared Italian dressing* * [[lettuce]] leaves * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], beans, [[tomato]], [[Cheese]] and [[parsley]] in large bowl. Pour dressing over [[rice]] mixture; toss lightly. Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves. === Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:Black bean Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings.
=== Ingredients === * 3 cups hot cooked [[rice]] * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1/4 cup chopped pimientos * 1 tablespoon grated [[Onion]] * 3 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, chopped * 1/4 cup chopped nut meats * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 1 cup [[sour cream]] * 1/4 cup crumbled bleu [[Cheese]] * 1 tablespoon [[lemon juice]] * 1/2 teaspoon seasoned [[salt]] (optional) * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], [[celery]], pimientos, [[Onion]], [[egg]]s, [[nuts]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]]; toss lightly. Blend [[sour cream]] with [[Cheese]], juice and seasoned [[salt]]. Fold into [[rice]] mixture. Turn into mold and chill thoroughly. Unmold before serving.
=== Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Something different for your next cookout
[[Image:bread salad.jpg|right|bread salad]]
=== Ingredients === * 1 loaf crusty bread, torn into bite size pieces * 2 lbs [[plum tomato]]es, cut into chunks * 1/4 cup chopped fresh [[basil]] === For the dressing === * 1/2 cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 cloves [[garlic]] * [[salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon dried [[rosemary]] * 1 dash [[red pepper flakes|hot pepper flakes]] * 4 tablespoons [[white wine vinegar]]
== Directions ==
* combine bread, [[tomato]]es and [[basil]] in large bowl. * in food processor with metal blade chop [[garlic]] and [[salt]] add [[rosemary]], [[red pepper flakes|hot pepper flakes]] and [[vinegar]]. * add [[olive oil]] in a dtream to emulsify * toss bread mixture and dressing * allow to stand for at least 20 minutes so the bread can absorb the dressing
=== Other Links ===
== See also ==
[[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Chile pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Salads]] [[Category:Rosemary Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]] [[Category:South African Recipes]] [[Category:South African Salads]]

revision.comment: /* Ingredients */clean up, replaced: [[corn Syrup|corn syrup]] → [[corn syrup]]
revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description ==
[[Image:408673328.jpg|thumb| Brown Beans]]
=== Ingredients ===
* 1 cups [[brown beans]], dried * 6 cups [[water]] * 1/2 cup [[white vinegar|white distilled vinegar]] * 1/2 cup [[corn syrup]], dark * 3 tablespoons [[brown sugar]], packed * 2 tablespoons [[butter]], melted * 1 [[cinnamon]] stick, small * 1 1/2 teaspoons [[salt]]
== Directions ==
* Pick over and rinse the beans. * Add the [[water]] and soak the beans at least 12 hours. * Bring the beans and soaking [[water]] to a boil. * Cover the pan and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. * Add the [[salt]], [[vinegar]], syrup, [[brown sugar]], [[butter]] and [[cinnamon]] stick. * Stir to mix. * Simmer, uncovered, for 1 hour. * If the liquid is not thickened, turn up the heat for 10 minutes. * Remove the [[cinnamon]] stick. * Serve hot.
== See also ==
[[Category:Brown sugar Recipes]] [[Category:Corn syrup Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Swedish Recipes]] [[Category:Swedish Salads]] [[Category:White vinegar Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings === Ingredients === * 3/4 cup [[vanilla]] lowfat [[yogurt]] * 1/2 cup reduced calorie [[Mayonnaise]] * 1/4 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/4 teaspoon ground [[cinnamon]] * 3 cups cooked [[brown rice]], cooled * 2 medium tart [[Apple]]s, cored and diced * 1 1/4 cups coarsely chopped [[celery]] * 1 medium [[carrot]], diced * 3/4 cup chopped [[walnuts]] * 3/4 cup [[Raisins]] * 6 boneless, skinless [[Chicken]] breast halves, grilled or broiled * Assorted fresh fruit for garnish (optional) * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Blend [[yogurt]], [[Mayonnaise]], [[salt]] and [[cinnamon]] in large bowl. Add [[rice]], [[Apple]]s, [[celery]], [[carrot]], [[walnuts]] and [[Raisins]]; mix well. Serve with grilled [[Chicken]] breasts. Garnish with fresh fruit. === Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Brown rice Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]]

== Description ==
This refreshing, cold, [[yogurt]] and [[cucumber]] salad is served with spicy dishes like kebap, as well as everyday Turkish cuisine, primarily in the summer months.
[[Image:Cacik.jpg|right|Cacik]]
=== Ingredients ===
* 1 Large [[cucumber]] * 1 clove of [[garlic]] * 3 cups of [[yogurt]] * 3 tbs olive [[oil]] * 1/2 cup [[water]] * 2 tbs fresh [[dill]] or 1 tbs dried [[dill]] flakes * 2 tbs fresh [[mint]] or 1 tbs dried [[mint]] flakes * [[salt]]
== Directions ==
Chop [[cucumber]] in small cubes. In a separate bowl mix [[yogurt]], [[garlic]], [[water]], [[dill]], [[mint]], [[oil]] and [[salt]]. Stir until mixture is consistency of thick soup. Add [[cucumber]]s and mix. Cover and place the bowl in refrigerator. Serve very cold in small individual bowls.
=== Other Links ===
== See also ==
[[Category:Clove Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Dill Recipes]] [[Category:Mint Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Turkish Recipes]] [[Category:Turkish Salads]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

revision.comment: clean up, replaced: [[chile pepper|hot pepper]] sauce → [[hot pepper sauce]] (2)
revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings. === Ingredients === * 1 cup uncooked [[rice]] * 2 cups [[water]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[curry]] powder * 1 medium [[tomato]], coarsely chopped * 1 medium [[carrot]], diced * 1/2 cup green [[bell pepper]], cut into thin strips * 1/2 cup red [[bell pepper]], cut into thin strips * 1/4 cup bottled [[oil]] and [[vinegar]] dressing * 1/4 teaspoon[[hot pepper sauce]] * 1/2 [[Onion]], sliced and separated into rings * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], [[water]] and [[curry]] powder in 2- to 3-quart saucepan. Bring to a boil; stir once or twice. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15 minutes or until [[rice]] is tender and liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Let [[rice]] cool.
Combine [[rice]] with [[tomato]], [[carrot]] and [[peppers]]. Blend dressing and[[hot pepper sauce]]. Pour over [[rice]] mixture. Toss lightly. Garnish with [[Onion]] rings.
=== Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Chile pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Curry Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == . === Ingredients === * 1 container (8 ounces) nonfat plain [[yogurt]] * 2 tablespoons thawed [[orange juice]] concentrate * 2 tablespoons chopped fresh [[basil]] or * 2 teaspoons dried [[basil]] leaves * 1 tablespoon honey * 1 small head [[iceberg lettuce]] cut into 8 wedges * 8 fresh [[apricots]], halved and pits removed * 1 pint basket fresh [[strawberries]] * 1 [[cantaloupe]], seeded, sliced and rind removed * 1/4 cup shelled and chopped natural pistachios == Directions == To make dressing, in bowl whisk [[yogurt]], [[orange juice]] concentrate, [[basil]] and honey. To assemble salad, on individual serving plates (or on platter) arrange remaining ingredients, dividing equally. Serve dressing on the side. Makes 4 servings === Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:Apricot Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Cantaloupe Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

page.title: Caribbean Roast Chicken and Avocado Salad

revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}}
[[File:Chicken-avocado.jpeg|right|300px|link=]] == Description ==
=== Ingredients ===
* 5 cups baby [[spinach]] leaves * 2 1/2 cups roast [[chicken]]s, shredded or cubed * 2 cups scallions, chopped very finely * 1/2 cup fresh [[cilantro]], chopped * 1 ripe [[avocado]], cubed * 1/2 [[lime]], zest of * 1 tablespoon fresh [[lime juice]] * 1 tablespoon virgin [[olive oil]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]]
== Directions ==
* Mix [[oil]], [[lime juice]], zest, [[salt]] and [[pepper]] in a bowl. * Right before serving time, put [[spinach]] leaves and scallions into a salad bowl. * Add [[oil]]/[[lime juice]] mixture over it. * Add [[Chicken]] and [[avocado]]. * Sprinkle [[cilantro]] over the top. * Toss lightly and serve.
=== Other Links ===
== See also == [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Caribbean Salads]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Lime Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Olive Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == This is a tasty summer recipe! Enjoy! [[File:Chicken-salad-ck-630133-l.jpg|right|300px|link=]] === Ingredients === * 1/2 cup Prepared honey [[mustard]] salad * 1 tbl [[lemon juice]] * 1/2 tsp Ground [[cinnamon]] * 1 dsh [[chile pepper|hot pepper]] sauce * 2 cup Diced cooked [[Chicken]] * 2 cup Cooked [[couscous]] * 1/2 cup Diced red [[bell pepper]] * 1/4 cup Thinly sliced [[green onions]] * 1/4 cup [[Raisins]] * 1 tbl Chopped fresh [[cilantro]] * [[salt]] * Ground [[pepper]] * Bibb or [[Boston lettuce]] leaves * 2 tbl Toasted [[almond#Sliced almonds|sliced almonds]] optional == Directions ==
* In salad bowl, whisk together dressing, [[lemon juice]], [[cinnamon]] and [[pepper]] sauce. * Add [[Chicken]], [[couscous]], red pepper, [[green onions]], [[Raisins]], [[cilantro]] and [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste. * Toss with dressing.
== See also == [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Bibb lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Chile pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Couscous Recipes]] [[Category:Mustard seed Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

revision.comment: /* Directions */clean up, typos fixed: didnt → didn't
revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == This is a quick and easy dish my mother came up with, its quick to prepare, and is really tasty!
[[Image:chicken pasta salad.jpg|right|chicken pasta salad]]
=== Ingredients === * 250 g [[Pasta]] * 3-4 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 1 [[tomato]], chopped * 300 g [[Broccoli]], cut into florets * 300 g skinless [[Chicken]] breasts * 2 tablespoons [[Parmesan cheese]] [[pepper]], to taste
== Directions ==
* Cook [[Pasta]] to packet instructions (cut 1minute off the packet instructions for'al dente' however i like to give it the bite test to see if its perfect!). * While the [[Pasta]] is cooking, steam or boil your [[Broccoli]] for about 15minutes, or to your liking, however i find a slightly softer texture is better with this dish. * Grill the [[Chicken]], I used a foreman grill, but you can broil, bake or fry it, as long as its cooked! * Now this is the fun part, when everything is done, throw everything in a salad bowl except the [[Cheese]], pour the [[olive oil]] on top (if you need more than 4tablespoons go for it, I didn't really measure it). * Mix! * Add [[pepper]] and [[Cheese]]. * Mix! * Serve warm, or chilled.
=== Other Links ===
== See also ==
[[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Salads]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Pasta Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 to 8 servings. === Ingredients === * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] * 2 cups cooked [[Chicken]] cubes * 1 cup cooked [[garden pea|green peas]] * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 1/2 cup thinly sliced [[green onions]] * 1/4 cup chopped [[pimiento]]s * 2 envelopes (2 tablespoons) [[gelatin|unflavored gelatin]] * 1/2 cup double-strength [[chicken broth]] (cold) * 2/3 cup [[Mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon [[lemon juice]] * 1 teaspoon seasoned [[pepper]] * 3/4 teaspoon [[salt]] * [[lettuce]] leaves * * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], [[Chicken]], [[Peas]], [[celery]], [[onion]]s and pimientos in large bowl.
Soften [[gelatin]] in broth; heat in small saucepan to dissolve. Combine with [[Mayonnaise]], [[lemon juice]], [[pepper]] and [[salt]]. Add to [[rice]] mixture and mix thoroughly. Spoon into 1-1/2-quart mold or individual molds. Chill until set. Unmold onto [[lettuce]] leaves.
=== Other Links === == See also ==
[[Category:American Salads]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken stock and broth Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Chicken and Black Bean Rice Salad

revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 4 servings. === Ingredients === * 2 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled to room temperature * 1 cup cooked [[black beans]] * 1 cup chopped fresh [[tomato]] * 1 cup cooked [[Chicken]] breast cubes * 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded [[Cheddar]] [[Cheese]] * 1 tablespoon chopped fresh [[parsley]] * 1/3 cup prepared Italian dressing* * [[lettuce]] leaves * == Directions == Combine [[rice]], beans, [[tomato]], [[Chicken]], [[Cheese]] and [[parsley]] in large bowl. Pour dressing over [[rice]] mixture; toss lightly. Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves.
=== Other Links === == See also ==

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == Makes 6 servings. === Ingredients === * 2 1-3/8-ounce packages [[sour cream]] sauce mix * 1 cup [[milk]] * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] * 1/2 cup minced [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 6 [[lettuce]] cups * 1 cup diced [[pickled beets]] * 2 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, chopped * * * == Directions == Blend [[sour cream]] sauce mix with [[milk]] to a smooth sauce. Add [[rice]], [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] and [[salt]]. Spoon onto [[lettuce]] leaves; top with beets and [[egg]]s
=== Other Links === == See also ==
