2 poblano peppers Grapeseed oil Kosher salt
Roast the peppers over a flame. Place them in a plastic bag for 30 minutes. Peel and seed them. Cut them into bite-size pieces and place in serving dish. Sprinkle salt and add grapeseed oil. Toss to serve. Better made the day before.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Poblano pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Italian Salads]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]]

[[File:Tumblr_m5mlueNmMy1r0nhs9o1_r1_1280.jpg|right|300px|link=]] '''Prep Time: 30 minutes'''
'''Cook time: n/a'''
'''Serves: 2-4'''
== Description ==
I've always enjoyed a good "salad." Something about them hits me right where I need to be hit, usually. Tuna salad, potato salad, egg salad, macaroni salad.... they're all delicious. But, I'm also from the midwest, so, it might be a "country bumpkin" type thing, but, I do love them. I've always made impromptu salads on my own, but took a bit of time to prepare a decent finger food for company using the "tuna salad" formula. These are light, fresh, delicious and a bit more filling than you'd think.
== Ingredients ==
* 2 cans of chunk light low sodium [[tuna]] in water (the stuff that's not greasy) * ½ to 1 cup of low-fat [[Miracle Whip]] * 2 tablespoons of [[ketchup]] * 6 [[green onions]] * ½ of a [[Roma tomato]] * ½ [[red onion]] * 1 clove of [[garlic]] * 1 loaf of [[Ciabatta]] bread
== Directions == # First things first: chop the onions, tomato and garlic # Drain the cans of tuna and place in a large bowl # Mix the tuna, Miracle Whip, onions, tomatoes, ketchup and garlic in a large bowl. # cut the Ciabatta in 8 pieces and slice the bread, so as to create a pac-man like opening (what a description!) and place the tuna salad equally in each piece and serve!
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Tuna Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

Makes 6 servings == Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[rice]] * 1 cup drained canned crushed [[pineapple]] * 1 cup shredded raw [[carrot]]s * 1/2 cup chopped [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * 1/4 cup [[Mayonnaise]] * 1 teaspoon [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] * 1 teaspoon grated [[lemon peel]] * 1 teaspoon [[lemon juice]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]]
== Directions == # Combine [[rice]], [[pineapple]], [[carrot]]s, [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], [[Mayonnaise]], [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]], [[lemon peel]] and [[lemon juice]]; mix well. # Cover and chill about 2 hours.
Serve as an accompaniment or salad.
[[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Side Dish Rice Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Description == This is a variation on a theme that has been tried many a time (each time with some changes according to the availability of ingredients) The main emphasis is the contrast in flavors and textures, so feel free to use this as the base recipe and adapt! One more thing — I don't have quantities but you can vary according to preference.
== Ingredients == * [[Mango]]s: semi-ripe ones work best although ripe will also do. Peeled and cut into large cubes * [[red bell pepper|Sweet red pepper]]: chopped to a small but not too fine dice (or use a mix of red and [[green bell pepper]]s) * [[Red onion]] chopped quite fine but not minced * [[Green onions|Spring onions]] * [[Mint]] leaves chopped * [[Cilantro]], chopped * Finely shredded [[lettuce]] or [[watercress]] * [[Jícama]] * [[Cucumber]]s, de-seeded and cut into chunks about the same size as the mango pieces * 1 teaspoon of [[sesame oil]] * 1 – 2 [[Kaffir lime leaf|lime leaves]] * [[garlic]] chopped fine (also optional) * Fresh [[ginger]] chopped fine * [[Chile peppers|Green chilis]] chopped fine
=== Dressing === * [[Tamarind]] pulp '''or''' [[lime juice|lime]]/[[lemon juice]] * [[Granulated sugar|Sugar]] '''or''' [[maple syrup]] * dash of [[soy sauce]] (optional) '''or''' even the east Asian [[fish sauce]] (caution use very very sparingly) * [[Salt]] to taste (you'll need less if you're using soy sauce) * pinch of red [[chili powder]] * [[Sesame oil]]
== Directions == # Mix together the first six ingredients. Other options: I would not use both, red onions and green onions. Also, add a little rice wine vinegar, a touch of sugar (if needed), salt and fresh cracked pepper to finish off the flavors. # Add the next three ingredients
=== Dressing === # Mix together all the dressing ingredients. Optionally if you happen to have some tamarind chutney at home, use that and add sesame oil and soy sauce to it. # Take about 1 teaspoon of sesame oil and heat it gently. # Add the lime leaves, garlic, and ginger # Add the green chilis chopped fine after turning it off. # Add to the dressing and toss with fruits/veges as well as a generous amount of partially crushed roasted peanuts # Garnish with roasted sesame seeds and cilantro and mint leaves
[[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Jícama Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Kaffir lime leaf Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Ginger Recipes]] [[Category:Fresh chile pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Mint Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 2 bags of baby [[spinach]] * 1 can of [[water chestnut]]s * ½ of a chopped [[onion]] * 16 slices of fried [[bacon]] - chopped
=== Dressing === * 1 cup of [[vegetable oil]] * ¼ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * ⅓ cup of [[ketchup]] * ⅔ cup of [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * a pinch of [[salt]] * 1 tsp of [[Worcestershire sauce]]
== Directions == # Mix the dressing with the spinach, onion, bacon and water chestnuts

== Directions == # Mix salad ingredients together # Mix dressing ingredients together, and pour over salad, serve chilled.

== Ingredients == * 6 oz pkg [[spinach]] * 1/2 cup sweetened dried [[cranberries]] * [[Red onion]] slices ; Dressing * 4 slices [[bacon]] cooked crisp and crumbled * 1/2 cup [[honey]] * 1/2 cup [[lime juice]] * 2 tbs [[Dijon mustard]] == Method == # Wash spinach. # Divide among 4 plates. # Top each with 2 tbs cranberries and onion slices. ; Dressing # Combine dressing ingredients in a bowl. # Heat in microwave on high for 1 min. or until warm. # Pour dressing over salad and serve with bread sticks.

page.title: Grilled Avocado and Scallop Salad with Honey-Lemon Garlic Dressing

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ == Ingredients == === Honey-lemon garlic dressing === * 1½ cups [[honey]] * 1¼ cups fresh [[lemon juice]] * 8 cloves [[garlic]], chopped finely * 1 Tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] (strong) * 1 Tbsp [[salt]] * 1 tsp freshly ground [[pepper]] * ⅓ cups [[olive oil]]
=== Polent squares === * 2 quarts [[water]] * 1 tablespoon [[salt]] * 2 cups [[polenta meal|polenta]]
=== Grilled avocado and scallop salad === * 5 [[scallops]] per serving (about 6 pounds) sea [[scallops]] * as needed [[olive oil]] * as needed to line plates green [[lettuce]] leaves * as needed [[salt]] * as needed freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 3 pounds + 8 ounces [[radicchio]], finely shredded * 1⅕ Pounds [[green onions|green onion]], sliced thinly * as needed for garnish [[#Polenta squares|polenta squares]] * as needed for garnish [[holland bell pepper|orange bell pepper]], cut in fine strips (about ⅛") * 10 [[Hass Avocado|California avocados]] * as needed fresh [[lemon juice]] * as needed for garnish chopped, fresh [[Italian parsley]]
== Directions == # Just before service, slice each [[avocado]] half in 5 slices; brush with [[lemon juice]] and [[olive oil]]. # Cover with plastic wrap. # To make dressing, whisk together honey, [[lemon juice]], [[garlic]], [[salt]], and [[pepper]]; whisk in [[oil]]. Reserve. # Toss [[scallops]] with a [[olive oil]] just to coat; reserve.
=== Polenta squares === # Make polenta using 2 quarts [[water]], 1 tablespoon [[salt]], and 2 cups polenta. # On a buttered sheet pan, spread hot cooked polenta into a square about ¾-inch thick. # Let polenta set until firm and cool. Cut into 1-inch squares.
=== Per serving === # Line a large serving plate with [[lettuce]] leaves; reserve. # Lightly season 5 [[scallops]] and 4 slices [[avocado]] with [[salt]]. # Grill [[Scallops]] until just firm to the touch, about 2 minutes total. # After 1 minute, grill [[avocado]] slices until lightly browned. # Keep [[scallops]] and [[avocado]] warm. # Meanwhile, deep fry 5 polenta cubes until golden brown; drain well. Reserve. # Toss 1½ cups [[radicchio]] and ¼ cup [[green onions|green onion]] with 1½ tablespoons dressing; arrange in the center of the prepared serving plate. # Top with [[scallops]], then arrange [[avocado]] slices around [[scallops]]. # Drizzle ½ tablespoon dressing over [[avocado]] and [[scallops]]. # Sprinkle [[avocado]] and [[scallops]] with [[parsley]]. # Dot with polenta cubes; scatter with several strips of [[bell pepper]].
[[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Scallops Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]] [[Category:Holland bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Radicchio Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]]

This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Pryor estate in Grapevine, Texas in 1996. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 5 ounces [[radishes]], thinly sliced * 14 ounce can [[lima bean|butter beans]], drained and rinsed * 1 bunch [[watercress]], tough stems removed * 2 [[oranges]], peeled and segmented * 4 teaspoons [[orange juice]] * 2 teaspoons [[olive oil]] * 2 teaspoons fresh [[cilantro|coriander]], chopped * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 1 teaspoon [[salt]]
== Directions == # Place [[radishes]], [[lima bean|butter beans]], watercress and [[orange]] segments in a bowl then whisk together [[orange juice]], [[olive oil]], coriander and seasoning and pour over salad. # Toss gently before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Lima bean Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == This is a recipe I obtained from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Hager estate in Canton, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ catsrecipes y-group]
== Ingredients == * 6 large ears white and yellow [[corn]] shucked * 2 cups shelled [[lima bean]]s * 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh [[tarragon]] leaves * 4 slices [[bacon]] cooked until crisp then well drained and minced * 2 tablespoons [[champagne vinegar]] * 6 tablespoons [[olive oil]]
== Directions == # Bring a large pot of [[water]] to a boil and add [[salt]] then blanch [[corn]] and cook just until tender then remove and set aside. # Cook [[lima bean|beans]] in same [[water]] for about 3 minutes then drain. # When [[corn]] is cool enough to handle cut kernels from cobs and toss with [[lima bean|beans]]. # In a clear jar with a lid shake together [[tarragon]], [[bacon]], [[vinegar]] and [[olive oil]]. # Shake well then pour over [[corn]] mixture. # Set aside to marinate for 15 minutes.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Lima bean Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[olive oil]] * ⅓ cup [[lime juice]] * 2 teaspoons [[chili powder]] * 2 teaspoons chopped [[garlic]] * 1 teaspoon [[cumin]] * 4 cups cooked [[chicken]] diced * 1 [[red bell pepper]] chopped * ¾ cup chopped [[red onion]] * ¾ cup [[cilantro]] chopped * 1 tablespoon chopped [[jalapeño pepper|jalapeño]] * 4 cups [[romaine lettuce]] * 2 [[tomato]]es cut in wedges
== Directions == # Whisk first 5 ingredients to blend then mix in [[chicken]], [[bell pepper]], [[onion]], [[cilantro]] and jalapeño. # Season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste. # Add [[lettuce]] to [[chicken]] salad and toss. # Garnish with [[tomato]] wedges.

page.title: Lettuce and Fruit Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ == Description == Yield: 2 cups
== Ingredients == === Fruit salad === * 3 cans [[mandarin orange]], drained (11 oz ea.) * 3 [[grapefruit]], pink, peeled, seeded and sectioned * 6 [[bibb lettuce]] heads, torn in bite size pieces
=== Poppy seed dressing === * ¼ to ½ cup [[onion]], chopped * ¾ cup [[tarragon vinegar]] * 2 tbsp [[vegetable oil]] * 2½ tbsp [[poppy seeds]] * 1 tbsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * 1 tsp dry [[mustard]] * ¾ cup [[oil]], vegetable
== Directions == # Combine [[mandarin orange]]s, [[grapefruit]] sections, and [[lettuce]] in a large salad bowl; toss lightly. # Serve with [[poppy seeds|poppy seed]] dressing.
=== Poppy seed dressing === # Combine first 7 ingredients in container of electric blender; blend well. # Slowly add ¾ cup [[vegetable oil]], continuing to blend until thick. # Pour into a jar with a tight-fitting lid, and chill. # Shake well before serving.
== Nutritional information == Food exchange per serving: 1 fruit exchange + 1 fat exchange
[[Category:Bibb lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Poppy seed Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ Makes 8 servings.
== Ingredients == * 2 [[turnips]], cut into bite size pieces * 1 head [[broccoli]], into flowerets * 2 large [[carrots]], peeled and sliced * 1 sweet [[red pepper]], chopped * 1 small [[red onion]], chopped * ½ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 3 tbs cider [[vinegar]] * 1 tbs light [[brown sugar]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * ¼ tsp each [[cayenne]] and ground [[cumin]]
== Directions == # Boil turnips, broccoli and carrots in lightly salted water for 3 min. # Drain. # Place in serving bowl with red pepper and onion. # Heat oil, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, cayenne and cumin briefly in saucepan. # Pour on top of veggies, stir. # Cover, refrigerate overnight.
== Contributed by: == * [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
[[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Turnip Recipes]] [[Category:Turnip Salad Recipes]]
[[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]
[[Category:Passover Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[[File:Freshfennel.jpg|thumb|266px|right|fresh fennel]] '''Prep Time: 5'''
'''Cook time: 10'''
'''Serves: 6'''
== Description == The secret to fennel is knowing how to use it & what to pair it with. Fennel can be a bit tough and fibrous with an anise flavor. It is also light, crunchy and refreshing found in many Mediterranean recipes.
== Ingredients == * 1 bulb of [[fennel]], cut in ½ and remove core * 2 – 3 [[blood orange]]s * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] * 3 glugs of extra virgin [[olive oil]]
== Directions == # Slice fennel as this as possible (use a food slicer or mandolin if available). # Peel and supreme the oranges. # Save the extra pulp and squeeze the remaining juice into the bowl. # Mix sliced fennel, juice from the pulp and oranges - season with salt and pepper. # Drizzle with olive oil and toss. # Let stand for 10 minutes then serve.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Fennel Recipes]] [[Category:Blood orange Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

==Ingredients== * 1 can [[black beans]] (drained and rinsed) * 1 large [[cucumber]] (peeled and diced) * 1 [[tomato]] (diced) * ½ [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] (diced) * 1 stalk [[celery]] (chopped) * ½ small [[red onion]] (chopped) * ⅛ cup [[olive oil]] * ⅛ cup [[balsamic vinegar]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Mix all ingredients in a medium size bowl. # Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour
[[Category:Black bean Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Nicaraguan Salads]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[[File:Bittersweet_salad.jpg|right|350px|Bittersweet Salad]] == Description == This recipe is from Yotam Ottolenghi's vegetarian cookbook "Plenty". It was published in [http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2010/apr/17/yotam-ottolenghi-plenty-recipes-extract guardian.co.uk] * Serves two
== Ingredients == * 2 [[blood orange]]s (or plain oranges) * blood [[orange juice]], as needed * 20 ml [[lemon juice]] * 60 ml [[maple syrup]] * coarse [[sea salt]] and [[black pepper]] * ½ tsp [[orange flower water|orange blossom water]] * ½ small [[radicchio]] * 1 small [[endigia|red endive]] (aka red chicory), leaves separated * 1 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 1 handful small [[red-leaf lettuce|red leaves]] * 150 g good-quality [[ricotta]] * 20 g [[pine nut]]s, toasted * 100 g [[pomegranate seeds]] (''ie'' from 1 small fruit)
== Directions == # Slice off the top and base of each orange. # Cut down the sides of the orange, following its natural curve, to remove the skin and white pith. # Cut in between the membranes and put the individual segments into a bowl. # Squeeze the juice from the membrane and skin into a small saucepan. # Make up the juice in the pan to 110ml with extra blood orange juice. # Add the lemon juice, syrup and a pinch of salt, and bring to a light simmer. # Leave to reduce for 20–25 minutes, until you are left with three tablespoons of thick syrup. # Strain through a fine sieve, leave to cool down, then stir in the orange blossom water. # Pull apart the radicchio leaves, tear into largish pieces and put into a salad bowl. # Add the endive leaves, oil and some salt and pepper, and toss gently. # Divide the salad between two serving plates. # Dot with the orange segments, some small red leaves and spoonfuls of ricotta, building the salad up as you go. # Drizzle with the orange syrup and finish with a scattering of pine nuts and pomegranate seeds.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Blood orange Recipes]] [[Category:Endigia Recipes]] [[Category:Ricotta cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Radicchio Recipes]] [[Category:Pomegranate seed Recipes]] [[Category:Pine nut Recipes]]
[[Category:Artichoke Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]
[[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[http://www.metrokc.gov/HEALTH/nutrition/recipes/asian-salad.htm Asian Chicken Salad] from the ''Public Health Cookbook'' by the Seattle & King County Department of Public Health—original source of recipe, public domain government resource * '''Serves''': 4 [[File:Chicken-salad-ck-1940987-l.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[chicken]], skin removed, cut into bite-sized pieces * 4 cups [[cabbage]], shredded * 1 cup [[mushroom]]s, sliced * 1 cup [[carrot]]s, grated * 2 tablespoons [[cilantro]], chopped * 1 [[cucumber]], thinly sliced * 3 [[green onions]], thinly sliced * 1 [[mandarin orange]] '''or''' [[mandarin orange|tangerine]], divided into sections * ½ cup no-fat Asian or Oriental-style salad dressing * [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # In a large bowl, combine chicken, cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, cilantro, cucumber, and dressing. # Toss well. # Top with green onions and tangerine sections. # Pepper to taste.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Asian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 8 cups loosely packed, small fresh baby '''or''' micro [[greens]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[chervil]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[chives]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[parsley]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[tarragon]] leaves * ¼ lb (½ cup) fresh [[almond]]s, coarsely chopped * 2 tbsp [[almond oil]] * 1 tbsp [[sherry vinegar]] * [[salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste * 1 cup thin shavings fresh [[Parmesan cheese|Parmigiano-reggiano cheese]]
== Directions == # Wash and rinse greens and herbs, and spin dry. # Place [[almond]]s in large salad bowl, and use back of spoon to thoroughly crush. # Whisk in [[oil]] and [[vinegar]] until emulsified. # Season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. # Arrange greens and herbs on top of dressing in bowl. # Just before serving, toss to coat, garnish with [[cheese]] and serve.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chives Recipes]] [[Category:Tarragon Recipes]] [[Category:Sherry vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} __NOTOC__ == Description == Orange salad. Comment from Sally: pico de gallo (pee-coh day guy-yoh) translates as the bite of the rooster. I assume that is because the salsa (which merely means "sauce") called pico de gallo is quite fiery and has a fierce bite to it. Having never been bitten by a rooster, however, i can only offer this as conjecture. (grin).
== Ingredients == * 1 cup thinly sliced [[red onion]] * 1 cup peeled, julienne-cut [[jícama]] * 5 cup loosely packed torn [[romaine lettuce|romaine]] or red-tip [[lettuce]] leaves * 2 cup peeled, sliced navel [[oranges]] * ¼ cup [[walnut]] or [[almond]] roughly chopped, (optional)
=== Dressing === * ¼ cup fresh [[orange juice]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[lime juice]] * 1½ tbsp [[honey]] * ½ tbsp [[cumin]] * ½ tbsp [[red chile powder]] * ½ tbsp [[salt]] * 2 tbsp finely mined [[cilantro]]
== Directions == # Whisk together all dressing ingredients - drizzle half the dressing over the [[onion]]s and [[jícama]], refrigerate for at least an hour - just before serving, remove onions and [[jícama]] from marinade and toss with the [[lettuce]]. # Arrange [[oranges]] on top and drizzle the remaining dressing over the salad. # (Optional) sprinkle the [[nuts]] on top.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Better Digestion Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Jícama Recipes]]
[[Category:Bean Recipes| Bean salads]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[[File:Placeholder|right|300px]] '''Prep Time: 20 minutes or less'''
'''Cook time: 10 minutes'''
'''Serves: 4-6'''
== Description ==
This salad is a tasty and more nutrient rich alternative to lettuce based salads during the cold winter month. Both kale and Brussel sprouts are winter vegetables and develop their best flavor after the first frost. Grow kale in your garden and you can harvest into March.
== Ingredients ==
* 1/3 cup raw [[sunflower seeds]] * 1 Tablespoon whole-grain [[mustard]] * 3 Tablespoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * 3/4 tsp coarse [[salt]] * 1 Tbs pure [[maple syrup]] * 2 Tbs cold-pressed [[sunflower oil]] * 1/2 pound [[Brussels sprouts]], thinly sliced (= 3 cups) * 3 cups of leafy greens such as [[Swiss chard]] or [[kale]], stemmed and thinly sliced
== Directions == # Preheat oven to 375 # Toast sunflower seeds in a single layer until golden, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Set aside to cool. # Stir mustard, lemon juice, salt and maple syrup together in a small bowl; whisk in oil until emulsified # Toss Brussel sprouts, chard and/or kale together # Add sunflower seeds # Pour in dressing and toss to coat # Serve immediately
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Salad Recipes|Winter Greens Salad]]

==Description== [http://www.fns.usda.gov/fdd/facts/hhpfacts/FS-ChickenCannedBoned.pdf Chicken, Canned] by the US Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe * '''Serves''': 4
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[chicken]] * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup sweet pickle [[relish]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]], to taste
=== For a variation, add any of these === * [[celery]], sliced * [[onion]], chopped * [[grapes]], halved * [[walnut]]s or [[almond]]s, chopped * [[apple]], chopped * hard boiled [[egg]], chopped
== Directions == # In a small bowl, mix chicken, mayonnaise, relish, salt, and pepper. # Add other ingredients as desired. # Serve with crackers, as a sandwich on whole wheat bread, or on top of a green salad.
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__

[[File:Placeholder|right|300px]] '''Prep Time: 10 minutes'''
'''Cook time: none'''
'''Serves: 2-4'''
== Ingredients == * torn [[chicken]] * [[mayonnaise]] * orange flavored [[yogurt]] * [[mandarin orange]] pieces * love
== Directions == # Prepare the chicken # Combine all the ingredients # Chill for an hour

[[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]]

Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * From: Cooking Light 1998 * Yield: 4 Servings
== Ingredients == * ¼ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * ¼ cup [[balsamic vinegar]] * ¼ cup [[tomato juice]] * 1 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 2 tsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 2 tsp [[stone-ground mustard]] * ¼ tsp coarsely ground [[pepper]] * 4 (4-oz) [[portobello mushroom]] caps (about 5 inches wide) * 1 tbsp [[Cajun seasoning]] for steak (such as chef Paul Prudhomme's Steak Magic) * 2 tsp [[olive oil]] * [[cooking spray]] * 16 cups gourmet salad [[greens]] * 1 large [[tomato]], cut into 8 wedges * ½ cup thinly sliced [[red onion]], separated into rings * 1 (15-oz) can [[cannellini bean|cannellini]] or other [[white beans]], rinsed and drained * ¼ cup (1 oz) crumbled [[blue cheese]]
== Directions == # Combine first 7 ingredients in a large zip-top plastic bag. # Add [[mushroom]]s to bag; seal. # Marinate 10 minutes, turning occasionally. # Remove [[mushroom]]s from bag, reserving marinade. # Sprinkle [[mushroom]]s with Cajun seasoning. # Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet coated with [[cooking spray]] over medium-high heat until hot. # Add [[mushroom]]s; cook 2 minutes on each side or until very brown. # Cool; cut [[mushroom]]s diagonally into thin slices. # Arrange 4 cups salad greens on each of 4 plates. # Top each with [[mushroom]] slices, 2 [[tomato]] wedges, and [[onion]] rings. # Sprinkle each with ¼ cup [[white bean|beans]] and 1 tablespoon blue cheese. # Drizzle the reserved marinade evenly over salads.
== Nutritional information == Per Serving: * 260 calories, (37% from fat), 10.7g fat, 2.4g sat, 5.2g mono, * 1.7g poly, 12.8g protein, 5 mg cholesterol, 165 mg calcium, * 669 mg sodium, 31.4g carbs, 7.7g fiber
[[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Cannellini bean Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Portobello mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato juice Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Description == They say that this is served on the Island of Crete as a main dish in the middle of the table and everyone eats out of the same dish, when the salad gets down to the end, everyone fights to sop up the [[olive oil]] and [[feta]] with a thick heavy bread that they serve in Greece. It is so good with the [[olive oil]] and [[feta]] on it. * Contributed by David D. Vaughan
== Ingredients == * fresh [[tomato]]es * [[Bermuda onion|Bermuda (red) Onion]] * [[European cucumber]]s * [[feta]] cheese * good [[olive oil]] * [[salt]]
== Directions == # Cut [[tomato]]es in a way that you have ¼s while not cutting all the way through and then cut across several times so you have chunks. # Slice the Bermuda (red) [[onion]] in half and then cut across in thin slices, kind of separate. # Peel the [[English cucumber|European cucumbers]] and cut in half or quarters before cutting across to make thick slices. # Now layer, [[cucumber]]s, [[tomato]]es, [[onion]], salting in between [[cucumber]]s and [[tomato]]es, and then layering again. # Sprinkle a thick layer of crumbled [[feta]] [[cheese]] on top of the layers and pour a liberal amount of [[olive oil]] over the [[feta]].
[[Category:David Vaughan's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:English cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 10 oz pkg. [[spring salad mix|spring-mix salad greens]] * 2 cups fresh [[broccoli]] florets * 1 [[English cucumber|seedless cucumber]], sliced * 8 oz bottle ranch [[salad dressing]]
== Directions == # Combine greens, [[broccoli]] and [[cucumber]] and toss with as much dressing as needed.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:English cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Spring salad mix Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Quick and Easy Side Dishes]]

== Description == Stewed green tomatoes [[File:Mtsvane Pamidori.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Mtsvane Pamidori]]
==Ingredients== * 2 tablespoons of [[olive oil]] * 1 pound of [[green tomato]]es, coarsely chopped * 1 medium [[onion]], peeled and finely chopped * 2 large [[carrot]]s, peeled and cut into rounds * ¼ cup of coarsely chopped [[celery leaves]] * ¼ cup of coarsely chopped [[parsley]] * ¼ cup of [[water]] * 3 [[garlic]] cloves, peeled and roughly chopped * 1 teaspoon of [[salt]] * freshly ground [[black pepper]]
==Directions== # In a skillet, heat the olive oil. # Add the chopped tomatoes, onion, carrots, parsley, celery leaves and the water. # Cover skillet and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally for 30 minutes. # In a mortar with a pestle, pound the garlic with salt until a paste is formed. # When the vegetables are tender, remove from heat and stir in the garlic paste and pepper to taste. # Cool to room temperature before serving.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Georgian Vegetarian]] [[Category:Vegan Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}}
== Ingredients == * 6 slices [[meat substitute|soy “bacon”]] * 4 to 6 oz baked marinated [[tofu]], or [[meat substitute|soy “turkey”]] - or [[meat substitute|“chicken”-style deli slices]], diced * 1 ripe medium [[avocado]], diced (1 cup) * 2 tbsp fresh [[lemon juice]] * 2 ripe medium [[tomato]]es, diced (1 1?2 cups) * 6 cups torn dark green [[lettuce]] or [[spinach]] leaves * ¼ cup low-fat French or Catalina dressing, or more to taste
== Directions == # Crisp-cook soy “[[bacon]]” according to package directions. # Remove to plate. # When cool enough to handle, cut into ½-inch pieces. # In large bowl, combine soy “[[bacon]]” and [[tofu]]. # In small bowl, toss [[avocado]] with [[lemon juice]], then add to [[tofu]] mixture along with [[tomato]]es and [[lettuce]]. # Add dressing, toss to coat and serve.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Meat substitute Recipes]] [[Category:Tofu Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 6 cups [[romaine lettuce]], torn into bite-sized pieces * 6 oz canned [[garbanzo beans]], rinsed and drained * 1 cup diced ripe [[tomato]]es or [[cherry tomato]]es, halved * ¼ cup crumbled [[blue cheese]] * 2 tbsp soy “[[bacon]]” bits * ¼ cup prepared low-sugar dressing or [[olive oil]] vinaigrette
== Directions == # Arrange [[lettuce]] on platter. # Arrange garbanzos, [[tomato]]es, [[blue cheese]] and soy “[[bacon]]” bits over the [[lettuce]]. # Just before serving, drizzle dressing over salad, and toss well. # Serve on chilled plates.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Meat substitute Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Description == [[File:CobbSalad.jpg|thumb|300px|Southern-style Cobb Salad]] Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Yield: 6 Servings of salad and 1¾ cups of dressing
== Ingredients == * ½ to 1 pound fresh [[sugar snap|sugar snap peas]] * 2 heads [[iceberg lettuce]] * 3 hard-cooked [[egg]]s * 4 [[plum tomatoes]] * 1 large [[avocado]] * 1 bunch fresh [[watercress]], torn * 2 skinned and boned [[chicken]] breast halves, cooked and sliced * 12 [[bacon]] slices, cooked and crumbled * [[#Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing|Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing]] * freshly ground [[pepper]] * garnish: [[edible flowers]]
=== Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing === * 1 (4-ounce) package crumbled [[blue cheese]] * 1 cup nonfat [[buttermilk]] * ½ to ⅔ cup reduced-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 3 to 4 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced
== Description == # Cook [[peas]] in boiling [[water]] to cover 2 to 3 minutes; drain. # Plunge into [[ice]] [[water]] to stop the cooking process; drain and set aside. # Cut [[iceberg lettuce]] into 6 wedges. # Coarsely chop [[egg]]s. # Remove and discard pulp from [[tomato]]es, and cut into thin strips. # Dice avocado. # Arrange watercress evenly on 6 salad plates. # Top with [[peas]], chopped [[egg]]s,[[tomato]] strips, [[avocado]], and [[chicken]]; sprinkle with [[bacon]]. # Place a lettuce wedge on each plate. # Drizzle with [[#Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing|Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing]]; sprinkle with [[pepper]]. # Garnish with edible flowers, if desired.
=== Blue cheese-buttermilk dressing === # Stir together all ingredients in a bowl. # Serve over salad.

== Description == Contributed by Sylvia at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 – 2 [[chicken breast]]s * 3 – 4 [[eggs]], hard boiled * 6 [[bacon]] slices, cooked crisp/crumbled * 1 [[avocado]], diced * 2 [[tomato]]es, diced * ½ [[red onion]], chopped * 8 oz [[cheddar]] or [[jack cheese|Monterey jack]], or [[blue cheese]], shredded * 1 [[romaine]] head, shredded
== Directions == # Grill or sauté breasts and cut into strips. # Line plates with lettuce and place ingredients on a diagonal; top with dressing of choice.

page.title: Mango, Sweet Pepper and Grilled Red Onion Salad

revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 2 medium [[red bell pepper]]s * 2 medium [[red onion]]s * 1 ripe [[mango]] * ⅓ cup chopped [[cilantro]] * 2 tsp [[olive oil]] * juice of half a [[lime]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] * 4 bunches [[arugula]], [[watercress]] or other pungent [[greens]]
== Directions == # On a grill, char the skins of the [[peppers]] until completely black on all sides. # While hot put the [[pepper]] in a brown paper bag and close tightly. # After about 10 minutes, peel off skin, remove seeds and slice the [[peppers]] into eighths. # Peel the [[onion]]s and slice into ¼" thick rounds. # Grill the [[onion]]s until crispy. # Peel the [[mango]] and cut into thick slices. # Combine the [[red bell pepper|red peppers]], grilled [[onion]]s and the [[mango]] slices. # Add the [[cilantro]]. # Add the [[olive oil]], [[lime juice]], a pinch of [[salt]] and [[pepper]] and mix lightly. # Serve the mixture over a bed of [[arugula]] or other greens.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Lime Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 cup [[sour cream]] * ¼ cup firmly packed [[brown sugar]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[cinnamon]] * 2½ cups seedless [[grapes]], halved * 2 cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * [[lettuce]] leaves * [[crab apple]]s for garnish (optional)
== Directions == # Combine [[sour cream]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[cinnamon]]; refrigerate until well blended. # Just before serving, fold in [[grapes]] and [[rice]] # Serve on [[lettuce]] leaves; garnish with [[crab apple]]s, if desired.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Grape Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[oil]] * ¼ cup [[lime juice]] * 4 tsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 tsp [[onion powder]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * ⅛ tsp [[pepper]] * 2 heads [[romaine lettuce]] torn into pieces * 2 cups [[mango]]s, cubed * 1 large [[avocado]] sliced
== Directions == # Blend together [[oil]], [[lime juice]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]], [[onion]] powder, [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. # Toss [[lettuce]], [[mango]] and [[avocado]]. # Pour on dressing.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * From: www.naturemade.com * Serves 8
== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[almond]] [[Sliced almonds|sliced almonds]] * 2 [[oranges]] peeled and sectioned * 8 cups torn [[romaine lettuce]] * ¼ cup [[rice vinegar|rice wine vinegar]] * ¼ cup [[sugar substitute|Splenda]] * 3 tbsp [[orange juice]] * 3 tbsp [[canola oil]] * ½ tsp [[prepared mustard]] * fresh ground [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Preheat the oven to 325°F. # Spread the [[almond]]s on a baking sheet and bake them for 5 minutes. # Shake the sheet so the nuts toss around and bake them another 3 minutes or until they darken in color. # Set them aside so they can cool down. # Cut [[orange]] sections in half and place them in a large bowl. # Add [[romaine lettuce]] and toss. # In a small bowl whisk together all the remaining ingredients. # Just before serving, pour this dressing over the salad and toss it lightly. # Sprinkle the toasted [[almond]]s on top and serve.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 110 Calories | 7g Carbs | 2g Protein | 8g Fat
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Rice vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == For a lovely presentation, garnish the perimeter of the serving dish with slices of cooked beets.
== Ingredients == === Marinade === * 2 tbsp [[orange]] [[marmalade]], low-sugar * 1 tsp [[ginger]], fresh, minced * 1 tsp [[garlic]], fresh, minced * ¼ cup [[lemon juice]], fresh * ¼ cup [[vinegar]], [[rice wine]] * ¼ cup [[soy sauce]], low sodium * ⅓ cup [[orange juice]], fresh * ¼ tsp [[pepper]], [[cayenne]], or to taste
=== Salad === * 1 lbs [[tempeh]], any variety * 4 cup [[greens]], mixed salad such as [[chicory|curly endive]], [[radicchio]] and [[leaf lettuce]] * 1 med [[carrot]], coarsely grated * 1 cup [[mushroom]]s, thinly sliced * 1 cup [[oranges]], canned, [[mandarin orange|mandarin]] slices, drained * ⅓ to ½ cup [[yogurt]], nonfat, plain
== Directions == # Combine marinade ingredients in a shallow pan. # Set aside. # Cut [[tempeh]] into strips about 2 inches long and ½ inch wide. # Steam 20 minutes. # Drain well; add to marinade. # Cover and refrigerate, basting [[tempeh]] with marinade occasionally. # In a large salad bowl, toss together greens, [[carrot]], [[mushroom]]s and [[orange]] slices. # Strain marinade from [[tempeh]] into a separate bowl. # Toss [[tempeh]] with salad. # Stir [[yogurt]] into marinade, adding more for a creamier texture; taste for seasoning, the toss with salad.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: 235 cal; 15g prot; 5g fat; 31g carb; 0.1 mg chol; 428 mg sod; 6g fiber
__NOTOC__

page.title: Avocado and Smoked Turkey Salad in a Bread Basket

revision.text:
== Ingredients == === Dressing === * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 3 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[marmalade]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], finely chopped * ½ tsp [[curry powder]] * ¼ tsp ground [[black pepper]] * ¼ tsp [[salt]]
=== Salad === * 2 loaves [[French bread]] (12 inches long) * 2 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar]] * 8 cups mixed [[greens]] * 1 cup cubed (½ inch) smoked deli [[turkey meat|turkey]] * 1 cup cubed (½ inch) [[papaya]] * 1 cup red or [[green grapes]] (halved if large) * 1 medium red [[apple]], cored and cubed (½ inch) * 1 ripe [[Hass avocado|California avocado]], seeded, peeled, and cut into crescents
== Directions == === Dressing === # In a small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients until blended. # Set aside.
=== Salad === # Cut one inch off the top of each loaf of [[bread]]. # Using serrated knife, cut around inner edge of crust to remove the inside of the [[bread]]. # Remove by tearing out all of the interior of the loaf. # A ½ inch shell should remain. # In a small bowl, mix together [[oil]] and [[vinegar]]. # Brush on inside of each loaf. # Bake in preheated oven at 375°F for 5 minutes. # Remove from oven and cool. # In large bowl, combine greens, [[turkey meat|turkey]], [[papaya]], [[grapes]], and [[apple]]. # Whisk together dressing and pour over salad. # Toss to coat. # Spoon into breadbaskets. # Top with [[avocado]] crescents. # Cut each breadbasket into four pieces and serve.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Papaya Recipes]] [[Category:Red grape Recipes]] [[Category:Marmalade Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:French bread Recipes]] [[Category:Green grape Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]]
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Side Dish Recipes]]

page.title: Prawn, California Avocado and Mango Salad

revision.text:
{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 3 medium [[Hass avocado|California avocados]] * 3 [[mango]]s * 1 pound cooked [[prawns]] * 3 oz baby [[mushroom]]s sliced * [[lettuce]]
=== Dressing === * 1 tsp grated [[ginger|fresh ginger]] * 5 oz [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[raspberry vinegar]] * 1 tsp [[honey]] * 1 tsp [[prepared mustard|seeded mustard]] * 3 tsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 tbsp chopped fresh [[chives]] * 1 tsp chopped [[dill]]
== Directions == # Prepare recipe close to serving time, it will not keep for long periods of time as the [[avocado]] will discolour, they will stay green longer if wiped with [[lemon juice]]. # Cut [[avocado]]'s in half lengthways, remove stone, remove flesh. # Shred [[lettuce]] and arrange a small pile in the middle of the plates. # Cut flesh of the [[mango]]s, remove skin and slice both [[avocado]] and [[mango]], and arrange around the plate. # Sprinkle the prawns over, then the sliced [[mushroom]] last. # Mix all dressing ingredients together and liberally coat the prawns etc. # Sprinkle with chopped [[parsley]] and serve with brown bread and [[butter]]. # This is a very nice light starter and the [[raspberry vinegar]] is a must, but can be replaced with other [[vinegar]].
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Prawn Recipes]] [[Category:Chives Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]]

[[File:Placeholder|right|300px]] '''Prep Time:'''
'''Cook time:'''
'''Serves:'''
==Description== I love experimenting with salads. In April 2005 I assembled a new salad recipe and decided to call it the ''Glendalough Salad'' because my father's family came from Glendalough, Ireland and the salad contains cubed corned beef.
==Ingredients== * 1 cup Riviera salad blend with [[butter lettuce]] and [[radicchio]] * 1 cup baby [[spinach]] trio (baby spinach, [[arugula]] and [[carrot]]s) * 2 slices of cooked [[corned beef]], cut into strips and then cubed * 4 slices of thin [[chicken]] deli meat, cut into strips and then cubed * 2 slices [[Swiss cheese]], cut into strips and then cubed * ¼ cup sliced fresh [[mushrooms]], cut in half and sliced again * 12 [[green olives]] with pimento but no pits, sliced * handful of [[sweet onion]], minced * ¼ cup [[pecans]], chopped * ranch dressing
==Directions== # Remove fat from corned beef before cubing. # Assemble all meats and vegetables in a large bowl. # Stir in pecans, and then add ranch dressing. # Blend well. # Serve at once; makes enough for two servings.
== Suggestions == You can also use a different type of salad dressing other than Ranch, although I would not recommended adding an oil-based dressing such as Italian as it might smother the natural flavors of the salad. Pepper to taste would be good, although the salad really doesn't need any extra salt because of the corned beef and olives.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Radicchio Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Corned beef Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss cheese Recipes]] Green olive Recipes

== Description == There you have a perfect "Grandma's Super Salad" which Grandma makes for me :D
== Ingredients == * 1 [[lettuce|salad]] * [[mayonnaise]] * 1 dinner [[sausage]]
== Directions == # Cut the salad in pieces. # Mix mayonnaise together with the salad. # Cut the sausages in pieces. # Mix the sausages together with the salad and the mayonnaise.

page.title: Romaine, Pear and Blue Cheese Salad

revision.comment: moved [[---Romaine, Pear & Blue Cheese Salad---with Citrus Dressing---]] to [[Romaine, Pear and Blue Cheese Salad]]
revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Not sure about how many servings.
== Ingredients == * 8 cups [[romaine lettuce]] * 6 oz bag baby [[spinach]] leaves * 14 oz can [[artichoke hearts]] * 2 [[pears]], sliced * 4 oz [[blue cheese]], crumbled
=== Citrus dressing === * ½ [[Italian dressing]] * ¼ cup [[orange juice]] concentrate * ½ tsp grated [[orange peel]] * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * ½ tsp [[tabasco]]
== Directions == # Combine dressing ingredients in a jar and shake well to blend. # Set aside. # Cut romaine lettuce leaves into 1 inch strips, including ribs. # Remove stems from spinach and combine in bowl with lettuce. # Rinse artichoke hearts in cold water, pat dry with paper towels, then cut in quarters and add to bowl. # Add pears and blue cheese to bowl. # Toss with dressing and serve.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Artichoke Recipes]] [[Category:Pear Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 6 fresh [[carrot]]s, grated (peeling is optional) * 1 small [[zucchini]], grated and pressed between paper towels to get rid of excess [[water]] * ½ cup grated [[red cabbage]] * ¼ [[raisins]], soaked for ½ hour in warm [[water]] to plump up * generous sprinkling of raw [[sesame seed]]s
=== Sweet carrot salad dressing === * ⅓ cup cold-pressed [[flavoring oils|essential oils]] or extra virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup freshly squeezed [[lemon juice]] * 1 tbsp [[maple syrup]] * 2 tsp spicy [[curry powder]] * ½ tsp fresh [[garlic]], minced * 1 tbsp fresh [[basil]], chopped very fine
== Directions == # Toss all veggies and [[sesame seed]]s together on a large, decorative plate. # Prepare the dressing. # Whip all ingredients together with a wire whisk until well-combined. # Pour over the [[carrot]] salad and serve immediately (no need to toss after adding the dressing).
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini Recipes]] [[Category:Red cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Sesame seed Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Tassel Estate in Wylie, Texas in 1986. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 pound lean [[ground beef]] * 1 white [[onion]] * 15 ounce can [[kidney beans]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * 4 [[tomato]]es chopped * 1 head [[iceberg lettuce]] chopped * 1 can sliced [[olives]] * 1 large [[avocado]] * 4 ounces sharp [[cheddar]] cheese shredded * 1 small bag [[tortilla chips|nacho cheese taco chips]] crushed * 8 ounce bottle Catalina dressing
== Directions == # Brown ground beef and onions then drain off fat and add kidney beans with juice and salt. # Simmer 10 minutes then drain. # When meat and bean mixture has cooled add to lettuce mixture along with dressing and cheese. # At the last minute add avocado and chips and mix well.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Ground beef Recipes]] [[Category:Kidney bean Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Olive Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]]

page.title: Champagne Salad Dressing and Herb Salad

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the O'Reilly Estate in Fort Worth, Texas in 1988. * Contributed…"
revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the O'Reilly Estate in Fort Worth, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 cup mixed spring [[greens]] * ⅓ cup fresh [[sweet basil]] leaves torn * ⅓ cup fresh [[arugula]] * 1 cup fresh [[nasturtium]] leaves * 2 medium [[green onions]] chopped * 2 ounces [[feta]] cheese * 5 tablespoons [[champagne vinegar]] * 5 tablespoons extra virgin herb [[olive oil]] * ½ teaspoon [[sea salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * 1 teaspoon freshly grated [[ginger]] * 1 tablespoon chopped [[parsley]]
== Directions == # In a salad bowl beat vinegar, olive oil, sea salt, mustard, ginger and parsley together. # Add greens and herbs. # After tossing salad top with crumbled feta cheese.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Champagne vinegar Recipes]]

This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the O'Reilly Estate in Fort Worth, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 cups fresh [[asparagus]] sliced thinly diagonally * 1 cup [[smoked salmon]] chunks * 1 cup [[cranberries]] * 1 cup [[red bell pepper]] sliced * 2 cups [[wild rice]] uncooked * ¼ cup [[white wine vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * 1 teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]]
== Directions == # Cook wild rice according to package directions. # Rinse in cold water. # Combine asparagus, salmon, cranberries, bell pepper and cooled cooked wild rice. # Mix well. # Combine vinegar, olive oil, mustard and salt together and toss with salad.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Wild rice Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Smoked salmon Recipes]] [[Category:Cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 8-oz pkg. three-grain [[tempeh]], cut into ½-inch cubes * ¼ cup [[tamari]] or reduced-sodium [[soy sauce]] * ⅛ tsp [[wasabi]] powder * 2 tbsp dark [[sesame oil]] * 1 cup uncooked long-grain [[brown rice]] * ½ tsp [[coarse salt]] * 1 cup fresh [[corn]] kernels (from 2 ears) * 3 tbsp [[rice vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[mirin]] * 5 small [[button mushroom|button]] or [[cremini mushroom]]s, thinly sliced (¾ cup) * 4 [[radishes]], julienned * 3 bunches [[watercress]] * [[Peanut-Miso Dressing]] * 3 small [[carrot]]s, julienned * 1 cup julienned [[daikon]]
== Directions == # In medium saucepan, bring 2 inches [[water]] to boil over high heat. # Place steamer basket in saucepan, add [[tempeh]], cover and steam 20 minutes. # Meanwhile, in large bowl, mix tamari, [[wasabi]] powder if using, and [[sesame oil]]. # Add hot [[tempeh]] and mix well to coat. # Set aside to marinate while preparing [[rice]]. # In medium saucepan, bring 2 cups [[water]] to a boil. # Add [[rice]] and [[salt]] and return to a boil. # Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer until [[water]] is absorbed, about 35 minutes. # Preheat oven to 375°F. # Remove [[rice]] from heat and let stand, covered, 10 minutes. # Transfer [[rice]] to large bowl and fluff with fork. # Drain [[tempeh]]; spread on baking sheet. # Bake, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned on all sides, about 25 minutes. # Bring small saucepan of [[water]] to a boil. # Add [[corn]], cover and cook 2 minutes. # Drain, rinse under cold running [[water]] and drain well. # Set aside. # In small bowl, whisk together [[vinegar]] and [[mirin]]. # Gradually pour mixture over [[rice]] while still slightly warm and mix gently to combine. # When [[rice]] reaches room temperature, add [[corn]], [[mushroom]]s, [[radishes]] and [[tempeh]] and toss to blend. # Break thick stems off watercress; discard. # Break remaining watercress in half, wash, then dry thoroughly in salad spinner or with paper towels. # In large bowl, toss watercress with peanut-[[miso]] dressing. # Place [[rice]] salad and watercress on individual serving plates; garnish with [[carrot]]s and [[daikon]]. # Alternatively, if salad is part of a buffet, place [[rice]] salad and watercress side by side on large serving platter; arrange [[carrot]]s and [[daikon]] on separate plate.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tempeh Recipes]] [[Category:Brown rice Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Daikon Recipes]] [[Category:Mirin Recipes]] [[Category:White mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Cremini mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * non-stick vegetable [[cooking spray]] (PAM) * 4 tbsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 tbsp [[orange juice|orange tangerine juice]] (Minute Maid) * 1 cup [[walnut]] halves * ¼ tbsp ground [[cinnamon]]
=== Salad === * 2 heads [[butter lettuce]], washed and drained * 1 can [[mandarin orange]] segments, drained (8 oz) * ¼ [[red onion]], very thinly sliced * ½ cup purchased Asian-style [[salad dressing]], such as miso dressing or ginger dressing)
== Directions == === Candied walnuts === # Preheat oven to 375°F. # Line large cookie sheet with foil and spray with pam. # In a large skillet over medium heat, add 3 tbsp of the [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and the [[orange]] tangerine juice. # Bring to a simmer, then add [[walnuts]]. # Cook until [[granulated sugar|sugar]] is absorbed and mixture starts to caramelize around [[walnuts]]. # Stir constantly, about 2 minutes. # In a small bowl, mix [[cinnamon]] and remaining 1 tbsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]]. # Toss [[walnuts]] in [[cinnamon sugar]] mixture. # Place [[walnuts]] ion single layer on prepared cookie sheet. # Bake until [[walnuts]] appear crystallized and toasted, about 8 minutes. # Set aside.
=== Salad === # Arrange 4 to 6 [[lettuce]] leaves on each plate. # Randomly place [[orange]] segments, [[onion]] slices and [[walnuts]] on top of each [[lettuce]] bed. # Drizzle 2 tbsp of dressing on top of each salad and serve.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Yield: 1 cup.
== Ingredients == === Spinach salad === * ½ lbs [[spinach]], fresh, torn into bite-sized pieces * 2 tbsp [[almond]]s, slivered, toasted * ¾ cup [[red cabbage|cabbage, purple]], shredded * ¼ cup [[raisins]]
=== Dressing === * ¼ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * ¾ tsp [[mustard]], dry * ¾ tsp [[salt]] * ½ tsp [[celery seed]]s * 1½ tbsp [[onion]], minced * ¼ cup [[vinegar]] * ½ cup [[oil]], vegetable
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients except dressing in a large bowl. # Toss and serve with dressing.
=== Dressing === # Combine all ingredients in a jar. # Cover tightly, and shake vigorously. # Chill several hours. # Shake dressing again before serving over salad.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Mustard seed Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Red cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}} == Ingredients == * 1 x 5-ounce package Ready Pac Bordeaux [[greens|Salad mix]] * 2 ripe [[Hass Avocado|California avocados]], peeled, pitted, cubed * 1 Pint fresh California [[strawberries]], hulled, halved lengthwise * ⅓ cups [[avocado oil|avocado]], [[grape seed oil]] or [[canola oil]] * ⅓ cups [[red wine vinegar]] * [[coarse salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste * 1 x 4-5 ounce log herbed soft [[chèvre]], sliced into discs * ¼ Cup toasted California [[almond]]s, coarsely chopped
== Directions == # Gently toss together the bordeaux salad mix, cubed avocados and [[strawberries]] with the [[oil]], [[vinegar]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] in a glass salad bowl. # Stud with the chèvre and sprinkle with the [[almond]]s. # Serve cool.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Chèvre Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 4 oz [[anchovy]] filets * 4 each [[garlic]] cloves, crushed * 2 tsp dry [[mustard]] * 2 tsp [[Worcestershire sauce]] * 3 tbsp [[white wine vinegar]] * 1 cup [[olive oil|olive]] or [[avocado oil]] * ⅓ cups fresh [[lemon juice]] * 3 [[egg yolk]]s (optional) * 3 heads [[romaine lettuce]], torn into bite size pieces (12 cups) * 2 cups grated [[parmesan]] or [[romano]] cheese * 6 cups [[croutons]] * 3 [[Hass avocado|California avocados]], seeded, peeled and sliced
== Directions == # Crush [[anchovy|anchovies]] and [[garlic]] in a small bowl and add dry [[mustard]], [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[vinegar]], [[oil]], [[lemon juice]] and [[egg yolk]]s whisk until well blended. # Place [[lettuce]] in large salad bowl and toss with dressing. # Add [[cheese]] and croutons and gently toss again. # Top with [[avocado]] slices.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Anchovy Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Romano Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 6 servings and ⅔ cup [[salad dressing]] * preparation 15 minutes
== Ingredients == === Salad dressing === * 3 tbsp light [[Mayonnaise]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * 2 tbsp [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 dash [[hot pepper sauce]] * 1 dash [[Worcestershire sauce]] * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[water]]
=== Salad === * 8 cups [[romaine lettuce]] leaves torn * 1½ cup toasted bread [[croutons]] * 1 tbsp grated [[parmesan cheese]]
== Directions == === Salad dressing === # Whisk together [[mayonnaise]], [[garlic]], [[vinegar]], [[mustard]], [[lemon juice]], [[hot pepper sauce]] and [[worcestershire sauce]]. # Gradually whisk in [[olive oil]] and [[water]] until blended and smooth.
=== Salad === # Place torn [[lettuce]], croutons and [[cheese]] in large salad bowl. # Toss with ⅓ cup [[salad dressing]] (about ½ of dressing). # Refrigerate remaining dressing for a second salad. # For single serving of salad, use about 1 cup [[lettuce]], ¼ cup croutons, 1 tbsp [[salad dressing]] and 1 tsp [[Parmesan cheese]].
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

revision.comment: clean up, typos fixed: california → California
revision.text:
* Yield - 3 cups of dressing == Ingredients == * 12 each [[chicken breasts]], boneless * 12 cups [[romaine lettuce]], bite size pieces * 12 oz [[Caesar dressing|Caesar dressing]] (recipe follows) * 3 each [[Hass avocado|California avocados]] * 36 [[croutons]] * 12 oz [[parmesan cheese]], grated
=== Caesar dressing === * 1 [[egg yolk]] * 1 oz [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 2 tbsp [[water]] * 1 [[anchovy]] fillet each * 1 clove [[garlic]] * ½ cup [[olive oil]] * 2 oz [[Parmesan cheese]], grated * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste * 3 drops [[tabasco]]
== Directions == # Grill [[chicken breasts]]. # Dress [[lettuce]] with [[#Caesar dressing|Caesar dressing]]. # Seed, peel and slice the [[hass avocado|California avocado]]. # Place greens in the center of the plate. # Place [[avocado]] on top. # Place [[chicken]] at the base of the [[avocado]]. # Garnish with croutons and grated [[cheese]].
=== Caesar dressing === # Combine [[egg]], [[vinegar]], [[lemon juice]], [[water]], anchovy and [[garlic]] in blender blend on high for 30 seconds. # Slowly add the [[olive oil]]. # Remove from blender and stir in [[cheese]]. # Season with [[salt]], [[pepper]] and tabasco.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 large bunch [[romaine lettuce]], about 1 lb * 1 large [[egg]] in shell * 2 cups [[croutons]] * 14 oz (1 can) small [[artichoke hearts]], drained and cut into quarters * 2 [[Hass Avocado|California avocados]], seeded, peeled and sliced * ½ cup grated [[Parmesan cheese]] * 6 [[anchovy]] filets, optional
=== Dressing === * ⅓ cups [[olive oil]] * 3 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 3 tsp [[Worcestershire sauce]] * 1 small clove [[garlic]], crushed * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Tear [[lettuce]] into bite-size pieces and chill. # Prepare [[#Dressing|Caesar dressing]]. # Just before serving, pour enough hot [[water]] over [[egg]] to cover and let stand 1 minute; rinse under cold [[water]]. # Pour [[#Dressing|Caesar dressing]] over [[lettuce]] in large salad bowl. # Break [[egg]] into middle of salad; toss lightly. # Add croutons, [[artichoke]] hearts, avocados, [[Parmesan cheese]] and [[anchovy|anchovies]]. # Toss again and serve.
=== Dressing === # Shake all ingredients together in tightly covered container.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Anchovy Recipes]] [[Category:Artichoke Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Find this recipe at: [http://diabeticgourmet.com/recipes/html/5.shtml Diabetic Gourmet] * Source: MealLeaniYumm! All That's Missing is the Fat * Author: Norene Gilletz * Yield: 6 servings [[File:Url-1.jpg|right|link=|300px]] == Ingredients == * 3 cups [[broccoli]] flowerets * 3 cups [[cauliflower]] flowerets * 1 cup sliced [[red cabbage]] * 3 tablespoons grated [[Parmesan cheese]] * ¾ cup Lighter Caesar Dressing or bottled low-fat [[Caesar salad dressing|Caesar dressing]] * ½ teaspoon freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Wash vegetables well; drain thoroughly. # Combine all ingredients in a glass bowl and mix well (optional: steam the veggies for 3 or 4 minutes if your prefer them softer).
== Nutritional information == * Calories: 68 * Protein: 6 g * Fat: 2.2 g * Carbohydrates: 8 g * Exchanges: 1 vegetable, ¼ low-fat milk
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

[[Image:Caesar salad.jpg|thumb|300px||Caesar salad]] == About Caesar salad == A salad consisting of [[greens]] (classically, [[romaine lettuce]]) tossed with a garlic vinaigrette dressing (made with [[worcestershire sauce]] and [[lemon juice]]), grated [[Parmesan cheese]], [[croutons]], coddled [[egg]] and sometimes [[anchovies]].
== Caesar salad recipes == * [[Favourite Caesar Salad]] * [[Great Caesar's Salad]]
=== Variations === * [[Austrian Caesar Salad]] * [[Australian Caesar Salad with Red Desert Spiced Chicken]] * [[Beef Caesar Rice Salad]] * [[California Avocado Caesar Salad]] * [[California Caesar Salad]] * [[Chicken Caesar Salad]] * [[Doug's Flower Power Caesar Salad]] * [[Salmon Caesar Salad]] * [[Shrimp Caesar Salad]] * [[The Ultimate Vegan Caesar Salad]] * [[Un-Caesar Salad]] * [[Un-Caesar Salad I]] * [[Warm Caesar Potato Salad]]
== Caesar salad dressing recipes == * [[Caesar Salad Dressing Mix]] * [[Tofu Caesar Dressing]]
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Caesar salad can be made in 10 minutes! It's a combination of Chicken of the Sea Premium Skinless & Boneless Salmon, crisp romaine lettuce and your favorite Caesar dressing. This is high in sodium...try to find ways to cut down. * Contributed by Gloria at [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * From: www.chickenofthesea.com * Preparation Time: 10 minutes * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 (7.1-oz) pouch Chicken of the Sea Premium Skinless and Boneless Pink [[Salmon]] <ref>substitute approximately 2 (6-oz) cans of drained [[salmon]] for one pouch.</ref> * 1 (5-oz) pkg [[romaine lettuce]] (about 4 cups) * 2 cups seasoned [[croutons]] * ½ cup grated [[Parmesan cheese]] * ¾ cup favorite [[Caesar salad dressing|Caesar dressing]]
== Directions == # In large mixing bowl, toss lettuce with dressing. # Fold in chicken of the sea salmon and parmesan cheese. # Evenly divide salad onto four salad plates; top with croutons.
== Notes == <references/>
== Nutritional information == Per serving (¼ of recipe): * 364 calories, 222 calories from fat | 25g fat | 7g saturated fat | 15g carbs | 1.5g fiber | 1g sugars | 21g protein | 62mg cholesterol | 1308 sodium | 22% vitamin A | 17% vitamin C | 27% calcium | 11% iron
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Salmon Recipes]]

[[File:Salad-nicoise2.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Ingredients == * 24 cups [[Boston lettuce|Boston butterhead lettuce]], torn * 3 cups [[vinaigrette]] * 6 cups cooked [[potato]]es, cubed * 3 cups cooked [[green beans]], cut into thirds * 12 [[roma tomato]]es, quartered * 4 cups canned [[tuna]], chunked * 1 cup [[black olive|ripe olives]], sliced * 12 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, sliced * 24 [[anchovy]] fillets * 3 pounds [[California avocados]], diced * 3 tbsp fresh [[tarragon]], chopped * 3 tbsp fresh [[chives]], chopped * 1 tbsp fresh [[basil]], chopped
== Directions == # Toss 2 cups [[lettuce]] with 1 tablespoon [[vinaigrette]]; arrange in a bed on a serving plate. # Toss ½ cup [[potato]] cubes, ¼ cup beans and 1 [[tomato]] with 2 tablespoons vinaigrette; arrange in sections on [[lettuce]]. # Arrange ⅓ cup [[tuna]], 1 tablespoon, 1 [[egg]], 2 anchovy fillets and ½ cup [[avocado]] in sections on [[lettuce]]. # Drizzle with 1 tablespoon vinaigrette; [[garnish]] with fresh herbs. [[Category:Anchovy Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Chives Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Potato Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]]

== Description == If you don't already have access to rose vinegar, you'll need to prepare it a week in advance! * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: my old recipes * Makes 2 cups of rose vinegar, 1⅓ cups dressing.
== Ingredients == * ¾ cup [[rose petals]] * 2 cups torn [[leaf lettuce]] * 2 cups torn [[romaine lettuce]]
=== Rose vinegar === * 1 cup [[rose petals]] * 3 whole [[cloves]] * 2 cups [[white vinegar|regular]] or [[white wine vinegar]] (5% acidity)
=== Rose vinegar dressing === * ¾ cup [[vegetable oil]] * ¼ cup [[honey]] * ¼ cup [[#Rose vinegar|rose vinegar]] * 2 tbsp [[poppy seeds]] * 1 tbsp minced [[onion]] * 1 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * ¾ to 1 tbsp [[salt]]
== Directions == # Trim away white part of [[rose petals]]. # Wash petals thoroughly. # Drain and pat dry. # Toss [[rose petals]] with [[lettuce]]. # Toss mixture with [[#Rose vinegar dressing|rose vinegar dressing]] just before serving.
=== Rose vinegar === # Trim away white part of [[rose petals]]. Wash petals thoroughly and drain. # Slightly bruise petals and put petals and cloves in a wide mouth canning jar. # Put [[vinegar]] in medium pan. Bring to boil. # Pour [[vinegar]] over [[rose petals]]. # Cover at once with metal lids. Screw bands tight. # Let stand at room temperature 1 week. # Strain [[vinegar]] into decorative jars. Discard rose petal residue. # Seal jars with a cork or other airtight lid. Store in a cool dry place.
=== Rose vinegar dressing === # Mix all ingredients in container of blender. # Process on low speed 30 seconds. # Chill thoroughly. # Stir well before serving.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]] [[Category:Leaf lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Poppy seed Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Rose petal Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:White vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:White wine vinegar Recipes]]

page.title: Grilled Vegetable Salad and Garlic Bread

revision.text:
== Ingredients == * 1 recipe [[Spicy Yogurt Marinade]] or [[Lemon Herb Marinade]] * 1 large [[eggplant]], cut in ¼-inch thick slices, then slices halved * 2 medium [[sweet onion]]s, such as Vidalia or Walla Walla, about 1½ lb, cut into ½-inch-thick slices * 1 large [[red bell pepper]], cut into ½-inch wide strips * 16 [[cherry tomato]]es * 8 slices (¾-inch-thick) [[Italian bread]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], cut in half * [[olive oil]] for drizzling * 8 cups [[spring salad mix|mesclun greens]] * 1 cup Parmesan shavings (2 oz) or ¼ cup grated [[Parmesan cheese]]
=== Balsamic dressing === * 2 tbsp extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar]] * ½ tsp [[Dijon mustard]]
== Directions == # Prepare marinade in large shallow bowl. Add [[eggplant]], [[onion]]s, [[bell pepper]] and [[tomato]]es, stirring to coat. Let vegetables marinate 30 minutes or up to 3 hours. # Prepare hot charcoal fire or preheat gas grill on high. Set fine-meshed grill rack on top to heat. # Lightly [[oil]] grill topper. Grill vegetables in batches until nicely browned and tender, 2 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer vegetables to baking sheet when they are done. Grill bread alongside vegetables until lightly toasted. Immediately rub warm grilled bread with cut sides of [[garlic]] and drizzle with a little [[olive oil]].
=== Balsamic dressing === # In small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients. # Season to taste with [[salt]] and [[pepper]].
=== Salad === # Place greens in large bowl. # Add grilled vegetables and dressing and toss well. # Divide salad among serving plates and sprinkle Parmesan shavings on top. # Serve immediately with [[garlic]] bread on side.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Italian bread Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Spring salad mix Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == I obtained this recipe from an estate sale when I purchased the family collection from the Sullivan Estate in Dallas, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://g…"
revision.text:
== Description == I obtained this recipe from an estate sale when I purchased the family collection from the Sullivan Estate in Dallas, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * ¾ cup dry [[bulgur]] * ⅓ cups water * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 cup fresh [[corn]] cut from ears * 1 tablespoon [[olive oil]] * 1 pint [[cherry tomato]]es halved * ⅓ cup chopped [[scallions]] * 2 tablespoons [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[pepper]]
== Directions == # In a large heavy dry skillet toast bulgur over medium heat for 10 minutes stirring occasionally until lightly browned. # Add water and salt and bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer covered for 10 minutes. # Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes covered. # Transfer to bowl and cool in refrigerator. # Sauté corn in oil in heavy skillet for 7 minutes. # Cool. # Add corn, tomatoes, scallions, vinegar and pepper to bulgur. # Toss lightly and chill before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bulgur Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/indiancuisineandculture/ Indiancuisineandculture Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups fresh [[corn]] kernels, cut off the cob and blanched in boiling water so corn kernels are still crisp; '''or''' 1 x 16-oz can shoepeg corn (small white and sweet kernels) * 2 cups fresh [[peas]], blanched in boiling water so peas are just barely done; '''or''' 1 x 16-oz can peas * 2 cups fresh [[green beans]], chopped in 2-inch pieces and blanched in boiling water so beans are still crisp; '''or''' 1 x 16-oz can green beans * 1 cup [[celery]], finely chopped * 1 cup [[apple cider vinegar]] * 1 cup [[sugar]] * one half cup [[vegetable oil]] * 2 cloves [[garlic]], minced * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]]
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients together in a large bowl. # Refrigerate overnight and serve chilled. # You will be surprised at how good this simple recipe is. # Make sure to prepare it the day before so that the flavors have time to blend. # Feel free to add or substitute other ingredients such as edamame, kidney or black beans. # Please use the fresh ingredients if you are fortunate enough to have them handy.
[[Category:Indiancuisineandculture]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]]

page.title: Mixed Baby Greens with Spicy Asian Citrus Vinaigrette

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Barger Estate in Mckinney, Texas in 1997. * Contributed by […"
revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Barger Estate in Mckinney, Texas in 1997. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 tablespoon [[rice vinegar]] * 3 tablespoons [[soy sauce]] * 2 tablespoons [[water]] * 1 tablespoon fresh [[lime juice]] * 2 tablespoons fresh [[orange juice]] * ¼ cup fresh [[grapefruit juice]] * 1 teaspoon [[ginger|ginger root]] minced * 1 teaspoon [[garlic]] chopped * ½ teaspoon [[chile paste]] with [[garlic]] * ¼ cup chopped fresh [[cilantro]] * 8 cups mixed [[salad greens]]
== Directions == # Blend [[rice vinegar]], [[soy sauce]], [[water]], lime juice, [[orange juice]], [[grapefruit juice]], [[ginger]], [[garlic]], [[chile paste]] and [[cilantro]] in a blender or food processor until smooth. # Toss desired amount of vinaigrette with mixed baby salad greens.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit juice Recipes]] [[Category:Rice vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Stewart Estate in Quinlan, Texas in 1994. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] [[File:Exps4971_TH1335C25D.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Ingredients == * 1 cup fresh [[asparagus]] cut in 1 inch pieces * 2 tablespoons [[cider vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons [[vegetable oil]] * 2 teaspoons [[honey]] * 2 teaspoons minced fresh [[parsley]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoons [[pepper]] * 1 cup cubed cooked [[chicken]] * ½ cup diced red [[apple]] * 2 cups torn mixed [[greens]]
== Directions == # Cook [[asparagus]] in a small amount of [[water]] until tender crisp then drain and cool. # In a bowl combine the next six ingredients then stir in [[chicken]], [[apple]] and [[asparagus]] and toss. # Serve over greens. [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Asparagus Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Leake Estate in Arlington, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by […"
revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Leake Estate in Arlington, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 19 ounce can [[chickpeas]] * 1 cup [[water]] * 5 fresh or dried [[sage]] leaves * 3 ounce jar chopped [[pimento]]s * 10 fresh [[parsley]] leaves chopped * 1 [[garlic]] clove minced * ½ cup [[olive oil]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[pepper]] * 3 tablespoons [[wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[prepared mustard]] * 4 whole green [[scallions]] diced
== Directions == # In a medium saucepan combine [[chickpeas]] and their liquid with the water and simmer gently for 15 minutes then drain and place in a warm bowl. # Cover and keep warm while preparing the dressing. # Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. # Pour over warm beans then let stand for 30 minutes before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]] [[Category:Sage Recipes]] [[Category:Pimento Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Hager Estate in Canton, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 4 cups [[alfalfa sprouts]] * 2 cups [[tomato]]es diced small * 1 cup chopped cooked [[bacon]]
=== Dressing === * 3 cups [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup [[prepared mustard]] * ¼ cup plain [[yogurt]] * 1½ teaspoons [[horseradish]] * 1½ teaspoons [[honey]]
== Directions == # Prepare dressing by combining and stirring all ingredients until well blended. # Combine sprouts, [[tomato]]es and [[bacon]] and serve with dressing poured over.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Alfalfa sprout Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Horseradish Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Hager Estate in Canton, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 ripe [[bananas]] diced * ½ cup diced canned [[pineapple]] * 1½ cups canned [[albacore tuna]] * ¼ cup diced [[celery]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 tablespoon chopped [[pickle]] * [[mayonnaise]] to moisten
== Directions == # Mix [[bananas]] and [[pineapple]] together then add flaked [[albacore]] and fold in remaining ingredients.
