[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Banana Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Albacore Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Makes 4 Servings.
== Ingredients == * 2 cups rare roast [[beef]], chilled * ½ cup thinly sliced [[celery]] * ⅓ cup chopped sour [[pickle]] * ¼ cup chopped [[green onion]] * ¼ cup [[capers]], drained * 3 tablespoons [[vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[Dijon-style mustard]] * ½ clove [[garlic]], minced * ½ teaspoon [[parsley]] * dash of [[cayenne pepper]] * ½ cup [[vegetable oil]]
== Directions == # Toss first 5 ingredients together. # Whisk together remaining ingredients and pour over beef mixture. # Serve at room temperature.
[[Category:Beef Recipes]] [[Category:Caper Recipes]] [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Pickle Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == Recipe courtesy Sandra Lee. This recipe on aired on the show: [http://www.foodnetwork.com/food/show_sh/0,1976,FOOD_14521,00.html ''Semi-Homemade Cooking with Sandra Lee''] * Episode: [http://www.foodnetwork.com/food/show_sh/episode/0,1976,FOOD_14521_51978,00.html Daffodil Parade] * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 pint yellow [[cherry tomato]]es * ¼ cup French [[vinaigrette]] dressing * ¼ cup [[feta]] cheese, crumbled * 2 [[green onions]], sliced * 1 head [[endive]], [[lettuce]] or 8 [[romaine lettuce]] leaves from the hearts
== Directions == # Preheat grill to medium-high. # Thread tomatoes onto bamboo skewers that have been soaked in water for at least 30 minutes. # Brush with vinaigrette and place on grill. # Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until some begin to burst and get charred. # In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes, feta cheese, green onion and remaining dressing. # Arrange endive leaves around serving platter, like flower petals, touching in the center. # Mound the tomato mixture in the center of the plate.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Vinaigrette Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Endive Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Marlin Estate in Heath, Texas in 1998. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 5 cups mixed [[salad greens]] * ½ medium [[red onion]] thinly sliced into half-circles * ⅓ cup [[dried cranberries]] * ¼ cup [[walnut]] halves * ⅓ cup crumbled [[blue cheese]]
=== Dressing === * 2 teaspoons [[balsamic vinegar|balsamic]] or [[red wine vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[cranberry juice]] * ½ teaspoon [[sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Wash lettuce and dry thoroughly in a salad spinner or wrap in a towel. # Refrigerate until ready to toss. # Whisk dressing in a glass measuring cup until smooth. # Toss together with the lettuce, onion, cranberries and nuts. # Place onto salad plates and top with a small amount of crumbled cheese.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Cranberry juice Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]]

page.title: Grated Parsnip and Carrot Salad with Citrus Dressing

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Grimes Estate in Bryan, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * ⅓ pound [[parsnip]]s peeled and grated * ⅓ pound [[carrot]]s peeled and grated * 1 [[orange]] juiced * ½ [[lime]] juiced * ½ teaspoon [[granulated sugar]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Toss all ingredients in bowl until thoroughly mixed. # Cover and place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Parsnip Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]]

page.title: Goat Cheese and Sun-dried Tomato Salad

revision.text:
== Description == I got this recipe from one of my college roommates, whose mother used to send us home with a huge batch of this. She was making it for us in 1978. I don't know how much further it goes back than that, but it is without a doubt one of my favorite salads of all times. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 bag mixed [[greens]] (preferably with [[radicchio]] leaves) * 1 package [[spinach]] leaves * 1 bunch [[watercress]] * 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[onion]]s * 4 [[sun-dried tomatoes]] sliced (packed in oil) * [[olive oil]]
=== Dressing === * 5 tablespoons [[olive oil]] * ½ teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * 2 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]] * 2 minced [[garlic]] clove * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] * 6 ounces creamy [[goat cheese]]
== Directions == # Preheat broiler. # Mix all greens and salad leaves in salad bowl. # Add onion, tomatoes and dressing and toss well. # Place on individual plates. # Brush goat cheese with olive oil and place under broiler (on sprayed cookie sheet) for a few minutes until cheese bubbles and turns slightly golden in color. # Place goat cheese slices on top of individual salads and serve while warm. # Mix together mustard, lemon juice, and vinegar then add salt and pepper to taste. # Whisk in olive oil slowly allowing dressing to thicken. # Add garlic and mix well then let stand for 30 minutes. # Combine dressing ingredients and pour over salad right before serving.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Radicchio Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Sun-dried tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by Suzanne Willen
== Ingredients == * 4 oz smallest elbow [[macaroni]] * 2 cup cubed cooked [[chicken]] or 2 cans [[tuna]] * 6 oz [[button mushroom]]s drained and quartered * 1 cup [[celery]], cut up small * 13½ oz [[pineapple]] tidbits, drained well * 3 oz [[cashews]]
=== Dressing === * 1 tbsp grated [[onion]] * ½ cup fat-free [[mayonnaise]] * ⅓ cup fat-free [[sour cream]] * ⅓ cup 1890 [[French dressing]] (I used Kraft fat-free [[Catalina dressing|Catalina]]) * ⅛ tbsp [[salt]] * [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Mix dressing in a separate bowl, then add to salad and mix together, refrigerate overnight. # The next day add 3 oz cashews mix well and serve.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Cashew Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Macaroni Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]]

page.title: Fresh Mango and Black Bean Salad with Grilled Chicken

revision.text:
[[File:Grillled-chicken-with-mango-and-black-bean-salsa.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Hoyt Estate in Allen, Texas in 1989. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * ½ cup prepared [[vinaigrette]] salad dressing * ¼ cup chopped fresh [[cilantro]] * 2 teaspoons grated [[lime peel]] * 6 boneless skinless [[chicken breast]] halves * 1 can [[black bean]]s drained and rinsed * ¼ cup chopped [[red onion]] * ¼ cup finely chopped [[jalapeno pepper]]s * 2 ripe [[mango]]s
== Directions == # In a small bowl combine salad dressing, cilantro and lime peel. # In a plastic food storage bag place ¼ cup of the dressing and the chicken breasts. # Refrigerate for 30 minutes. # Meanwhile in a medium bowl combine black beans, onion and jalapeno with remaining dressing then set aside. # Peel and cube mangoes. # Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. # Grill or broil chicken until cooked through. # Toss mangos with bean mixture. # Serve chicken with mango and black bean salad. [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Black bean Recipes]] [[Category:Jalapeno pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Fisher Estate in Rockwall, Texas in 1980. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 package [[gelatin dessert mix|lemon gelatin]] * 2 cups boiling water * 2 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * ⅔ cup [[cabbage]] chopped * ⅔ cup [[Green bell pepper|green pepper]] chopped * 2 slices [[pimento]] * [[lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and stir until completely dissolved. # Add lemon juice then add chopped vegetables and chill. # Slice when firm and serve on lettuce leaves with your favorite dressing.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Pimento Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]]

== Description == WebMD Weight Loss Clinic members: Journal as 1 portion light dessert '''or''' 1 portion fresh fruit * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Yield: About 4½ cups (9 x ½-cup servings)
== Ingredients == * ¼ cup light [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup light or regular plain [[yogurt]] or fat-free [[sour cream]] * 2 teaspoons [[sugar]] * ¾ teaspoon [[lemon juice]] * 3 [[apples]], peeled, cored, and chopped (about 3 cups) * 1 cup thinly sliced [[celery]] * ⅓ cup [[walnut]] pieces (or coarsely chopped walnuts) * ⅓ cup [[dried fruit]] like raisins, cherries, or cranberries (optional)
== Directions == # Add mayonnaise, yogurt or sour cream, sugar and lemon juice to serving bowl and whisk well to blend. # Add apple pieces, celery, walnuts and dried fruit if desired and toss everything together. # Cover and chill in refrigerator until ready to serve.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 90 calories | | calories from fat: 45% | 2 g protein | 11 g carbohydrate | 4.5 g fat | .6 g saturated fat | 0 mg cholesterol | 1.3 g fiber | 66 mg sodium
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by Jenn B aka Mom2Sam and Tiny at [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: http://www.bettycrocker.com
== Ingredients == * ¼ cup fat-free [[mayonnaise]] or [[salad dressing]] * ¼ cup plain fat-free [[yogurt]] * 1 tablespoon [[lemon juice]] * 1 tablespoon [[non-fat milk|fat-free (skim) milk]] * 2 medium unpeeled red eating [[apple]]s, coarsely chopped (2 cups) * 2 medium [[celery]] stalks, chopped (1 cup) * 2 tablespoons coarsely chopped [[nuts]] * salad [[greens]], if desired
== Directions == # Mix mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice and milk in medium bowl. # Stir in apples, celery and nuts. # Serve on salad greens. # Cover and refrigerate any remaining salad.
== Nutritional information == 1 Serving: Calories 90 (Calories from Fat 25) | Fat 3g (Saturated 0g) | Cholesterol 0mg | Sodium 150mg | Potassium 200mg | Carbohydrate 9g (Dietary Fiber 2g) | Protein 2g * Diet Exchanges: 1 fruit | ½ fat * Weight Watcher Points - 2 Points
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Nut Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/85.12.79.6|85.12.79.6]] ([[User talk:85.12.79.6|talk]] | [[Special:Block/85.12.79.6|block]]) to last version by [[User:Carrolbot|Carrolbot]]
revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by Dorie at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 pkg. [[gelatin dessert mix|lemon flavor Jell-O]] * 1½ cups boiling water * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 cup cold water * ice cubes * ½ cup [[Miracle Whip]] * 1½ cups diced [[apple]]s * ¾ cup [[celery]] * ¼ cup chopped [[walnuts]]
== Directions == # Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. # Add lemon juice. # Combine cold water and ice cubes to make 2 cups. # Add to gelatin, stirring until slightly thickened. # Remove any unmelted ice. # Stir in salad dressing with wire whisk; chill until thickened. # Fold apples, celery and walnuts into gelatin mixture. # Pour into mold chill until firm, about 3 hours.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]]

== Description == This is a recipe I obtained from an Estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Manes Estate in Venus, Texas in 1981. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups diced [[apple]]s * 1 cup [[celery]] sticks * ½ cup [[walnuts]] * ¼ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon [[granulated sugar]] * ½ teaspoon fresh [[lemon juice]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ½ cup [[whipping cream]] whipped
== Directions == # Blend mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice and salt together until smooth. # Fold in whipped cream then fold into apples, celery and nut mixture. # Chill and serve.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Heavy cream Recipes]]

== Description == This is a recipe I obtained from an Estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Manes Estate in Venus, Texas in 1981. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 16 ounces [[sour cream]] * 1 large can [[mandarin orange]]s * 1 small can crushed [[pineapple]] * 10½ ounces miniature [[marshmallow]]s * 7 ounces [[coconut]]
== Directions == # Mix all ingredients together. # Chill for 1 hour and serve.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Marshmallow Recipes]] [[Category:Coconut Recipes]]

page.title: Osh Kosh Mesclun Salad with Avocado and Blood Oranges

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 small [[blood orange]]s * 1 tablespoon [[rice vinegar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * 1 tablespoon extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 6 cups [[mesclun]] or mixed young salad [[greens]] * 4 red [[radish]]es trimmed and thinly sliced * ½ small [[avocado]] peeled and sliced thin * 2 tablespoons crumbled [[blue cheese]]
== Directions == # Working with 1 orange at a time cut a thin slice off the top and the bottom exposing the flesh. # Stand the orange upright and using a sharp knife thickly cut off the peel and remove all pith. # Holding the orange over small bowl cut along both sides of each section to free from membrane. # As you work discard any seeds and let the sections and any juice fall into the bowl. # Repeat with the second orange. # When both oranges are sectioned squeeze the membranes into the bowl to extract all of the juice. # In a small bowl whisk together 2 tablespoons orange juice vinegar and mustard. # While whisking slowly add the olive oil in a thin stream until emulsified. # Whisk in the salt and pepper. # In a large bowl combine mesclun, radishes and orange sections. # Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss gently to mix well and coat evenly. # To serve divide salad among individual plates. # Top each portion with slices of avocado and sprinkle with the cheese.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spring salad mix Recipes]] [[Category:Blood orange Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]]

page.title: Fresh Spinach and Rice Salad Bowl

revision.text:
== Ingredients == * ¼ to ½ pound fresh [[spinach]] * 1 small [[onion]], thinly sliced * ½ cup thinly sliced [[celery]] * ¼ cup sliced [[radishes]] * 3 hard-cooked [[egg]]s, sliced * 1½ cups cooked [[rice]], cooled * ¾ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * bottled [[French dressing]]
== Directions == # Wash [[spinach]] thoroughly. # Break off stems and measure 1 quart. # If leaves are large, tear into bite-sized pieces. # Shake [[spinach]] in towel to dry well. # Arrange attractively with other vegetables, [[egg]]s, and [[rice]] in salad bowl. # Chill. # When ready to serve, season, add dressing and toss lightly.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 5 cups, 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[chicken]], cooked, cut up * ½ cup [[zucchini]], chopped * ½ cup [[radishes]], chopped * ¼ cup 2% [[yogurt]] * 1 tbsp [[soy sauce]] * ½ tsp bulk granulated artificial [[sweetener]], like Sugar Twin * ½ tsp [[ginger]], ground * 3 cups [[lettuce]], shredded
== Directions == # In a bowl, combine [[chicken]], [[zucchini]], and [[radishes]]. # In a cup, combine yogurt, soy sauce, sweetener and [[ginger]]. # Pour over [[chicken]] mixture to coat evenly. # Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving, then toss well gently. # Divide into 4 portions.
== Nutritional information == car: 2g | pro: 15g | fat: 7g | cal: 131
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 head [[romaine lettuce]] torn shredded * 1 [[green bell pepper]] seeded and diced * 1 [[red bell pepper]] seeded and diced * ½ cup [[dried cranberries]] * ½ cup shelled [[pistachios]] * ¼ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 3 tablespoons [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[prepared mustard|spicy mustard]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Combine romaine, peppers, cranberries and pistachios in a large bowl. # Whisk together the remaining ingredients and toss with lettuce mixture.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Pistachio Recipes]]

page.title: Omega Insalata di Rucola e Finocchio

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 bunches [[arugula]] thick stems removed * 2 [[fennel]] bulbs very thinly sliced * ¼ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 3 tablespoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 3 tablespoons [[Parmesan cheese]] shavings
== Directions == # Combine arugula and fennel in a salad bowl. # Whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper and toss with greens. # Garnish with parmesan shavings.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Fennel Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 16 ounce can whole [[tomato]]es drained * ¼ cup fresh [[lemon juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[brown sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Place tomatoes in a dish and sprinkle with lemon juice, brown sugar, salt, and pepper. # Refrigerate at least two hours before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[crab]] meat * 1 tablespoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * ½ [[cantaloupe]] peeled seeded and chopped * 1 cup cooked [[rice]] * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ½ cup [[sour cream]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Gently toss crab meat with lemon juice. # Add remaining ingredients and toss gently to combine.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Crab Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Cantaloupe Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 [[Belgian endive]]s washed dried and cut crosswise * 16 [[walnut]] halves coarsely chopped * 4 tablespoons [[walnut oil]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Heat walnuts in a sauté pan over medium heat for 2 minutes. # Combine endive, walnut oil, salt and pepper in a bowl tossing to coat endive. # Place on individual salad plates and sprinkle chopped walnuts on top.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian endive Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut oil Recipes]]

page.title: Oozing with Goodness Tangerine Napa Cabbage Salad

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 tablespoons toasted [[sesame seeds]] * 3 tablespoons [[peanut oil]] * 3 tablespoons [[rice wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[fennel seeds]] * 1 teaspoon [[honey]] * 1 teaspoon grated [[ginger]] * grated [[zest]] of 1 [[tangerine]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 1 large [[Napa cabbage]] shredded * 2 [[scallions]] green and white parts thinly sliced * ¼ cup chopped [[cilantro]] * 4 [[tangerine]]s peeled and sectioned
== Directions == # Combine half the sesame seeds with the oil, vinegar, fennel seeds, honey, ginger, tangerine zest, salt and pepper in an electric blender and process until smooth. # Toss with the shredded cabbage, scallions and cilantro in a large bowl. # Serve garnished with tangerine sections and remaining sesame seeds.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sesame seed Recipes]] [[Category:Napa cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Fennel seed Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Butler Estate in Irving, Texas in 1988. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 cup drained pimento-stuffed [[green olives]] coarsely chopped * 4 cloves [[garlic]] finely chopped * 2 ribs [[celery]] finely chopped * 1 tablespoon extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 teaspoons [[red wine vinegar]] * ½ teaspoon grated [[lemon zest]] * ¼ teaspoon dried [[oregano]] * ¼ teaspoon hot [[red pepper flakes]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients in a bowl and toss to combine. # Refrigerate covered for at least 2 hours before serving at room temperature.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green olive Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]]

== Description == This is a recipe I obtained from an Estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Stewart Estate in Terrell, Texas in 1982. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 head [[iceberg lettuce]] * ½ cup [[bell pepper]] * ½ cup [[green onions]] * 1 package frozen green [[peas]] uncooked but thawed * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 10 slices [[bacon]] cooked * 1 cup shredded [[Swiss cheese]]
== Directions == # Layer in order and refrigerate.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss cheese Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Vaughan Estate in McKinney, Texas in 1987. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[apple cider]] * 6 ounce package [[gelatin dessert mix|cherry flavored gelatin]] * 16 ounce can pitted dark [[sweet cherries]] * ½ cup thinly sliced [[celery]] * ½ cup chopped [[walnuts]] * 3 ounce package [[cream cheese]] softened * 1 cup [[applesauce]] * [[leaf lettuce]]
== Directions == # Bring cider to boiling then dissolve gelatin in boiling cider. # Drain cherries reserving syrup. # Halve cherries and set aside. # Add enough water to reserved syrup to measure 1½ cups liquid then stir into gelatin. # Set aside 2 cups of the gelatin mixture and keep at room temperature. # Chill remaining gelatin until partially set. # Fold halved cherries, celery and walnuts into the partially set gelatin. # Pour into a 6½ cup ring mold and chill until almost firm. # Gradually add reserved gelatin to softened cream cheese beating until smooth. # Stir in applesauce. # Spoon cream cheese mixture over cherry layer in mold then chill until firm. # Unmold onto lettuce lined platter.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cider Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Cream cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Applesauce Recipes]] [[Category:Leaf lettuce Recipes]]

page.title: Fresh Spinach Salad with Grapefruit and Pecans

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Legmen Estate in Jacksonville, Texas in 1991. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 20 ounces fresh [[spinach]] * 2 ruby red [[grapefruit]] peeled and sectioned * ½ cup toasted chopped [[pecans]] * ½ cup light [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup [[Napa Valley Raspberry Vinaigrette|raspberry vinaigrette]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[pepper]] * ½ teaspoon [[maple syrup]] * ⅛ teaspoon minced [[serrano pepper|serrano]]
== Directions == # Tear spinach leaves from stems. # Wash and dry completely. # Place in large salad bowl tearing large leaves into bite-size pieces. # Toss grapefruit sections with spinach. # Combine oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, maple syrup and serrano and whisk together or shake in airtight container until salt is dissolved. # Pour over salad and toss to evenly coat ingredients. # Garnish with chopped pecans.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]]

page.title: Melon Ball Salad with Raspberry Vinaigrette

revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Edmonds Estate in Canton, Texas in 1987. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 small [[red onion]] thinly sliced * 3 cups bite sized pieces of [[melon]] * 2 hearts [[romaine lettuce]] cut into pieces * 2 tablespoons coarsely chopped [[basil]] leaves * 1 tablespoon coarsely chopped [[mint]] leaves
=== Vinaigrette === * ¼ cup extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * 3 tablespoons [[raspberry vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[basil]] leaves * 1 tablespoon finely chopped [[mint]] leaves * 1 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Place onion slices in a small bowl and cover with cold water and soak for 30 minutes. # Drain and pat dry then combine with melon balls, lettuce and herbs then toss gently to combine and refrigerate until ready to serve. # Whisk together all ingredients for vinaigrette and toss gently with melon mixture. # Serve immediately.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vinaigrette Recipes]] [[Category:Melon Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Cabrera Estate in Malakoff, Texas in 1986. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * ⅓ cup [[granulated sugar]] * ⅓ cup [[vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[dry mustard]] * 1 clove [[garlic]] finely chopped * 1 teaspoon [[celery seed]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 3 cups fresh raw [[spinach]] * 3 cups fresh [[leaf lettuce]] * ½ cup coarsely chopped [[cashews]]
== Directions == # Combine sugar, vinegar, mustard, garlic, celery seed, salt and pepper in a bowl. # Whisk until combined. # Toss greens in the dressing and place on individual serving plates. # Sprinkle with the cashews and serve immediately.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cashew Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Leaf lettuce Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Cabrera Estate in Malakoff, Texas in 1986. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 medium [[cucumber]]s * 1½ cups crumbled [[feta]] cheese * ½ cup chopped fresh [[mint]] leaves * ½ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup fresh [[lemon juice]] * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Peel half the skin of the cucumbers in lengthwise strips then cut into very thin slices. # Arrange slices on a serving platter then sprinkle feta cheese on top followed by the mint. # Whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper and pour over the salad.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Mint Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Cabrera Estate in Malakoff, Texas in 1986. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 6 cups fresh [[romaine]] * 2 tablespoons extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 teaspoon freshly ground [[black pepper]] * 1 pint fresh [[strawberries]] hulled and sliced * 1 small [[red onion]] thinly sliced * ½ cup toasted chopped [[pecans]] * ½ cup crumbled [[blue cheese]]
== Directions == # Toss romaine with the oil, vinegar salt and pepper. # Sprinkle remaining ingredients over romaine immediately before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Cabrera Estate in Malakoff, Texas in 1986. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 4 large ripe [[tomato]]es sliced * 12 ounces fresh [[mozzarella]] sliced * 1 cup fresh [[basil]] leaves * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]]
== Directions == # Arrange tomatoes and mozzarella in alternating slices on a serving platter. # Sprinkle with basil leaves. # Drizzle liberally with olive oil and season with salt immediately before serving. # Do not refrigerate prior to serving and serve at room temperature.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]]

== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Gibson Estate in Quinlan, Texas in 1981. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 small head [[lettuce]] washed and chilled * 1 ripe small [[avocado]] * ½ cup bottled creamy [[Italian salad dressing]]
== Directions == # In a bowl tear lettuce into bite size pieces. # Cut avocado lengthwise in half and remove pit then peel and slice crosswise into bowl. # Pour salad dressing over lettuce and toss. # Divide amongst individual salad bowls and serve.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: Prevention Magazine May 2006 * 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 cup [[quinoa]], rinsed, drained * 2 cup water * 1 cup chopped [[radicchio]], about ½ head, + leaves for garnish * ½ cup chopped [[cilantro]] * ½ cup [[golden raisins]] * ½ cup fat-free honey mustard dressing
== Directions == # In medium pot, combine quinoa and water; bring to boil. # Reduce heat to simmer, cover and cook until all liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. # Transfer quinoa to med serving bowl. # Combine radicchio, cilantro, and raisins with quinoa. # Toss with dressing. # Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve on radicchio leaves.
== Nutritional information == Per Serving: 247 cal | 6 g protein | 50 g carb | 2.5 g fat | 0.3 g sat fat | 0 mg chol | 4 g fiber | 300 mg sod
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Quinoa Recipes]] [[Category:Radicchio Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Golden raisin Recipes]]

[[File:Butternut-squash-salad.jpg|thumb|300px|Roasted Butternut Squash Salad]]
== Ingredients == * 1 medium-large [[butternut squash]], seeded and cut into thick 1-inch slices * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] * 8 tablespoons of [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * ½ medium [[red onion]], sliced paper thin * 1 clove of [[garlic]], sliced paper thin * handful of fresh [[oregano]] * pinch of [[red pepper flakes|red chili flakes]]
== Directions == # Preheat oven to 450°F. # Season the squash with 4 tablespoons of olive oil, salt and pepper. # Lay squash in a single layer on a cookie sheet. # Bake about 20 minutes, until tender. # Mix 4 tablespoons olive oil, vinegar, onion, garlic, herbs, chili flakes and salt and pepper - creating a marinade. # Remove the squash once tender and pour marinade over hot squash. # Allow to cool for 20 minutes in the marinade, sprinkle with fresh mint and serve. # Best served at room temperature.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Butternut squash Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 can (8 oz) crushed [[pineapple]] in own juice * 1 can (16 oz) Ocean Spray whole [[cranberry sauce]] * 1 pkg. (3 oz) [[gelatin dessert mix|raspberry gelatin]] * ¼ cup chopped [[nuts]] * ¼ cup chopped [[celery]]
== Directions == # Drain pineapple, save juice, add water to make 1¼ cup liquid. # In saucepan bring liquid to boil and take off of heat. # Stir in gelatin until dissolved. # Break up cranberry sauce with fork and stir into gelatin mixture. # Cool until slightly thick and add celery, nuts and pineapple. # Pour into mold and chill.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Christmas Salads]] [[Category:Christmas Side Dishes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Nut Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared cranberry sauce Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * From Dinah's Kitchen
== Ingredients == === Salad === * 1½ lbs head crisp [[lettuce]], cut into small pieces * ½ lb medium cooked roast [[beef]], diced * ½ lb cooked [[chicken]] or [[turkey meat|turkey]], diced * ½ lb [[mushrooms]], sliced * ½ lb [[cucumber]]s, peeled, cored and diced * ¼ lb [[carrot]]s, peeled, sliced and diced * 4 tbsp grated [[Parmesan cheese]] * ½ cup garlic [[croutons]] * ¼ lb crisp cooked [[bacon]], crumbled
=== Dressing === * 3 whole [[eggs]] <ref>This recipe uses raw eggs. Use only fresh, clean eggs.</ref> * ¼ tsp [[pepper]] * ¼ tsp [[sugar]] * ¼ tsp [[salt]] * 1 tsp [[dry mustard]] * ½ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 cup Wishbone [[Italian dressing]] * 2 cups [[soybean oil|soybean salad oil]] * 1 cup cold [[water]]
== Directions == === Dressing === # Put eggs, pepper sugar salt and dry mustard in food processor. # Blend well for 2 minutes. # Add vinegar and Italian dressing and mix for another minute. # Slowly add oil drop by drop from tablespoon and then add water to thin down dressing. # Makes 1 quart.
=== Salad === # Toss salad ingredients with [[#Dressing|dressing]] and serve cold.
== Notes == <references/>
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Celebrity Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Beef Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Egg Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 beefsteak [[tomato]] * 3 ounces [[mozzarella]] * 5 leaves fresh [[basil]] * 1 teaspoon coarsely ground [[black pepper]] * ¼ teaspoon [[white wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon extra virgin [[olive oil]]
== Directions == # Slice tomato to ¼ inch thickness and arrange on plate. # Slice mozzarella about the same width and layer it between the tomatoes. # Arrange the basil between the layers of cheese and tomato. # Season with pepper then drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''Flavorful Seasons'' Cookbook from ADA. * Prep time 15 minutes | Cook time 15 minutes * 4 servings
== Ingredients == * ¾ lb boneless skinless [[chicken breasts]], cooked and cut into 2-inch cubes * 1 cup [[celery]], diagonally sliced * ⅔ cup [[snow peas]], trimmed * ⅓ cup [[red bell peppers]], seeded and diced * ⅔ cup [[apples]], unpeeled and diced (we use [[Gala apple|Gala]]) * 2 tablespoons [[vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons [[canola oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[sugar]] * ¾ teaspoon [[paprika]] * ¾ teaspoon [[celery seeds]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]], to taste
== Directions == # Combine all salad ingredients. # Whisk together the dressing ingredients. # Pour the dressing over the salad and serve on a bed of greens.
== Nutritional information == Per serving %DV (Calculated for 1 serving = 188 g) * Calories 228 (Calories from Fat 95 / 41%) | Total Fat 10.6g 16% (Saturated Fat 1.0 g 4%, Polyunsat. Fat 3.1 g, Monounsat. Fat 5.8 g, Trans Fat 0.0 g) | Cholesterol 49 mg 16% | Sodium 77 mg 3% | Potassium 378 mg 10% | Total Carbohydrate 12.3 g 4% (Dietary Fiber 1.8 g 7%, Sugars 10.1 g) | Protein 20.6 g 41% | Vitamin A 916 mcg 18% | Vitamin B6 0.6 mg 28% | Vitamin B12 0.3 mcg 5% | Vitamin C 36 mg 60% | Vitamin E 2 mcg 7% | Calcium 36 mg 3% | Magnesium 35 mg 8% | Iron 1mg 7% | Alcohol 0.0 g |Caffeine 0.0 mg
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Snow pea Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * makes 12 servings
== Ingredients == * 5 pounds (2,400 g) skinless, boneless [[chicken breasts]] * ¾ cup (150 g) non-fat [[sour cream]] * ¾ cup (150 g) non-fat [[mayonnaise]] * 2 tablespoons (30 ml) [[white wine vinegar]] * 4 [[celery]] ribs, strings removed, and cut into small dice * ½ cup (75 g) [[walnuts]] * ¼ cup (12 g) chopped fresh [[tarragon]] * freshly grated [[pepper]] * extra [[tarragon]] for garnish
== Directions == # Poach the [[chicken]] breasts in simmering broth until cooked through, about 15 minutes. # Drain, cool, and cut into bite-sized pieces. # In a small bowl, combine the [[sour cream]], [[mayonnaise]] and [[vinegar]]. # Combine the [[chicken]] and dressing. (can be made ahead and refrigerated to this point 1 day in advance). # Before serving, add the [[celery]], [[walnuts]], [[tarragon]] and [[pepper]] to taste. # Place mixture in a large serving bowl. # Garnish with [[tarragon]].
== Nutritional information == Per ½-cup serving: * 271 calories (19% calories from fat) | 46 g protein) | 6 g total fat (0.9 g saturated fat)) | 7 g carbohydrates) | 1 g dietary fiber) | 111 mg cholesterol) | 253 mg sodium * diabetic exchanges: 6 very lean protein, ½ carbohydrate (bread/starch)
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Tarragon Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:White wine vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == I love this stuff!!!! I think I could wipe the whole bowl of this. It is just the best stuff * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 head [[napa cabbage]] * 2 pkg. [[ramen noodles]], broken into pieces. discard seasoning pkt. * 1 stick [[butter]] * ¼ cup [[oil]] * ½ cup packed [[brown sugar]] * ¼ cup [[vinegar]] (I like [[apple cider vinegar]]) * 2 heaping tbsp [[soy sauce]] * [[black pepper]] to taste (½ tsp) * 1 cup roasted [[sunflower seeds]] (I like honey roasted) * ½ cup [[almond]] slices or slivers * 2 bunches [[green onion]], chopped small
== Directions == # Brown noodles in butter. # Set aside. # Mix oil, brown sugar, soy sauce and pepper in small saucepan. # Boil for 2 minutes. # Cool cut the napa cabbage up in bite size pieces, add the nuts and onions. # Add the noodles. # Just before serving add the oil, sugar mixture.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Ramen Recipes]] [[Category:Napa cabbage Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Sunflower seed Recipes]]

page.title: Warm Salad of Mustard Greens and Black-eyed Peas

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Mason Estate in Fate, Texas in 1991. * Contributed by [http:…"
revision.text:
== Description == This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Mason Estate in Fate, Texas in 1991. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 [[bacon]] slices chopped * 12 cups torn [[mustard greens]] stems removed * ¼ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[black pepper]] * 1 tablespoon extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * ½ cup chopped [[green onions]] * 2 teaspoons [[caraway seeds]] * 3 [[garlic]] cloves minced * 1 [[jalapeño pepper]] seeded and chopped * 16 ounce can [[black-eyed peas]] rinsed and drained * ¼ cup [[balsamic vinegar]]
== Directions == # Cook bacon in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp. # Remove bacon from pan reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in pan then set bacon aside. # Add greens and cook 4 minutes. # Combine greens, salt and black pepper in a large bowl then set aside. # Add oil to pan then stir in onions, caraway seeds, garlic and jalapeño then cook 1 minute. # Add peas and cook 1 minute. # Stir in vinegar and bring to a boil. # Add pea mixture to greens mixture then sprinkle with reserved bacon.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Mustard greens Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Caraway seed Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Jalapeno pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Black-eyed pea Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by Kim at [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 large [[tomato]] * 1 [[cucumber]] * 1 [[Holland bell pepper|orange bell pepper]] * 2 small [[summer squash|yellow squash]] * Wish-Bone [[romano]] [[basil]] vinaigrette (or favorite vinaigrette)
== Directions == # Peel [[cucumber]] if desired. # Cut all veggies into bite size pieces. # Pour over enough vinaigrette to just coat the vegetables. # Do not drown them. # Eat right away or chill and serve later.
== Kim's Note == You can use any color [[bell pepper]]. We just used the orange to give some extra color. You could also add any extra vegetables you may like.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Holland bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Summer squash Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]]

__NOTOC__ == Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * 12 boneless skinless [[chicken breast]] tenders * 1 cup [[buttermilk]] * 1 tbsp [[hot pepper sauce]] * 1½ cups [[self-rising flour]] * ¾ tsp [[salt]] * [[vegetable oil]] for frying * 8 oz pkg [[Spring salad mix|salad mix]] * 2 medium [[tomatoes]], cut into wedges * ½ cup [[ranch-style dressing]]
== Directions == # In a pie plate, combine buttermilk and pepper sauce. # On wax paper, mix flour and salt. # Dip chicken pieces into buttermilk, then roll in flour. # Dip again in buttermilk and roll again in flour. # In skillet, heat ¼ inch oil, cook chicken 5 min. or until deep golden and done. # Drain on paper towels. # To serve, in large bowl, toss salad mix, tomatoes, and dressing. # Top with chicken.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Lunch Recipes]] [[Category:Buttermilk Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]]

== Description == A salad to go with the paella * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 cups [[plum tomato]]es, chopped * 1 [[cucumber]], seeded, peeled and diced * ¼ cup chopped [[onion]] * ⅓ cup fresh [[cilantro]], chopped * 1 [[jalapeno pepper]], seeded and diced (I usually leave this out) * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients and mix well. # Allow salad to sit at room temperature for about an hour to allow flavors to blend.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Jalapeno pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[chicken]], cooked * 1 cup [[rice]], cooked * 1 cup [[celery]] * ¾ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 cup [[mushrooms]], sliced * 1 tsp chopped [[onion]] * 1 tsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 tsp [[salt]] * 1 can [[cream of chicken]] soup, undiluted * 1 cup [[water chestnuts]]
=== Topping === * ½ stick [[margarine]] * ½ cup [[almonds]] * 1 cup crushed [[corn flakes]]
== Directions == # Mix all ingredients next day put in casserole. # In separate pan melt margarine, and stir in crushed corn flakes and slivered almonds. # Spoon over casserole. # Bake for 35 minutes, uncovered, in 350°F degree oven.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Water chestnut Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Canned chicken soup Recipes]] [[Category:Cornflake crumb Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Yield: about 12 servings
== Ingredients == * 3 envelopes unflavored [[gelatin]] * ½ cup cold [[water]] * 1 (15¾ oz) can crushed [[pineapple]], undrained * 2 cups [[sugar]] * 4 cups fresh [[cranberries]] * ½ cup seedless [[green grapes]] * 1 cup finely chopped [[pecans]]
== Directions == # Soften gelatin in cold water, set aside. # Drain pineapple; reserving juice. # Add enough water to juice to make 3½ cups. # Bring juice mixture and sugar to a boil, add cranberries, and cook 7 – 10 minutes or until berries pop. # Stir in softened gelatin. # Chill until consistency of unbeaten egg white. # Stir in grapes, pecans, and pineapple. # Pour into a lightly oiled 8-cup mold. # Chill until firm.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Holiday Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Green grape Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]]

== Ingredients === * ½ to ¾ lb thin, tender [[rhubarb]], trimmed and cleaned * 2 [[Granny Smith apple]]s * 2 stalks [[celery]], diced * 4 [[scallions]], trimmed and sliced * ½ cup [[sour cream]] * ¼ cup crumbled [[blue cheese]] * ¼ cup chopped, toasted [[walnuts]]
== Directions == # Cut [[rhubarb]] into ¼-inch-long pieces. # Peel, core and dice [[apple]]s. # Combine [[rhubarb]], [[apple]]s, [[celery]], and scallions in mixing bowl, stirring to mix. # Stir in [[sour cream]] and [blue [cheese]] until ingredients are evenly coated. # Sprinkle with [[walnuts]], and serve.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Granny Smith apple Recipes]] [[Category:Rhubarb Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 pkg black [[gelatin dessert mix|raspberry Jell-O]] * 1 cup [[rhubarb]] (frozen or fresh) heated * ½ cup cold [[water]] * ½ cup [[pineapple juice]] * ½ cup chopped [[celery]] * ½ cup chopped [[nuts]]
== Directions == # Mix and put in refrigerator until jelled.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Rhubarb Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple juice Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Nut Recipes]]

page.title: Mushroom, Apple and Goat Cheese Salad

revision.text:
== Description == If you receive candied or spiced nuts as a holiday gift, try them on this salad for a special touch. To splurge, use a variety of mushrooms such as shiitake, portobello, oyster or enoki. Often grocers carry a gourmet mushroom mix. Standard white mushrooms will yield tasty results too.
Make the vinaigrette up to two days ahead and refrigerate in an airtight container. Let it come to room temperature and whisk before serving. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: ''Southern'' Living 2007 Holiday Dinners * Makes 6 – 8 servings and about 1 cup of vinaigrette
== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[walnut]] halves * 1 tbsp [[butter]] * 1 lb assorted [[mushrooms]], trimmed and coarsely chopped * [[#Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette|Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette]], divided (recipe follows) * 1 (4-oz) package [[arugula]], thoroughly washed * 1 large [[Cameo apple]], thinly sliced * 3 oz [[goat cheese]], crumbled
=== Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette === * ½ cup [[olive oil]] * ⅓ cup [[balsamic vinegar]] * 1 tbsp chopped fresh [[parsley]] * 1 tbsp chopped fresh [[thyme]] * 2 tbsp [[honey]] * [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Place walnuts in a single layer on a baking sheet. # Bake at 350°F for 8 – 10 minutes or until toasted. # Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat, add mushrooms, and saute 6 minutes until tender. # Stir in 2 tbsp [[#Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette|Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette]]. # Remove from heat, and let cool 15 minutes. # Toss together arugula, apple, mushrooms and desired amount of honey-balsamic vinaigrette. # Transfer to a serving dish, and sprinkle with toasted walnuts and goat cheese.
=== Honey-Balsamic Vinaigrette === # Whisk together first 5 ingredients until blended. # Whisk in salt and pepper to taste.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Arugula Recipes]] [[Category:Cameo apple Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]]

page.title: Watercress Strawberry Salad with Homemade Poppy Seed Dressing

revision.text:
[[File:Strawberry-salad2-502x222.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Description == Purchased from the O'Reilly Estate in Fort Worth, Texas in 1988. Date and source unknown. This is a great summer salad when [[strawberries]] are fresh and plentiful. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Cat's Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 4 cups torn [[salad greens]] * 1 cup [[watercress]] * 1 cup sliced hulled [[strawberries]] * ½ half of a small [[red onion]], thinly sliced * [[#Poppy seed dressing|poppy seed dressing]] (below)
=== Poppy seed dressing === * 1 teaspoon [[honey]] * ½ teaspoon [[dry mustard]] * ½ teaspoon [[paprika]] * ¼ teaspoon [[garlic powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[poppy seeds]] * ¼ teaspoon [[ginger|ground ginger]] * ¼ cup fresh [[orange juice]] * ¼ cup [[mayonnaise]]
== Directions == # In a salad bowl place greens, watercress, [[strawberries]] and [[onion]]. # Top with dressing and toss to coat. # Combine ingredients in jar, shake well.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Dry mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Poppy seed Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 block [[tofu]] * 1½ lbs fresh [[spinach]] leaves * 1 pkg (16 oz) [[bean sprouts]] * ½ cup [[rice vinegar]] * ½ cup [[soy sauce]] * minced [[garlic]] to taste
== Directions == # Dice tofu into bite-sized pieces. # Wash spinach thoroughly and tear into bite-sized pieces. # Wash bean sprouts. # Place tofu in a large serving bowl, top with spinach and bean sprouts. # Top with garlic to taste. # Pour vinegar and soy sauce over salad. # Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tofu Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Bean sprout Recipes]] [[Category:Rice vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 cup finely chopped [[celery]] * ½ cup sliced [[water chestnuts]] * 1 lb [[bacon]], fried and crumbled * 2 tsp [[sugar]] * ½ cup chopped [[onion]] * 1 cup shredded [[cheddar]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]]
== Directions == # Mix and chill. # Two hours before serving, add 6 cups popped, small white popcorn. # Return to refrigerator.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Water chestnut Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]]

== Description == This is a wonderful salad and it has many possibilities. * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Makes 10 to 12 servings
== Ingredients == * 6 cups [[iceberg lettuce]], [[romaine]], [[leaf lettuce]], [[bibb lettuce]] or [[spinach]] * sugar * 1 (10 oz) pkg. frozen [[peas]], thawed or 2 cups sliced fresh [[cauliflower]], [[broccoli]], [[zucchini]], [[carrot]]s, [[mushrooms]], or canned [[water chestnuts]], drained and sliced * 4 hard-cooked [[eggs]], sliced * ½ lb [[bacon]], crisp-cooked, drained and crumbled * 1½ cups shredded [[Swiss cheese|Swiss]], [[American cheese|American]], [[cheddar]], [[colby]], [[Monterey jack]] or [[brick cheese]] (6 oz) * ¾ cup [[mayonnaise]] or [[salad dressing]] * 1½ tsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 tsp [[paprika]] * ⅛ tsp ground [[red pepper]] * 2 tbsp sliced [[green onion]]
== Directions == # Place lettuce or spinach in bottom of a large salad bowl; sprinkle with a little salt, pepper and sugar. # Spoon desired vegetable evenly atop. # Arrange egg slices and bacon over vegetable. # Top with desired shredded cheese. # Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, paprika and red pepper. # Spread mayonnaise mixture over top of salad, sealing to edge of bowl. # Cover and chill salad in the refrigerator up to 24 hours. # Before serving, toss to coat the vegetables. # Enjoy.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Twenty-four hour Vegetable Salad I}}
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Leaf lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Bibb lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Water chestnut Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss cheese Recipes]] [[Category:American cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Colby Recipes]] [[Category:Jack cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Brick cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

revision.comment: clean up, typos fixed: tomatos → tomatoes
revision.text:
I discovered a new healthy [[avocado]] recipe with Mediterrenean taste. My secret is to use steamed [[spinach]] and [[green onions|scallions]] together with [[lemon juice]] and [[kiwi]].
== Ingredients == * 1 big or 2 small size genuine [[Hass Avocado|California avocado]](s) * 1 to 2 [[kiwi|kiwi fruit]] (not very soft and sweet) * ½ pound fresh [[spinach]] (baby [[spinach]] preferred) * 5 to 6 [[green onions|scallions]] * ½ [[green bell pepper|bell pepper]] * 1 to 2 [[plum tomato]] or ½ [[tomato]] * [[salt]], to taste * [[lemon juice]] (1 whole [[lemon]])
== Directions == # Chop the [[green onions|scallions]], [[bell pepper]] fine. # Cut the [[kiwi]]s and tomatoes in fine cubes. # Mesh the [[avocado]]s. # Mix ingredients. # Steam the [[spinach]] in a pan with a very little [[water]], wait till [[water]] gets evaporated almost totally and spinach should get softened. # Add the [[spinach]] on top. # Again mix them by adding [[salt]] and [[lemon juice]].
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Kiwi Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == Contributed by Lilly at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * 6 – 8 servings == Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[rice]] * 1 c…"
revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by Lilly at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * 6 – 8 servings
== Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[rice]] * 1 cup [[olive oil]] * juice of 1 [[lemon juice|lemon]] * 1 tsp grated [[lemon rind]] * [[salt]] to taste * [[pepper]] to taste * dash of [[cayenne]] * 1½ cups frozen [[corn]] kernels * 1 cup fresh, flaked [[crab]]meat * 1 [[red bell pepper|red pepper]], seeded, cut in fine strips * 1 [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], seeded, cut in fine strips * ¼ cup chopped [[chives]] * 6 sweet [[gherkin]]s, coarsely chopped * 10 [[walnuts]], chopped
== Directions == # Heat rice in top of double boiler. # Add oil and mix well. # Add lemon juice, rind, salt, pepper and cayenne. # Allow to cool to room temp. # In med saucepan, boil corn kernels in salted water 2 min only. # Transfer to colander and rinse with cold water until corn is well chilled. # When rice is cool, add remaining ingredients, except walnuts. # Toss to mix well. # Sprinkle walnuts on top.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon peel Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Crab Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Pickle Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]]

== Description == For dressing I use fat-free [[yogurt]] with [[balsamic vinegar]] and some [[granulated sugar|sugar]]. [[Yogurt]] or [[sour cream]] with dried [[Italian salad dressing]] would also be good.
== Ingredients == * 2 cup [[cracked wheat]] or [[wheat berries]] * 2 cup chopped [[tomato]]es * 1 cup chopped [[cucumber]]s * 1 chopped [[purple onion]] * fat-free [[yogurt]] * [[balsamic vinegar]] * [[granulated sugar|sugar]]
== Directions == # Start with 2 cups of cooked [[cracked wheat]]. # I just boil it until its done. # Actually I think you are supposed to use boiled [[wheat berries]]. # Add an equal amount of chopped [[tomato]]es and half as much chopped [[cucumber]]s and chopped purple [[onion]] to taste.
[[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Bermuda onion Recipes]] [[Category:Bulgur Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Locto Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Wheat berry Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

== Description == Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * ½ cup plain [[yogurt]] * 3 tablespoons [[curry powder]], divided * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[cayenne pepper|ground red pepper]] * 4 boneless, skinless [[chicken breasts]] * 3 cups cooked [[rice]] (cooked in [[chicken broth]]), cooled * 1 medium-size [[red bell pepper|red pepper]], julienned * ½ medium-size [[red onion]], sliced * 1 cup [[snow peas]], julienned * 2 [[green onion]]s, sliced * ⅓ cup [[raisins]] * ¼ cup unsalted [[peanut]]s, chopped * ¼ cup prepared light [[Italian dressing]]
== Directions == # Combine [[yogurt]], 2 tablespoons [[curry]] powder, [[garlic]], [[salt]] and [[cayenne pepper|ground red pepper]] in medium bowl; mix well. # Place [[chicken]] in mixture; stir to coat. # Cover and marinate 4 to 6 hours in refrigerator. # Grill or broil [[chicken]] and cut into strips; refrigerate. # Combine [[rice]], remaining 1 tablespoon [[curry]] powder, [[red bell pepper|red pepper]], [[red onion]], [[snow peas]], [[green onion]]s, [[raisins]] and [[peanut]]s; mix well. # Cover and refrigerate one hour. # Pour dressing over salad; toss. # To serve, place [[chicken]] strips over salad.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Curry Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Snow pea Recipes]] [[Category:Peanut Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 head [[lettuce]] * 1 large [[white onion]] * 16 ounce can [[ranch-style beans]] * 1 package [[corn chips]] * 2 [[avocado]]s ripe but not too soft * 2 [[tomatoes]] * 1 pound grated [[cheddar cheese]] * 1 bottle [[Catalina dressing]] * 1 pound [[ground beef]] * 2 tablespoons [[lime juice]]
== Directions == # Sauté ground beef then drain well and set aside to cool. # Tear lettuce into pieces. # Dice tomatoes and onion. # Grate cheese. # Drain beans. # Break corn chips into smaller pieces. # Chop avocado and sprinkle with lemon juice lightly tossing to coat. # Toss together all ingredients except corn chips. # Top with chips just before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bean Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Ground beef Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Corn chip Recipes]]

page.title: Avocado Citrus Salad with Curry Dressing

revision.text:
[[File:Mixed_citrus_avocado_salad_plate.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Ingredients == * 2 naval [[oranges]] * 2 ruby red [[grapefruit]]s * 2 heads [[Boston lettuce]], torn * 3 large [[Hass avocado|California avocados]], peeled * ½ medium [[purple onion]], sliced and separated into rings
=== Curry dressing === * ¾ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ⅓ cup reserved citrus [[juice]]s * 1 tablespoon [[honey]] * 2 teaspoons [[curry powder]] * 2 drops [[hot sauce]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[salt]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Peel and section [[oranges]] and [[grapefruit]] over a bowl, reserving juices. # Set aside ⅓ cup juices for [[#Curry dressing|curry dressing]]. # Cut [[avocado]]s into thin slices. # Arrange [[avocado]], [[onion]], [[orange]] sections, and [[grapefruit]] sections over [[lettuce]]; drizzle with [[#Curry dressing|curry dressing]]. # Serve immediately.
=== Curry dressing === # Process all ingredients in a food processor or [[blender]] until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Curry Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit juice Recipes]]

== Description == Here's is a great simple salad. With just a touch of the southwest. MANGIA!!! by Nana Lee * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * © 2007 Recipezaar. All Rights Reserved. http://www.recipezaar.com * 5 minutes | 5 minutes prep * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 6 cups torn [[romaine lettuce]] * 1 (15 ounce) can [[black beans]], rinsed, drained * 1 cup frozen [[corn]], thawed * ¾ cup [[salsa]] * ½ cup Mexican-style shredded [[Monterey jack]] and [[cheddar]] cheese blend * ¼ cup [[ranch dressing]] * 1 cup [[tortilla chips]], broken
== Directions == # Arrange lettuce in bottom of glass serving bowl or on serving plate. # Layer beans, corn, salsa and cheese evenly over top. # Drizzle with dressing; sprinkle with chips. # You can change the cheese and beans to your favorites.
== Nutritional information == Calculated for 1 serving (295g), not including 1 cup tortilla chips: * Calories 328 (from Fat 119 (36%) | Total Fat 13.2g 20% DV (Saturated Fat 4.1g 20% DV, Polyunsat. Fat 0.7g, Monounsat. Fat 1.4g, Trans Fat 0.0g) | Cholesterol 16mg 5% DV | Sodium 518mg 21% DV | Potassium 800mg 22% DV | Total Carbohydrate 39.9g 13% DV (Dietary Fiber 12.5g 50% DV, Sugars 3.0g) | Protein 15.9g 31% DV | Vitamin A 4357mcg 87% DV | Vitamin B6 0.3mg 14% DV | Vitamin B12 0.1mcg 2% DV | Vitamin C 20mg 34% DV | Vitamin E 0mcg 2% DV | Calcium 176mg 17% DV | Magnesium 102mg 25% DV | Iron 3mg 19% DV | Alcohol 0.0g | Caffeine 0.0mg
__NOTOC__
