== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 cups [[cauliflower]] * 3 cups [[broccoli]] * 1 cup [[carrot]]s * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * 1 cup [[sour cream]] * 1 pkg. original Hidden Valley [[salad dressing]] mix (not [[buttermilk]])
== Directions == # Cut up vegetables. # Mix together [[mayonnaise]], [[sour cream]] and [[salad dressing]] mix and toss lightly with vegetables. # Chill before serving.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]]

Submitted by Dick Miale and sampled at diabetes holiday food fest, Chesapeake General Hospital, Chesapeake, VA * recipe provided by EVMS (Eastern Virginia Medical School), Norfolk, VA
== Ingredients == * 1 medium [[orange]] * ½ cup raw [[cranberry|cranberries]] * [[sugar substitute]] equal to 1 tablespoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 pack sugar-free [[gelatin]], red * ¾ cup boiling [[water]] * ½ cup cold [[water]] * [[ice cubes]]
== Directions == # Quarter the orange and remove seeds, combine [[orange]] and [[cranberry|cranberries]] in food processor and chop finely. # Add [[sugar substitute]] and set aside. # Dissolve [[gelatin]] in boiling [[water]]. # Combine cold [[water]] and enough [[ice]] cubes to make 1 cup [[ice]] [[water]]. # Add [[water]] to [[gelatin]] and stir. # Set aside until [[ice cubes]] melt. # Add fruit mixture. # Pour into a 2 cup mold or an 8 inch square pan which has been sprayed with PAM. # Chill until firm.
== Nutritional information == 35 calories per serving
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Cranberry Recipes]] [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 3 cups [[beef]], cooked, cubed * ¾ cup [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], chopped * 5 large [[olives]], stuffed, sliced * 10 [[onion]]s, pickled, chopped * ⅛ tsp [[pepper]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * ¼ tsp [[dry mustard]] * 1 tsp [[dill]]weed * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup [[beer]] * 1 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * [[onion]]s, pickled, stuffed
== Directions == # Combine [[beef]], [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], sliced olives, and chopped pickled [[onion]]; chill. # Combine [[pepper]], [[salt]], [[mustard]], [[dill]]weed, [[mayonnaise]], [[beer]], and [[lemon juice]]; mix well and add to meat mixture. # Toss lightly. # Chill at least 1 hour. # Garnish with [[pickled onions]] and olives.
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Beef Recipes]] [[Category:Black olive Recipes]] [[Category:Dill leaf Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Dry mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes using beer]] [[Category:Pickled onion Recipes]]

== Description == Nancy O'Brion notes: I would make this work for me as a diabetic. I enjoy salads of any kind.
== Ingredients == * 1½ cups [[quinoa]] * 3 cups [[water]] * 1 [[green bell pepper]], chopped * 1 [[red bell pepper]], chopped * ¼ cup [[scallion]]s, chopped * ¼ cup [[red onion]], chopped * ¼ cup [[dill]], [[cilantro]], or [[parsley]], finely chopped * 1 recipe [[Savory Salad Dressing]] or [[Honey-Vinegar Dressing]] * freshly ground [[pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Rinse the [[quinoa]] well before cooking to remove its slightly [[bitter]] coat. # Place the [[quinoa]] and [[water]] in a saucepan. # Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed. # Combine the chopped vegetables in a bowl, including the fresh chopped herb of your choice. # Mix well. # Add the cooked [[quinoa]]. # Toss gently and add dressing of your choice. # Mix well. # Add the cooked [[quinoa]]. # Toss gently and add dressing of your choice. # Toss again and add [[pepper]] to taste. # Cover and chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
== Nutritional information == Food exchanges per serving: 1 starch/bread + 1 fat + 1 vegetable
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Quinoa Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 12 oz [[radishes]], trimmed * 2 tbsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] or [[sugar substitute]] * 2 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 1 tbsp [[orange flower water]] * [[salt]] * 2 navel [[oranges]]
== Directions == # Shred [[radishes]] in a food processor or "grate" with a blender. # Allow excess liquid to drain of and add [[salt]] to taste. # Chill. # Peel and slice [[oranges]]. # Just before serving add the sugar, orange flower water and lemon juice. # Arrange all together and dust with [[cinnamon]].
== Nutritional information == Food exchanges per serving: 1 fruit exchange.
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Orange flower water Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 3 cups [[rice]], regular, cooked, cold * 1 cup [[corn]], whole kernel, cooked, cold * 1 cup [[celery]], thinly sliced * ¼ cup [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], chopped * ¼ cup [[olives]], stuffed, sliced * 3 tbsp [[onion]], minced * ¼ cup [[dill pickle]], chopped * ¾ tsp [[salt]] * [[black pepper]], to taste * ¼ tsp [[curry powder]] * 2 tbsp [[chutney]] * ⅓ cup [[French dressing]] * crisp [[salad greens]] * 2 [[egg]]s, hard-cooked, sliced
== Directions == # Combine first 9 ingredients. # Stir [[curry powder]] and chutney into French dressing; pour over salad. # Toss lightly, and chill until serving time. # Mound on crisp salad greens. # Garnish with slices of hard-cooked [[egg]]s.
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Olive Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]] [[Category:Curry Recipes]] [[Category:Pickle Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 3 packs [[gelatin]], unflavored * 1 cup [[water]], cold * ¾ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1½ tsp [[salt]] * 3 cups [[water]], coiling * ⅓ cup [[vinegar]] * ¼ cup [[lime juice]] * 2 large [[apple]]s, unpeeled and finely chopped (about 2-½ cups) * 1 cup [[green pepper]], finely chopped * ½ cup [[green onion]], chopped * [[lettuce]] * [[apple]] wedges, optional
== Directions == # Soften [[gelatin]] in cold [[water]]; stir well. # Add [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[salt]]. # Gradually add boiling [[water]], stirring until [[gelatin]] is dissolved. # Add [[vinegar]] and [[lime juice]]. # Chill until consistency of unbeaten [[egg white]]. # Fold in [[apple]], [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], and [[onion]]. # Spoon into 12 (½ cup) individual molds, and chill until set. # Unmold on lettuce-lined plate, and garnish with [[apple]] wedges, if desired.
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 cup [[wild rice]], cooked * 1 [[apple]], chopped * 1 cup seedless [[grapes]] * 1 cup chopped [[celery]] * 2 tbsp [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tbsp plain low-fat [[yogurt]] * 2 tbsp chopped dry roasted [[peanut]]s
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients except [[nuts]] in a bowl. # Toss to mix. # Cover and chill thoroughly, about 3 to 4 hours. # Sprinkle the [[nuts]] on top just before serving.
== Nutritional information == For ¼ recipe: * 157 calories | 20g carbohydrate | 3g protein | 7g fat | 138mg sodium | 193mg potassium | 4mg cholesterol * Exchanges: 1 bread | ½ fruit | 1 fat
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Grape Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Wild rice Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Peanut Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[wild rice]] * 1½ cups [[water]] * 2 cup [[turkey meat|turkey]], cooked chopped * 1 cup [[celery]], chopped * ½ cup [[red bell pepper|sweet red pepper]], chopped (optional) * ⅓ cup [[raisins]] * 1 [[apple]], chopped * ¼ cup [[green onions]], chopped * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[red wine vinegar|red]] or [[white wine vinegar]] * ¼ tsp [[black pepper]] * ¼ tsp ground [[nutmeg]] * 2 tbsp fresh [[parsley]] leaves, chopped * chopped [[pecans]], for garnish
== Directions == # Cook the [[rice]] in the [[water]] until tender, about 50 minutes. # Cut the [[turkey]] into bite-size pieces. # Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and toss. # Cover and chill until ready to serve. # Sprinkle on the [[pecans]] just before serving.
== Nutritional information == For ¼ recipe * 422 calories | 42g carbohydrate | 24g protein | 18g fat | 344mg sodium | 503mg potassium | 54mg cholesterol * Exchanges: 3 lean meat, 1 bread, 1 ½ fruit, 2 fat
[[Category:Diabetic-friendly Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]] [[Category:Wild rice Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:White wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

== Description == What's for lunch? Whip up this flavorful chicken salad for a truly delicious (and healthy) midday meal. Serve this sensational salad as it is or try it inside half of a large scooped-out tomato or on top of fresh salad greens. In later phases, use it as a sandwich filling inside a whole wheat pita. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''The South Beach Diet® Quick & Easy Cookbook''. For information on the book [http://www.southbeachdiet.com/public/south-beach-diet-store/south-beach-diet-store.asp click here]. * Prep time: 15 minutes * Makes 4 (1 cup) servings
== Ingredients == * 1½ cups plain fat-free or low-fat [[yogurt]] * 1 tablespoon [[curry powder]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[ginger]] * 1½ pounds boneless, skinless [[chicken breasts]], cooked and cut into ½-inch cubes * 3 [[celery]] stalks, diced * ½ small [[red onion]], diced * ¼ cup chopped fresh [[cilantro]] * [[salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper ]]
== Directions == # Whisk together yogurt, curry powder, and ginger in a large mixing bowl. # Stir in chicken, celery, onion, and cilantro; season to taste with salt and pepper. # Serve at room temperature or refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving for more concentrated flavor.
== Nutritional information == 240 calories | 2.5 total fat (0.5 g sat) | 11 g carbohydrate | 44 g protein | 1 g fiber | 270 mg sodium
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Curry Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:South Beach Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

page.title: Cauliflower and Cherry Tomato Salad with Basil

revision.text:
== Description ==[[File:5126534660_4ff14a28ba_b.jpg|right|link=|300px]] I was surprised at how fast this disappeared. It can also be made with sherry vinegar. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Makes 8 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 medium [[cauliflower]] * 1 or 2 [[garlic]] cloves, finely chopped * ¼ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 tsp [[sugar]] * 12 [[cherry tomato]]es, halved * 1 medium [[red onion]], halved and thinly sliced * ⅓ cup chopped fresh [[basil]] * [[salt]] and freshly cracked [[black pepper]] to taste
== Directions == # Bring a large pot of water to a boil. # Meanwhile, remove and discard the leaves and core from the cauliflower; cut and separate into small florets. # Boil the florets for 2 minutes. # Drain the florets well, chill in ice-cold water, and drain well again. # Place the garlic, olive oil, vinegar and sugar in a salad bowl and whisk to combine. # Add the cauliflower and all other remaining ingredients and toss to coat. # Cover and let the flavours in the salad meld in the fridge for 30 minutes. # Toss again and serve.
== Nutritional information == * Calories 97 | Fat 7.2g |Carbs 8g |Sodium 13 mg |Fiber 2.8g
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cauliflower Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]]

== Description == Perk up a deli chicken salad with chopped apple and serve it with a just-baked dinner roll for a fabulous meal in minutes. * Contributed by Jenn B aka Mom2Sam and Tiny at [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Prep Time: 10 minutes | Start to Finish: 10 minutes * Makes: 2 servings
== Ingredients == * 2 Pillsbury® microwave frozen soft white dinner rolls (from 12.4-oz bag) * ⅔ cup plain [[chicken]] salad for sandwiches (from deli) * ¼ cup finely chopped red [[apple]] * 2 tablespoons chopped [[cashews]] * [[lettuce]], if desired
== Directions == # Microwave rolls as directed on bag. # In small bowl, mix remaining ingredients. # On 2 individual serving plates, serve chicken mixture on beds of lettuce with rolls on the side, or split warm rolls horizontally and fill with chicken mixture.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * Calories 330 | Calories from fat 140 | Total Fat 16g 24% DV (Saturated 3g 15% DV, Trans Fat 1g) | Cholesterol l30mg 10% DV | Sodium 370mg 15% DV | Total Carbohydrate 35g 12% DV (Dietary Fiber 1g 4% DV, Sugars 8g) | Protein 14g | Vitamin A 4% DV | Vitamin C 6% DV | Calcium 0% DV | Iron 10% DV * Exchanges: 1½ starch | 1 other carbohydrate | 1 medium-fat meat | 2 fat * Carbohydrate Choices: 2
__NOTOC__ [[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Cashew Recipes]]

page.title: Chicken Salad with Apples and Cucumber

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Submitted by: Jill Karlya via dLife * [http://www.dlife.com/dLife/do/recipe/ShowRecipe?recipeId=3017 Original recipe] * 4 Servings
== Ingredients == * 1 cup chopped cooked [[chicken]] * ⅓ cup chopped cored [[apple]], chopped seeded [[cucumber]], or finely chopped [[celery]] * 1 hard-cooked [[egg]], peeled and chopped * 2 tablespoons plain low-fat [[yogurt]] * 2 tablespoons light [[mayonnaise]] or [[salad dressing]] * [[salt]] and [[black pepper]] * 8 slices [[whole wheat bread]]
== Directions == # Stir together the chicken, apple and egg in a medium-size bowl. # Add yogurt and mayonnaise, stir to combine. # Season to taste with salt and pepper. # Serve immediately or cover and chill up to 4 hours. # Spread chicken mixture on half of the bread slices. # Top with remaining bread slices. # If desired, cut away crusts. # Cut each sandwich into 4 triangles or squares. # Great to serve as finger sandwiches at a special luncheon.
== Nutritional information == * Calories 244 | Total Fat 9g | Saturated Fat 2g | Cholesterol 87mg | Sodium 432mg | Carbohydrate 26g | Sugar 12g | Fiber 4g | Protein 17g
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sandwich Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]]

This is from epicurious and it's simply fabulous! Super easy as it starts with a store bought cooked chicken. by Annacia * © 2007 Recipezaar. All Rights Reserved. http://www.recipezaar.com * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Prep time: 20 minutes * Recipe makes 6 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 (2 lb) rotisserie-cooked [[chicken]], at room temperature * 1 medium [[white onion]], chopped * [[black bean]]s, rinsed and drained * ½ cup packed fresh [[cilantro]] stems * 1 tablespoon canned [[chipotle chile]]s in adobo (to taste) * ⅓ cup [[olive oil]] * ⅓ cup fresh [[lime juice]] * ¾ teaspoon [[salt]] * ¾ teaspoon [[black pepper]] * 2 firm-ripe [[California avocado]]s, halved, pitted, and left unpeeled * 3 ounces [[corn chips]], such as Fritos corn chips (1½ cups) * 1 [[romaine lettuce]] hearts, separated into leaves
== Directions == # Remove chicken from bone in large chunks, with some skin if desired, and toss together with onion and black beans in a large bowl. # Purée cilantro, chipotles, oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper in a blender, then add to chicken mixture. # Cut avocado into ½-inch cubes, without cutting through peel. # Toss chicken mixture with chips. # Scoop avocado into chicken mixture with a spoon. # Serve salad on romaine leaves.
== Nutritional information == Calculated for 1 serving (281g) not including chipotle chiles in adobo: * Calories 447 | Calories from Fat 299 (67%) | Total Fat 33.3g 51% (Saturated Fat 5.7g 28%, Polyunsat. Fat 6.2g, Monounsat. Fat 18.7g, Trans Fat 0.1g) | Cholesterol 52 mg 17% | Sodium 441 mg 18% | Potassium 754 mg 21% | Total Carbohydrate 20.6g 6% (Dietary Fiber 7.3g 29%, Sugars 2.6g) | Protein 19.8g 39% | Vitamin A 6336mcg 126% | Vitamin B6 0.5 mg 26% | Vitamin B12 0.2mcg 3% | Vitamin C 35 mg 59% | Vitamin E 3mcg 10% | Calcium 82 mg 8% | Magnesium 60 mg 15% | Iron 2 mg 13% | Alcohol 0.0g | Caffeine 0.0 mg
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Chipotle pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Black bean Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Corn chip Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

page.title: Chopped Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.diabetic-recipes.com/recipes/JAN00_5.2.htm Original recipe] * Makes 8 servings
== Ingredients == * 8 cups (440 g) chopped [[iceberg lettuce]] * 1 medium [[cucumber]], seeded and chopped * 3 [[plum tomato]]es, diced * 2 ribs [[celery]], thinly sliced * 8 [[radish]]es, trimmed and thinly sliced * 1 medium [[green bell pepper]], seeded and diced * 1 medium [[carrot]], peeled and diced
=== Dressing === * ⅓ cup (80 ml) [[buttermilk]] * ½ ounce (15 g) crumbled [[blue cheese]] * 1 tablespoon (15 ml) light [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tablespoon (15 ml) [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon (5 ml) [[Worcestershire sauce]] * 1 teaspoon (5 ml) well-drained [[capers]] (optional) * ½ teaspoon (2.5 ml) freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Combine the lettuce, cucumber, tomato, celery, radishes, bell pepper, and carrot in a large salad bowl. # Lightly toss.
=== Dressing === # In a small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients. # Drizzle over salad and toss lightly to coat.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 44 calories (28% calories from fat) | 2 g protein | 2 g total fat (0.6 g saturated fat) | 7 g carbohydrates | 2 g dietary fiber | 2 mg cholesterol | 78 mg sodium * Diabetic exchanges: ½ carbohydrate (1½ vegetable) | ½ fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Buttermilk Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Caper Recipes]]

== Description == The best thing about tofu - besides its nutritional value - is the way it carries other flavors, such as the tanginess of this sesame dressing. Serve this warm salad with crunchy breadsticks and a tall glass of iced jasmine tea. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''Eating Well Diabetes Cookbook'' * Formatted by Chupa Babi in MC: 06.26.07 * Active time: 25 minutes | Total time: 25 minutes * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 3 tablespoons [[canola oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[rice vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[honey]] * 2 teaspoons reduced-sodium [[soy sauce]] * 1 teaspoon toasted [[sesame oil]] * 1 teaspoon minced fresh [[ginger]] * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 x 14-ounce package [[extra-firm tofu|extra-firm, water-packed tofu]], rinsed, patted dry and cut into 1-inch cubes * 8 cups mixed [[salad greens]] * 2 medium [[carrot]]s, peeled, halved lengthwise and sliced * 1 large [[cucumber]], chopped
== Directions == # Whisk canola oil, vinegar, honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger and salt in a bowl. # Place tofu and 2 tablespoons of the dressing in a large nonstick skillet. # Cook over medium-high heat, turning every 2 to 3 minutes, until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes total. # Remove from the heat, add 1 tablespoon of the dressing to the pan and stir to coat. # Toss greens, carrots and cucumber with the remaining dressing. # Serve immediately, topped with the warm tofu.
== Notes == * Make ahead tip: The dressing (Step 1) will keep, covered, in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Whisk just before using. * ChupaNote: tossed in a julienned [[red bell pepper]] and a thinly sliced [[red onion]] as well as a handful of [[sugar snap|sugar snap beans]]. Doubled all of the ingredients of the dressing and we used most of it over rice!!!!
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 237 calories | 16 g fat (2 g sat, 8 g mono) | 0 mg cholesterol | 16 g carbohydrate | 11 g protein | 5 g fiber | 454 mg sodium. * Nutrition bonus: Vitamin A (180% daily value) | Folate (41% dv) | Vitamin C (38% dv) | Calcium (29% dv). * Carbohydrate servings: 1½ * Exchanges: 3 vegetable | 1 medium-fat meat | 2 fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Extra-firm tofu Recipes]] [[Category:Rice vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]] [[Category:Sesame oil Recipes]] [[Category:ginger Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: Posted to www.sparkpeople.com by SparkPeople user POIFECT_NOT * Number of Servings: 4
== Ingredients == * 2 [[avocado]]s * 8 medium sized [[plum tomato|Roma (plum) tomatoes]] chopped * 1 regular [[tomato]] chopped * 1 cup of chopped [[onion]] * 1 cup chopped [[green bell pepper|green pepper]] * 1 or 2 chopped [[jalapeno pepper]]s * [[garlic]] about 6 to 8 tbsp or to your taste * 8 tbsp [[cilantro]], chopped * [[salt]] to taste
== Directions == # Set the avocados aside do not peel until ready to use. # Chop all the vegetables and mix together with the salt and lime juice. # You can add more or less jalapeno according to taste. # You should let this mixture chill at least an hour. # Then clean your avocados cut in half and serve the tomato mixture over the top.
== Nutritional information == Per Serving: * 213.7 Calories | 14.1g Total Fat | 1.9g Saturated Fat | 1.9g Polyunsaturated Fat | 8.6g Monounsaturated Fat | 0mg Cholesterol | 62.8mg Sodium | 943.1mg Potassium | 23.3g Total Carbs | 8.9g Dietary Fiber | 1.4g Sugars | 4.3g Protein
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Plum tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Jalapeno pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]]

page.title: Apple Spinach Salad with Thyme-Dijon Vinaigrette

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''Diabetic Living Diet'' * Prep time: 20 minutes | Total time: 20 minutes * Servings: 4 (1-cup) servings plus ⅔ cup of vinaigrette
== Ingredients == * 4 cups baby [[spinach]] * 1 medium [[Granny Smith apple]] * ¼ cup [[red onion]] * 2 tbsp [[dried cherries]] * ½ cup [[feta]] cheese, crumbled
=== Thyme-Dijon vinaigrette === * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup white or regular [[balsamic vinegar]] * 2 tsp snipped fresh [[thyme]] or ½ tsp crushed dried thyme * 1 tsp [[Dijon-style mustard]] * ¼ tsp [[salt]]
== Directions == === Apple spinach salad === # In a large bowl, toss together spinach, apple, onion, and cherries. # Shake Thyme-Dijon vinaigrette; drizzle onto salad. # Toss to coat. # If desired, top each serving with cheese.
=== Thyme-Dijon vinaigrette === # In a screw-top jar combine the vinaigrette ingredients. # Cover and shake well to mix. # Chill until ready to serve. # Make-ahead directions: Prepare the vinaigrette as directed. Cover and chill for up to 1 week. Serve the leftover vinaigrette with a tossed vegetable salad.
== Nutritional information == Per Serving: * 93 Calories | 6g Total Fat | 1g Saturated Fat | 96mg Sodium | 11g Carbs | 2g Dietary Fiber | 0mg Cholesterol1g Protein * Exchanges: 1 Vegetable | ½ fruit * Carb Choices: ½
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Granny Smith apple Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Dried cherry Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Thyme Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by Jenn B aka Mom2Sam and Tiny at [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: http://www.bettycrocker.com * Makes 4 Servings
== Ingredients == * 1 bag (16 ounces) [[lettuce]] or 1 small head lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces (6 cups) * 1½ cups cut-up cooked [[chicken]] (9 ounces) * 1 [[tomato]], cut into eighths * ⅓ cup [[Thousand Island dressing]] * ⅓ cup Betty Crocker® Bac~Os™ [[bacon bits|bacon flavor bits]] or chips * hard-cooked [[egg]] slices, if desired
== Directions == # Toss lettuce, chicken and tomato in large salad bowl; refrigerate. # Just before serving, toss with dressing and bacon flavor bits. # Garnish with hard-cooked egg slices.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * Calories 220 (Calories from Fat 115) | Fat 13g (Saturated 3g) | Cholesterol 50mg | Sodium 460mg | Potassium 740mg | Carbohydrate 8g (Dietary Fiber 3g) | Protein 21g * Diet Exchanges: 3 Lean Meat | 2 Vegetable * Weight Watcher Points: 5 Points
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[Basic Free Green Salad|basic free salad]] * 2 tbsp [[cheddar]] cheese, diced * 2 tbsp [[Swiss cheese]], diced * ¼ cup [[garbanzo beans]] * 2 tbsp [[peanut]]s * 1 slice [[whole wheat bread]], toasted and cut into cubes
== Directions == # In a large bowl mix the basic free salad with cheeses and garbanzo beans. # Top with the wheat [[bread]] cubes.
== Nutritional information == 1 serving = 3 meat, 2 fat, 1 bread
[[Category:Locto Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Peanut Recipes]]

page.title: Green Bean, Chickpea, and Tomato Salad

revision.text:
== Description == The salad holds well and can be tossed a few hours in advance--but leave out the salt until close to serving time, since it will cause the tomatoes to release their juice. Blanch the green beans up to a day ahead, and keep refrigerated. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''Cooking Light'' via WebMD * Yield: 6 servings
== Ingredients == * 2 cups [[green bean]]s, trimmed (8 oz) * 4 cups coarsely chopped [[tomato]] (about 2½ lb) * 1 cup thinly sliced [[red onion]] * ½ cup (2oz) crumbled [[feta]] cheese * 2 tbsp chopped fresh [[mint]] * 2 tbsp [[red wine vinegar]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * 2½ tsp extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ tsp [[black pepper]] * 1 (15½-oz) can [[chickpeas]] (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained
== Directions == # Place the beans in a large saucepan of boiling water, and cook 3 minutes. # Drain and plunge beans into ice water. # Drain. # Combine beans, tomato, and remaining ingredients in a large bowl; toss well to combine.
== Nutritional information == Per 1⅓ cups serving: * 157 Calories, 29% from Fat | 5.1g Fat | 1.8g Sat | 2g Mono | 0.8g Poly | 6.2g Protein | 8mg Cholesterol | 91mg Calcium | 463mg Sodium | 24.4g Carbs | 5.9g Fiber | 2.1mg Iron
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Mint Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''The New Family Cookbook for People with Diabetes'' * Yield: 3¾ cups (4 servings)
== Ingredients == * 12 oz fresh small [[green bean]]s, ends trimmed * 8 fresh [[mushrooms]], sliced * ½ cup chopped [[red onion]] * 3 tbsp [[canola oil|canola]] or [[corn oil]] * 1 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar|balsamic]] or [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * ½ tsp [[salt]] * ¼ tsp freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Cook the green beans in a large pot of boiling water for 5 minutes; drain. # Plunge the beans into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking and retain their bright green color. # Drain and place in a large bowl. # Add the mushrooms and onions to the beans; toss to mix. # For the dressing, whisk the oil into the vinegar in a small bowl; add the remaining ingredients and pour over the green beans. # Toss lightly. # Serve immediately.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (about 1 cup): * 136 Calories | 11g Fat | 0mg Cholesterol | 295mg Sodium | 9g Carbs | 3g Dietary Fiber | 3g Sugars | 2g Protein * Diabetic Exchanges: 2 Vegetable | 2 Fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Green bean Recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * From: Charity Ferriera, ''Cooking Light'', June 2007 * Yield: 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 1 (1-lb) [[eggplant]], cut crosswise into ½-inch-thick slices * [[cooking spray]] * 2 cups coarsely chopped [[tomato]] * ¼ cup (1 oz) crumbled [[feta]] cheese * 2 tbsp chopped fresh [[basil]] * 1 tbsp [[red wine vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar]] * 2 tsp [[capers]] * 1 tsp extra virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ tsp dried [[oregano]] * ¼ tsp freshly ground [[black pepper]] * ⅛ tsp [[salt]] * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced
== Directions == # Prepare grill. # Lightly coat both sides of eggplant slices with cooking spray. # Place eggplant on grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill 5 minutes on each side or until tender. # Cool; cut each eggplant slice into quarters. # Combine eggplant, tomato, and remaining ingredients in a large bowl; toss gently.
== Nutritional information == Per 1¼ cups serving: * 86 Calories | 39% from fat | 3.7g Fat | 1.6g Sat | 1.3g Mono | 0.4g Poly | 3.5g Protein | 8.3mg Cholesterol | 67mg Calcium | 243mg Sodium | 12g Carbs | 5g Fiber | 67mg Calcium | 0.9g Iron
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Caper Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] and also [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipes/salad/herbgarden.html Original recipe] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * 6 cups mixed greens, torn into pieces ([[red-leaf lettuce|red leaf]], [[Boston lettuce|Boston]] or [[romaine lettuce]], [[radicchio]], [[arugula]], etc.) * ⅓ cup mixed fresh herbs, chopped ([[parsley]], [[thyme]], [[basil]], [[chives]], [[cilantro]], [[dill]], [[tarragon]], etc.) * 4 red [[radish]]es, thinly sliced * 12 [[cherry tomato]]es * 16 [[walnut]] halves * 1 tbsp organic [[balsamic vinegar]] * 2 tbsp organic extra virgin [[olive oil]] * freshly ground [[black pepper]]
== Directions == # Toss the greens, herbs, and radishes with the oil and toss again with the vinegar. # Arrange the cherry tomatoes and walnuts. # Dust lightly with pepper and serve.
== Nutritional information == Per Serving: * 169 calories | 15g fat (.7g sat) | 3.5g protein | 8g carbohydrates | 0mg cholesterol | 16mg sodium
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Herb Recipes]] [[Category:Radish Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == This lean chicken salad recipe is perfect for eating alone on a bed of lettuce or on toasted whole wheat bread. Chicken salad will spice up any dinner plate. This recipe even has a sweet taste with the addition of raisins. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 boneless, skinless [[chicken breast]] meat, cubed * ½ cup [[sweet pickle relish]] * ¼ cup [[red onion]], finely minced * 1 cup fat-free [[mayonnaise]] * ¼ cup [[celery]], finely minced * ¼ cup [[red bell pepper]], diced * ¼ cup [[cherry tomato]]es, diced * 2 tsp [[salt]] * 2 tsp [[black pepper]] * 2 tsp [[garlic powder]] * 1 tbsp fresh squeezed [[lemon juice]] * ½ cup [[raisins]]
== Directions == # Preheat the oven to 350°F. # Grease a casserole dish with cooking spray or olive oil. # You can buy pre-cubed chicken or buy whole chicken breasts and cut them up yourself. # If you cut the kitchen up this way, you will be available to cut the chicken to your liking. # In a medium sized mixing bowl, combine the cubed chicken, the mayonnaise, and the fresh squeezed lemon juice. # Lemon juice out of a bottle may be substituted, if you prefer. # Stir the chicken salad. # Now add the sweet pickle relish, red onion, and celery. # More mayonnaise may be used if mixture becomes too dry. # Continue stirring. # Add the red bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, and the raisins. # Lastly add the salt, black pepper, and garlic powder to the chicken salad. # Cream this mixture together well and spoon it into the casserole dish. # Spread the chicken salad around evenly. # Bake the chicken salad on 350°F for 12 – 15 minutes or less depending on the size of your oven. # Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool. # Place the chicken salad into a serving dish with a lid. # Chill the chicken salad before serving.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Relish Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Raisin Recipes]]

== Description == The key to this salad is finely chopping the kale leaves. The finer they are, the more they will absorb the dressing and the easier they will be to eat. This salad is a great opportunity to practice good knife skills. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: www.wholefoodsmarket.com * Serves 6
== Ingredients == * 2 bunches [[kale]] leaves, very finely chopped * ¼ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * ¼ cup freshly squeezed [[lemon juice]] * 1 tsp [[chili powder]] * ½ tsp [[sea salt]]
== Directions == # Place the kale leaves in a serving bowl. # In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, chili powder and salt. # Pour over kale and toss to combine well. # Taste and adjust seasoning before serving.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (About 1½ cups / 121g-wt.): * 130 calories (90 from fat) | 10g total fat | 1.5g saturated fat | 3g protein | 11g total carbohydrate (2g dietary fiber, 0g sugar) | 0mg cholesterol, 250mg sodium
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Dairy-free Recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free Recipes]] [[Category:Vegan Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Kale Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

page.title: Jicama Salad with Cilantro Lime Dressing

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes For Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: ''1,001 Delicious Recipes for People with Diabetes'' * Yield: 6 servings and about ¼ cup of dressing
== Ingredients == * ½ large [[jícama]], peeled (about 12oz) * 1½ medium [[zucchini]], sliced * 1 small [[orange]], peeled, cut into segments * 2 – 3 thin slices [[red onion]] * [[#Cilantro Lime Dressing|Cilantro Lime Dressing]] (recipe to follow) * [[salt]] and [[pepper]], to taste * [[lettuce]] leaves
=== Cilantro Lime Dressing === * 2 tbsp [[lime juice]] * 1 tbsp [[orange juice]] * 1 – 2 tbsp [[olive oil|olive]], or [[vegetable oil]] * 2 tbsp finely chopped [[cilantro]] * 2 tsp [[sugar]] or [[Splenda]] sweetener
== Directions == # Cut jícama into sticks about 1½ x ½ inches. # Combine jícama, zucchini, orange, and onion in bowl. # Pour [[#Cilantro Lime Dressing|Cilantro Lime Dressing]] over and toss; season to taste with salt and pepper.
=== Cilantro Lime Dressing === # Mix all ingredients; refrigerate until serving time. # Mix again before using.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (⅙ of recipe): * 77 Calories | 2.4g Fat | 0mg Cholesterol | 1mg Sodium | 1.3g Protein | 13.5g Carbs (less if using Splenda in dressing) * Diabetic exchanges: 1 vegetable | ½ fruit | ½ fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Jícama Recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]]

== == Ingredients * 12 ounces iceburg lettuce * 12 ounces romaine lettuce * 1/2 [[red bell pepper|red pepper]], chopped * 1/2 [[green bell pepper|green pepper]], chopped * 4 slices [[bacon]], cooked and crumbled * 1 cup garlic-flavored [[croutons]] * ½ cup [[Parmesan cheese]], shredded * ½ cup [[mozzarella]] cheese, shredded Dressing * ½ cup [[red wine vinegar]] * 6 anchovies, finely chopped * ½ teaspoon [[oregano]] * ¾ teaspoon [[pepper]] * ¾ teaspoon [[salt]] * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced * 1 tablespoon [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 2 tablespoons [[cornstarch]] * 1 cup [[olive oil]] or [[vegetable oil]] Directions # Toss lettuces, [[peppers]], [[bacon]], mozzarella, and ¼ cup [[Parmesan cheese]] into large mixing/salad bowl, set aside.
Dressing # Combine [[vinegar]], anchovies, [[oregano]], [[salt]], [[pepper]], [[garlic]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]], cornstarch, and remaining [[Parmesan cheese]] into blender. # Mix in blender, slowly adding 1 cup [[oil]]. # Refrigerate until ready to use. # Combine salad, croutons and dressing, serve.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Mozzarella Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Red wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Recipes that need photos]]

== Description == Thanks to Julie, who shops at our Overland Park, Kansas store, for generously sharing her idea for this exceptional berry salad. Blueberries add a burst of sweet, acidic flavor and significant antioxidant nutrition. The olive oil and orange juice dressing is enlivened by lemon thyme leaves. Add grilled or broiled chicken or tempeh for a heartier meal. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipes/salad/berryblue.html Original recipes] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * 8 cups loosely packed organic baby field [[greens]] or a combination mixed with baby [[spinach]] leaves * ½ cup fresh [[blueberries]] * ¼ cup [[blue cheese]] crumbles * ½ cup thinly sliced [[red onion]] * ⅓ cup extra virgin [[olive oil]] * ⅓ cup [[orange juice]] * 1 – 2 tablespoons fresh [[lemon thyme]] leaves * 1 tablespoon minced [[shallot]] (optional) * [[sea salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste * ¼ cup roasted sliced or slivered [[almonds]]
== Directions == # Place greens, blueberries, blue cheese and red onion in a serving bowl. # In a smaller bowl, whisk together olive oil, orange juice, lemon thyme leaves, shallot if desired, and salt and pepper to taste. # Toss salad with the dressing and garnish with roasted, sliced almonds.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (208 g-wt.): * 260 calories (200 from fat) | 23g total fat | 4.5g saturated fat | 6g protein | 13g total carbohydrate (4g dietary fiber, 4g sugar) | 5mg cholesterol | 290mg sodium
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Blueberry Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]]

== Description == Toss with [[Two-seed Dressing]].
== Ingredients == * 1 lb fresh [[spinach]], washed, dried and torn into pieces * 1 pint fresh [[strawberries]], washed and hulled * ½ cup [[slivered almond]]s
== Directions == # Place the [[spinach]] in a serving bowl. # Halve the [[berries]] and arrange over the [[spinach]]. # Prepare the dressing.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]]

== Description == Baby spinach dressed in a light raspberry vinaigrette and tossed with fresh strawberries, almonds and creamy goat cheese. What could be more delightful and this easy? * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipes/salad/spinachstrawberry.html Original recipe] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * ½ [[shallot]], minced (about 1 tablespoon) * 2 tablespoons [[raspberry vinegar]] * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 6 ounces baby [[spinach]] leaves * 5 fresh [[strawberries]] * ⅓ cup sliced [[almonds]] * 2 ounces [[goat cheese]]
== Directions == # Combine the minced shallot and raspberry vinegar in a small bowl. # Slowly add the olive oil to the mixture while continuously whisking. # Place the vinaigrette in the refrigerator until ready to serve. # Roughly chop (or tear) the baby spinach into large julienne strips. # Add to a large bowl. # Prep the remaining components of the salad, but keep separated. # Slice the strawberries into thin round slices. # Toast the almonds by spreading on a cookie sheet and placing in a 375°F degree oven for approximately 5 minutes. # Crumble the goat cheese into medium-size chunks. # When you are ready to serve the salad, add the strawberries, almonds and goat cheese and lightly mix together. # Add the dressing slowly (you may not want to add all the dressing to the salad). # Gently mix together and serve immediately.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (89 g-wt.): * 180 calories (150 from fat) | 17g total fat | 3.5g saturated fat | 1g dietary fiber | 4g protein | 4g carbohydrate | 5mg cholesterol | 40mg sodium
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Shallot Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Strawberry Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipes/salad/spinach_2-wc.html Original recipe] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * 6 cups loosely packed organic [[spinach]], washed and dried * 1 cup mixed [[sprouts]] (clover, mung beans or snow pea) * 1 cup sliced [[button mushrooms]] * ½ cup sliced [[radish]]es * 2 hard boiled [[eggs]], peeled and gently grated
== Directions == # Gently toss all ingredients together and serve with dressing.
== Nutritional information == Per serving (174 g-wt.): * 60 calories (25 from fat) | 3g total fat | 1g saturated fat | 2g dietary fiber | 6g protein | 5g carbohydrate | 105mg cholesterol | 150mg sodium

__NOTOC__ [[Image:Avocado Fruit Stand Salad.jpg|right|Avocado Fruit Stand Salad]] == Ingredients == === Dressing === * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[raspberry vinegar]] * 2 tbsp chopped [[walnuts]], toasted * 1 tsp grated [[lime peel]] * 1 tbsp fresh [[lime juice]] * 1 tbsp chopped fresh [[basil]] leaves * ½ tsp [[dry mustard]] * ¼ tsp [[salt]] * ¼ tsp ground [[black pepper]]
=== Salad === * 1 pkg. Ready Pac® European-style [[greens|salad]], any variety * 3 [[kiwi]], peeled, cut in half lengthwise and sliced in half rounds * 2 red or pink [[grapefruit]], peeled and segmented * 2 cups sliced [[strawberries]] * 1 ripe [[Hass avocado|California avocado]], seeded, peeled, one-half sliced into 8 portions, remaining [[avocado]] cubed
== Directions == === Dressing === # In a small bowl, whisk together ingredients, set aside.
=== Salad === # In large salad bowl, combine all ingredients for salad except [[avocado]] slices. # Whisk together dressing and pour over salad just before serving. # Toss salad to coat with dressing. # Arrange [[avocado]] slices on top.
