== Ingredients == * 3 x 6-inch corn [[tortillas]] * 2 tbsp [[raspberry vinegar]] * 4 [[oranges]] * 1 sliced ripe [[Hass avocado|California avocado]] * 4 [[grapefruit]]s * 2 tbsp [[honey]]
== Directions == # Cut tortillas in half and slice into very thin strips. # Bake the strips by placing on a cookie sheet and baking in a preheated 325°F oven for 7 – 8 minutes. # Grate the [[oranges]] to obtain 2 tsp of rind for each serving. # Peel [[oranges]] and [[grapefruit]]s, section and seed. # In a large bowl, mix honey, [[raspberry vinegar]], [[orange]], and [[grapefruit]] sections. # Add [[orange]] rinds and tortilla strips. # Top with [[avocado]] slices.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Orange Recipes]] [[Category:Tortilla Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]]

page.title: Piquant Avocado, Grapefruit and Spinach Salad

revision.text:
== Ingredients == * 1 x 6 ounce package Ready-Pac baby [[spinach]] * 2 [[Hass avocado|California avocados]], peeled, pitted, sliced * 2 [[grapefruit]], sectioned * 6 oz fresh [[raspberries]] * Dashes of ground [[pico de gallo]] (or pure [[red chile powder|chile powder]])
=== Dressing === * ¼ cup [[raspberry vinegar]] * ⅓ cups [[avocado oil|avocado]] or [[olive oil]] * [[salt]] to taste
== Directions == # Line a large platter or individual plates with the baby [[spinach]] leaves. # Top with the [[avocado]] slices and with ground pico de gallo. # Drizzle with the combined dressing ingredients. # Serve cool. # For a special treat, add ½ pound grilled or pan-seared sea [[scallops]]. # Do not overcook! the centers should be translucent!.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Grapefruit Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry Recipes]] [[Category:Red chile powder Recipes]] [[Category:Scallops Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 ripe [[mango]], peeled and cut into small chunks * 2 tbsp chopped [[Red bell pepper|red pepper]] * 1 tbsp chopped [[red onion]] * ½ tsp [[garlic]], minced * 2 tbsp [[raspberry vinegar]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] * 2 tbsp chopped fresh [[cilantro]]
== Directions == # Toss ingredients together and chill until ready to serve.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Raspberry vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.diabetic-recipes.com/recipes/OCT00_2.1.htm Original recipe] * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 1¼ pounds (600 g) boneless, skinless [[chicken breasts]] * ½ small [[onion]], cut into quarters * 5 whole [[black peppercorns]] * 3 large ribs [[celery]] * 1 large [[Granny Smith apple]] * 1 tablespoon (15 ml) fresh [[lemon juice]] * 2 large heads [[Belgian endive]], leaves separated * 2 tablespoons (30 ml) [[olive oil]] * 1½ tablespoons (22.5 ml) [[white wine vinegar]] * ½ tablespoon (12.5 ml) [[balsamic vinegar]] * 1 small [[shallot]], minced * ½ teaspoon (2.5 ml) [[Dijon mustard]] * freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # In a large nonstick skillet, combine chicken, onion, peppercorns and enough cold water to cover. # Bring to a simmer over medium heat. # Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken has cooked through, 15 to 18 minutes. # Drain and discard onion and peppercorns. # Cut chicken breasts crosswise into strips about 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide. # Set aside. # Remove and discard any strips from the celery. # Cut each rib into thirds and julienne. # Set aside. # Quarter and core the apple, but do not peel. # Thinly slice each quarter and place in a large bowl. # Sprinkle with lemon juice and set aside. # Julienne endive leaves. # Add to apple, along with chicken strips and celery. # In a small glass measuring cup, whisk together olive oil, vinegars, shallot and mustard. # Drizzle over chicken mixture. # Toss and arrange on a large serving platter. # Sprinkle with pepper to taste. # Serve immediately.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 263 calories (30% calories from fat) | 33 g protein | 9 g total fat (1.4 g saturated fat) | 12 g carbohydrates | 3 g dietary fiber | 82 mg cholesterol | 135 mg sodium * Diabetic exchanges: 4 very lean protein | 1 carbohydrate (½ fruit, 1 vegetable) | 1 fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken breast Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Granny Smith apple Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Belgian endive Recipes]] [[Category:White wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Shallot Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.urbanext.uiuc.edu/diabetesrecipes/recipe.cfm?recipe=Red%20Apple%20Spinach%20Salad Original recipe] * Total time: 15 minutes * Servings per Recipe: 6
== Ingredients == * 1 pound fresh [[spinach]], trimmed and cleaned * 1 unpeeled red [[apple]] * 3 slices [[bacon]], fried crisp, crumbled * ½ cup frozen unsweetened [[orange juice]] concentrate, thawed * ⅓ cup light [[mayonnaise]]
== Directions == # Dice apple. # Mix orange juice and mayonnaise. # Mix apple and spinach. # Pour dressing over salad and top with crumbled bacon.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * Calories 98 | Calories from Fat 54 | Total Fat 6g | Cholesterol 7mg | Sodium 212mg | Carbohydrate 10g | Dietary Fiber 7g | Protein 3g * Exchanges: 1 fruit | 1 vegetable * Carbohydrate Units 1
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]]

== Description == This salad has so much flavor that the only dressing you'll need is a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. * Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * Source: WebMD via www.onhealth.com * Yield: 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 4 cups baby [[spinach]], rinsed and dried (comes in packages this way), packed measure * 2 cups fresh [[blackberries]] (thawed blackberries can also be used) * 2 oz crumbled [[goat cheese]] (or reduced-fat or regular [[feta]] cheese) * 2 cups [[cherry tomato|cherry]] or [[grape tomato]]es, halved (chopped ripe tomatoes can be substituted) * 1 large or 2 small [[green onions]], sliced * 3 tbsp finely chopped [[walnuts]] or walnut pieces * 4 tbsp [[balsamic vinegar]] (add more to taste)
== Directions == # Add spinach, blackberries, cheese, cherry tomatoes, green onion, and walnuts to a large serving bowl. # Toss to blend well. # Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and serve into 4 salad bowls.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 167 Calories | 7g Fat (3.2g Saturated fat, 1.6g Monounsat Fat, 1.8g Polyunsat Fat) | 11mg Cholesterol | 7g Protein | 21g Carbs | 6g Fiber | 129mg Sodium | Calories from fat: 37%
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Grape tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]]

page.title: Spinach Salad with Scallops and Apples

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.diabetic-recipes.com/recipes/OCT00_3.1.htm Original recipe] * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * vegetable [[cooking spray]] * 1¼ pounds (600 g) sea [[scallops]] * 2 tablespoons (30 ml) [[olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon (15 ml) [[water]] * 2 tablespoons (30 ml) fresh [[lemon juice]] * 1 teaspoon (5 ml) [[Dijon mustard]] * 8 cups (24 g) baby [[spinach]], washed, stems removed, and drained on paper towels or spun dry * 1 large tart apple, such as [[Fuji apple|Fuji]] or [[Granny Smith apple|Granny Smith]], cored and chopped * 2 tablespoons (16 g) slivered [[almonds]], toasted * freshly ground [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Preheat broiler. # Lightly a broiler pan with cooking spray. # Rinse scallops to remove any bits of shell or sand; pat dry with paper towels. # Arrange the scallops on the broiler pan and lightly coat with cooking spray and broil, turning once, until opaque throughout (cut to test), about 5 to 7 minutes. # Keep warm. # In a small cup combine the oil, water, lemon juice and mustard. # Set aside. # Place the spinach in a bowl. # Add the apples and almonds. # Toss with the dressing. # Season with pepper. # Divide between 4 plates and top with scallops. # Serve immediately.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * 258 calories (36% calories from fat) | 27g protein | 10g total fat (1.2g saturated fat) | 15g carbohydrates | 4g dietary fiber | 47mg cholesterol | 306mg sodium * Diabetic exchanges: 4 very lean protein | 1 carbohydrate (½ fruit, 1 vegetable) | 1 fat
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Scallops Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Fuji apple Recipes]] [[Category:Granny Smith apple Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]]

page.title: Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://vgs.diabetes.org/recipe/viewRecipeDisplay.jsp?SizedRecipeId=999&CategoryID=5 Original recipe] * Number of servings: 8
== Ingredients == * 1 spray [[cooking spray]] * 6 slices [[turkey bacon]], low-fat * ½ cup apple [[cider vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[olive oil]] * 2 tbsp [[honey]] * ¼ tsp [[salt]] * 10 oz [[spinach]] leaves, well washed, stems removed and torn
== Directions == # Coat a small sauté pan with cooking spray and heat over medium- high heat. # Add bacon and sauté 3 minutes or until bacon is crispy. # Add remaining ingredients except spinach and bring to a boil. # Boil for 5 – 7 minutes or until slightly thickened. # Place spinach in a large bowl. # Drizzle hot dressing over spinach and toss to coat.
== Nutritional information == Per ½ cup serving: * Calories 63 (Calories from Fat 33) | Total Fat 4g (Saturated Fat 1g) | Cholesterol 8mg | Sodium 229mg | Total Carbohydrate 6g (Dietary Fiber 1g, Sugars 5g) | Protein 3g * Exchanges Per Serving: ½ Fat | ½ carbohydrate
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Cider vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Healthy_Recipes_For_Diabetic_Friends/ Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends Y-Group] * [http://www.fitnessandfreebies.com/lowcarb/waldorf.html Original recipe] * Yield: 8 (¾-cup) servings
== Ingredients == * ½ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 2 tablespoons [[honey]] * 1 cup sliced [[celery]] * ¼ cup coarsely chopped [[walnuts]] * ½ pound (½-inch thick) sliced deli [[turkey breast]], cubed ½-inch * ¼ pound (½-inch thick) sliced deli [[Swiss cheese]], cubed ½-inch * 2 medium (2 cups) [[Red Delicious apple]]s, cored, coarsely chopped * 6 [[lettuce]] leaves, if desired
== Directions == # Combine mayonnaise and honey in large bowl; mix well. # Stir in all remaining ingredients except lettuce leaves. # Serve on lettuce leaves, if desired.
== Nutrition information == Per serving: * Calories: 240 | Fat: 18g | Cholesterol: 30mg | Sodium: 450mg | Carbohydrates: 12g | Dietary Fiber: 2g | Protein: 10g
__NOTOC__ [[Category:Healthy Recipes for Diabetic Friends]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Honey Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Swiss cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Red Delicious apple Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]]

[[File:069.JPG|right|300px|link=]] == Ingredients == * 6 stalks [[celery]] stalks cut diagonally into 2½" pieces * [[salt]] to taste * 2 teaspoons sweet [[pimenton]] (not smoked) <ref>Spanish pimenton comes in three flavors-dulce (sweet), agridulce (bittersweet) and picante (spicy hot). Each is made from a different subspecies of pepper. Sweet pimenton, smoked or unsmoked, is the most versatile, while the bittersweet adds an interesting complexity to a dish. The spicy-hot is packed with flavor and really not at all fiery to most palates. Substitute Spanish pimenton in any recipe calling for paprika.</ref> * [[water]] as needed * 2 dozen [[almond]]s blanched, skinned * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] divided * ¼ cup chopped [[Italian parsley]] * 3 [[garlic]] cloves * 2 tbsp [[red wine vinegar]] * 2 cans [[artichoke hearts]] - (13¾ oz ea) drained, quartered * 3 cup chopped [[lettuce]] or [[escarole]] * 1 hard-boiled [[egg]] sliced * 1 tsp chopped fresh [[mint]] leaves * 1 tbsp chopped [[green onion]]
== Directions == # Blanch the [[celery]] in boiling salted [[water]] 6 minutes. # Drain and refresh it under cold [[water]]. # Set it aside. # Combine the sweet and hot [[pimenton]] in a small bowl and mix it with ¼ cup [[water]] until it is smooth. # Toast the [[almond]]s in 2 teaspoons of the [[oil]] in a small [[skillet]] over medium-low heat until they are golden, 3 to 4 minutes. # Remove from the heat. # Chop the [[parsley]] in a food processor, then add the [[garlic]] and process until it is finely chopped. # Add the toasted [[almond]]s and process until they are finely ground. # Add ½ teaspoon of [[salt]], the [[vinegar]] and ½ cup of [[water]] and continue to process until the mixture is quite smooth. # Add the pimenton paste and the remaining [[oil]]. # This makes 1 cup of dressing (the dressing can be served with other vegetables and salads) # Place the [[artichoke]] hearts and [[celery]] in a bowl and top with the dressing. # Marinate 1 hour at room temperature. # Prepare a bed of [[lettuce]] or [[escarole]] on a large platter. # Arrange the [[artichokes]] and [[celery]] on top. # Garnish with the [[egg]], [[mint]] and [[onion]].
== Notes == <references/> [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Artichoke Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Escarole Recipes]] [[Category:Escarole Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Italian parsley Recipes]] [[Category:Lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Mint Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]]

revision.comment: clean up, typos fixed: parmesan → Parmesan
revision.text:
If you want a twist on the classic salad and love [[avocado]]s and [[spinach]], this is the recipe for you!
== Ingredients == * 1 package of ready pack baby [[spinach]] * ½ package of [[cherry tomato]]es * 1 medium [[cucumber]] * 1 x 4 oz package of crumbled [[feta]] (Athenos tomato basil or peppercorn is best) * 1 or 2 [[Hass avocado]]s * 1 or 2 thin slices of [[red onion]] (quartered) * ¼ cup chopped [[walnuts]] * Paul Newman's Parmesan-roasted garlic [[salad dressing|dressing]] (to taste) * lengthwise slices of [[red bell pepper|red pepper]] (optional) * fresh cracked [[pepper]] (to taste)
== Directions == # Place spinach in salad bowl. # Halve [[cherry tomato]]es and place in salad bowl. # With a vegetable peeler, peel [[cucumber]] lengthwise in a striped pattern (skin/ flesh/ skin/ flesh etc.) # Cut [[cucumber]] in half (lengthwise), slice [[cucumber]] width-wise as thick as you desire. # [[chop]] [[avocado]] into cubes and place in bowl. # Add red [[onion]], [[red pepper]] strips (optional), [[feta]], and [[walnuts]]. # Add [[salad dressing]] and cracked [[pepper]] to taste. # Toss until ingredients are well mixed.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Hass avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Basil Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 large [[bell pepper]], [[yellow bell pepper|yellow]], [[Holland bell pepper|orange]] or [[red bell pepper|red]] * 1 tsp [[olive oil]] * 4 strips [[meat substitute|soy “bacon”]] * ½ cup canned [[cannellini bean|cannellini]] or [[navy bean]]s, drained and rinsed * ½ cup cooked [[green peas]] * 3 tbsp snipped [[dill|dill weed]] * ½ cup crumbled [[feta]] cheese * [[salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste * 3 tbsp [[pine nut]]s
== Directions == # Slice [[bell pepper]] in half lengthwise, cutting carefully through stem end to keep end intact while removing stem. # Discard seeds and inner membranes, and set aside. # Heat [[olive oil]] in large skillet over medium-low heat. # Cook soy “bacon” until browned, turning several times, 5 to 7 minutes. Avoid burning. # Combine beans, [[peas]], [[dill|dill weed]], [[feta]] [[cheese]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste in mixing bowl, and toss to mix well. # Carefully spoon mixture into [[pepper]] halves, sprinkle with [[pine nut]]s and serve.
[[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Meat substitute Recipes]] [[Category:Dill leaf Recipes]] [[Category:Feta Recipes]] [[Category:Navy bean Recipes]] [[Category:Pea Recipes]] [[Category:Pine nut Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Holland bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Yellow bell pepper Recipes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == Featured for the Fourth! When fresh tomatoes are in season, I could literally live on this salad. The flavors just “sing!” and the colors are just right for..."
revision.text:
== Description == Featured for the Fourth! When fresh tomatoes are in season, I could literally live on this salad. The flavors just “sing!” and the colors are just right for the patriotic 4th (or 14th) of July. * From Chef June Jacobs,sdapted from Pierre Franey * Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SF&SC/ SF&SC Y-Group] * Makes 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 4 large ripe [[tomato]]es, about 1¼ pounds * 2 medium-sized [[red onion]]s, about ¾ pound (or you could choose one of the infamous sweet onions) * 1 tablespoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry wine vinegar]] * ½ teaspoon finely chopped [[garlic]] * 3 tablespoons extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * [[sea salt]] and freshly ground [[pepper]] to taste * ¼ pound [[blue cheese]], at room temperature (I love Point Reyes blue from Marin County, CA) * 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[chives]] and/or [[basil]] (would you believe [[tarragon]]?)
== Directions == # Core the tomatoes and use a serrated knife to make thick slices. # Peel the onions and slice them about ¼-inch thick. # Arrange alternate and slightly overlapping sliced tomatoes and onions on serving plates. # Combine the vinegar, garlic, oil, salt and pepper. # Blend well with a wire whisk. # Crumble the cheese and add it into the dressing (which should be lumpy). # Pour the dressing over the tomatoes and onions, sprinkle with the fresh herbs and serve.
[[Category:SF&SC]] [[Category:Independence Day Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Sherry vinegar Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 6 ears fresh [[corn]] * 6 small [[mango]]es, peeled, pitted and coarsely chopped * 2 lbs [[jícama]], peeled and chopped * 1 cup chopped [[red onion]] * ½ cup fresh chopped [[cilantro]] * ½ cup fresh [[lime juice]]
== Directions == # Cook [[corn]] in pot of boiling salted [[water]] 2 minutes. # Drain and cool [[corn]]. # Cut off enough kernels to measure 4 cups (reserve remaining [[corn]] for another use). # Place [[corn]] in medium bowl. # Add mangoes, [[jícama]], [[red onion]], [[cilantro]] and [[lime juice]]. # Toss to combine. # Season to taste with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]. # Cover and refrigerate until cold. # Can be prepared 3 hours ahead. # Serve cold.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Jícama Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Mango Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Cilantro Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Serves 4 [[File:Spinsalad333.JPG|right|300px|link=]]
== Ingredients == === Salad === * ½ lb [[bacon]] * 1 (2½ oz) pkg. sliced [[almonds]] * 1 (10 oz) pkg. fresh [[spinach]], washed, stems removed, chilled * 1 (11 oz) can [[mandarin orange]]s, drained and chilled
=== Dressing === * 1 cup [[catsup]] * 1 cup [[vegetable oil]] * ⅔ cup [[vinegar]] * ⅔ cup [[sugar]] * 1 small grated [[onion]], optional * 1 tsp [[salt]] * 1 tsp [[celery seed]] * ½ tsp [[paprika]] * juice of 1 [[lemon]] * 1 [[garlic]] clove, minced * pinch of [[dry mustard]] * ½ tsp [[Worcestershire sauce]]
== Directions == # Cook bacon until crisp. # Drain, crumble and set aside. # Sauté almonds in bacon grease over medium heat until lightly brown. # Drain. # In a large bowl, toss spinach and oranges. # Stir in dressing and almonds. # Serve immediately. # Enjoy. [[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Spinach Recipes]] [[Category:Almond Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Ketchup Recipes]] [[Category:Vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 large box or 2 small boxes orange [[gelatin dessert mix|Jell-O]] * 2 small cans [[mandarin orange]]s (drain) * large tub [[Cool Whip]]
== Directions == # Mix jello using directions on box. # Let chill to almost set. # Put in drained mandarin oranges and stir. # Using a wire whisk, mix or fold in cool whip. # Let chill in refrigerator until set. # Enjoy.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gelatin dessert mix Recipes]] [[Category:Mandarin orange Recipes]] [[Category:Nondairy topping Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 2 cups cooked [[brown rice]] * 2 cups chopped [[green mango]] * ¾ cup shredded [[carrot]] * 4 stalks [[celery]], diced * 2 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 2 tsp [[lemon zest]] * ¼ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]]
== Directions == # Combine all ingredients in a container. # Mix well, cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Brown rice Recipes]] [[Category:Green mango Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon peel Recipes]]

page.title: Beet Salad with Roquefort and Walnuts

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Pressurecookerrecipes/ Pressurecookerrecipes Y-Group] * Source: ''Quick Cuisine Pressure Cooker Cookbook'' * Preparation time: 20 Minutes * Makes 6 Servings
== Ingredients == * 4 medium sized [[beet]]s, gently washed and trimmed * 3 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]] * 2 tablespoons [[walnut oil]] * 1 teaspoon [[Dijon mustard]] * ¼ cup shelled [[walnuts]], halves or pieces * 2 oz [[roquefort]] or [[blue cheese]] * 4 servings mixed [[salad greens]]
== Directions == # In a 3-quart or larger Duromatic pressure cooker, place whole beets on the steaming trivet with ½ cup of [[water]] in the bottom of the cooker. # Close the lid and bring pressure to the second red ring (15psi) over high heat. # Adjust heat to stabilize pressure at the second red ring and cook for 10 to 14 minutes depending on the size of the beets. # Off heat, allow the pressure to subside naturally. # Cool beets, slip off their skins and cut into julienne strips. # Mix [[balsamic vinegar]] and [[mustard]] together. # Slowly add the [[oil]] while whisking to make a vinaigrette. # Toss the beets in the vinaigrette to coat them. # Arrange greens on each plate and place beets on top. # Just before serving, crumble [[roquefort]] over each serving and garnish with walnut pieces.
[[Category:Pressure cooker Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Balsamic vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Beet Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Roquefort Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut oil Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]]

[[File:Beetorange.jpg|right|300px|link=]] == Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PressureCookerRecipes/ PressureCookerRecipes Y-Group] * Source: ''Cooking Light'', September 1998 * Yield: 4 servings
== Ingredients == * 6 [[beet]]s (about 3 pounds) * 3 (3-inch) [[orange rind]] strips * ½ cup fresh [[orange juice]] * 2 tablespoons [[cider vinegar]] * ¼ cup sliced [[green onions]] * 2 tablespoons [[brown sugar]] * 2 teaspoons grated [[orange rind]] * 2 teaspoons [[Dijon mustard]] * 4 cups gourmet [[salad greens]] * [[orange rind]] strips (optional)
== Directions == # Trim roots and stems from beets; scrub with a brush. # Peel beets. # Cut beets in half lengthwise; cut into ¼-inch-thick slices. # Place beets, 3 orange rind strips, orange juice, and vinegar in a 6-quart pressure cooker. # Close lid securely; bring to high pressure over high heat (about 4 minutes). # Adjust heat to medium or level needed to maintain high pressure; cook 3 minutes. # Remove from heat; place pressure cooker under cold running water. # Remove lid. # Drain mixture in a colander over a bowl, reserving 1 cup cooking liquid. # Discard the 3 orange rind strips. # Combine 1 cup reserved cooking liquid, beets, onions, sugar, grated orange rind, and mustard in a bowl; toss gently. # Place 1 cup greens on each of 4 plates; top with beet mixture. # Garnish with additional orange rind strips, if desired.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * Calories 142 (4% from fat) | fat 0.6g (sat 0.1g, mono 0.1g, poly 0.2g) | protein 4.9g | cholesterol 0.0mg | calcium 70mg | sodium 222mg | fiber 3g | iron 2.7mg | carbohydrate 32g [[Category:Pressure cooker Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Beet Recipes]] [[Category:Orange juice Recipes]] [[Category:Cider vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Brown sugar Recipes]] [[Category:Orange peel Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Leafy and salad vegetable Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 3 cups hot cooked [[rice]] * ¼ cup [[vegetable oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], minced * ½ teaspoon [[salt]] (optional) * ½ teaspoon [[rosemary]] * ½ teaspoon [[oregano]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[black pepper]] * 1 small [[zucchini]], thinly sliced * 1 medium [[tomato]], seeded and chopped * 3 tablespoons grated [[Parmesan cheese]]
== Directions == # Spoon [[rice]] into large bowl. # Blend [[oil]], [[lemon juice]], [[garlic]], [[salt]], [[rosemary]], [[oregano]] and [[pepper]]; stir into [[rice]]. # Cover; let cool. # Add [[zucchini]], [[tomato]] and [[cheese]]. # Serve at room temperature or chill.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Oregano Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Rice Recipes]] [[Category:Rosemary Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini Recipes]]

== Description == [[Image:Beets.jpg|thumb|300px|Beets]] This recipe is best if marinated for a few hours, stirring occasionally. imple and refreshing in the summer. Enjoy!
== Ingredients == * 4 medium [[beet]]s * 1 small white [[Onion]] * 2 [[limes]]
== Directions == # Boil beets, covered in [[water]] for ½ hour, until skins can be easily peeled off and [[beet]] is soft when poked by fork. # Peel and chop beets into small squares (about ½ inch). # Slice [[onion]] into thin pieces. # Squeeze [[lime juice]] over the beets, add the [[onion]]s.
[[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Lime juice Recipes]] [[Category:Beet Recipes]]

== Ingredients == === Dressing === * 2 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * 2 tbsp [[vegetable broth]] * 1½ tbsp [[vegetable oil]] * ½ tsp [[salt]] '''or''' 1 tsp [[soy sauce]] * ¼ tsp [[pepper]]
=== Salad === * 1 large [[watercress]] bunch, tough stems removed * 1 large [[carrot]], shredded * 1 [[Red Delicious apple]], cored and shredded * 1 [[Golden Delicious apple]], cored and shredded * 2 tbsp [[lemon juice]] * ½ cup [[walnuts]], chopped
== Directions == === Dressing === # In a small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. # Mix well.
=== Salad === # Arrange watercress around the outside edge of a large platter. # Scatter [[carrot]] next o the watercress. # In a small bowl, toss shredded [[apple]]s with [[lemon juice]]. # Spoon [[apple]]s into the center of the platter. # Scatter [[nuts]] on top of the [[apple]]s. # Pour dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
__NOTOC__
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Golden Delicious apple Recipes]] [[Category:Red Delicious apple Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Carrot Recipes]] [[Category:Watercress Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetable stock and broth Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 cup cubed cooked [[turkey meat|turkey]] or [[chicken]] * 2 small [[apple]]s, chopped (1 cup) * ½ cup [[celery]], chopped * 2 [[green onions]], sliced * ¼ cup plain [[yogurt]] * 2 tbsp [[mayonnaise]], non-fat or low-calorie * 2 tsp [[lemon juice]] * ½ tsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]]
== Directions == # Combine [[turkey meat|turkey]], [[apple]], [[celery]] and [[green onions]] in a medium mixing bowl. # Stir together [[yogurt]], [[mayonnaise]], [[lemon juice]] and [[granulated sugar|sugar]] in another small bowl. # Pour [[yogurt]] mixture over [[turkey meat|turkey]] mixture. # Toss to mix well. # Cover and chill for 1 to 3 hours. # Serve on purple [[kale]] leaves, if desired.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Turkey meat Recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt Recipes]]

[[Image:CEASAR SALAD.jpg|300px|thumb|Ceasar Salad]] == Description == This recipe is for 1 serving.
== Ingredients == * 80 g [[iceberg lettuce]] * 80 g [[romaine lettuce]] * 80 g basic [[Caesar dressing]] * 30 g [[Parmesan cheese]], grated * [[Parmesan cheese|Parmesan]], shaved * 10 g crispy [[bacon bits]] * 20 g crispy bread [[croutons]]
== Directions == # Mix the salad with the dressing. # Garnish with the croutons and shaved Parmesan. # NOTE: The salad can be served with various accompaniment: [[smoked salmon]], grilled [[chicken]] supreme, [[Parma ham]], grilled [[prawn]]s or [[scallops]]. # Various garnishes can be used: Roasted [[pecan]] nuts, [[focaccia]] bread croutons, [[sun-dried tomato]] bread croutons.
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Parmesan cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Romaine lettuce Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by Jenn B aka Mom2Sam and Tiny via [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Serves 4
== Ingredients == * ¼ cup [[olive oil]] * 2 large [[eggplant]]s, chopped * ½ cup chopped fresh [[parsley]] * 2 cloves [[garlic]], crushed * grated rind of 2 [[lemons]] * seasonings to taste
=== Topping === * 8 [[cherry tomato]]es, quartered * ¼ cup roughly chopped fresh [[parsley]] * 1 clove [[garlic]], chopped * grated rind and juice of 1 [[lemon]]
== Directions == # Heat oil in a frying pan. # Sauté eggplant until tender. # Stir in remaining ingredients. # Press ¼ of the mixture into an egg ring on individual serving plates. # Remove ring. # Prepare topping: combine ingredients in a bowl. # Spoon equal amounts onto each salad. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free Recipes]] [[Category:Eggplant Recipes]] [[Category:Parsley Recipes]] [[Category:Garlic Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon peel Recipes]] [[Category:Cherry tomato Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group] * Serves 8
== Ingredients == * 6 medium [[]]sweet potatoes, peeled * 1 (8 oz) can [[pineapple]] chunks, drained * ½ cup sliced [[celery]] * ½ cup chopped [[pecans]] * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] or salad dressing ([[Miracle Whip]]) * ¼ cup [[sour cream]]
==Directions == # In large saucepan cook sweet potatoes in boiling water for 25 – 30 minutes, or until tender. # Let cool, then cut into ¾ inch cubes. # In a large bowl, combine sweet potatoes, pineapple, celery, and pecans. # Combine mayonnaise or salad dressing and the sour cream. # Fold into salad. # Chill if desired.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Sweet potato Recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Pecan Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 3 medium [[cucumber]]s, sliced * 1 medium [[sweet onion]], thinly sliced * 1 tbsp [[sugar]] * 1 cup [[sour cream]] * ½ cup [[white wine vinegar]] * 5 tbsp fresh [[dill]], chopped * ½ tsp [[salt]] * dash [[pepper]]
== Directions == # In a bowl make alternating layers of cucumbers and sliced onion, sprinkling with chopped dill. # Combine sour cream, sugar, white wine vinegar, salt and pepper. # Pour over cucumbers. # Let chill at least 4 hours.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:White wine vinegar Recipes]] [[Category:Dill Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SF&SC/ SF&SC Y-Group]
== Ingredients == === Dressing === * ⅔ cup [[mayonnaise]] * 6 tablespoons [[buttermilk]] * 4 teaspoons [[Dijon mustard]] * 4 teaspoons fresh [[lemon juice]] * 4 teaspoons [[granulated sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[hot pepper sauce]] * [[salt]] * [[pepper]]
=== Salad === * 2 large [[red bell peppers]] * 3 cups frozen [[baby lima bean]]s, thawed from 2 x 10 ounce packages * 5 cups frozen [[corn]] kernels, thawed and drained, about 24 ounces * ⅔ cup [[green onions]], thinly sliced
== Directions == # Whisk dressing ingredients together in medium bowl to blend. # Season to taste with salt and pepper. # Char peppers <ref>You don't have to char the peppers. You can just wash them, seed them, and chop them up.</ref> over gas flame or in oven under the broiler til black on all sides. # Put in a paper bag and roll up to close and let sit for 10 minutes. # Peel and seed and coarsely chop peppers (about half the size of an American flag stamp). # Put in large bowl. # Cook lima beans in salted boiling water til heated through, about 4 minutes. # Drain and cool (you can run cold water over them to speed it up). # Put in bowl with the peppers. # Mix in corn and green onions. # Toss salad with enough dressing to coat. # Season to taste with salt and pepper. # Cover and chill. # Serve cold or at room temperature. # Store in refrigerator. # We put all the dressing in the salad to coat and we serve it very cold.
__NOTOC__ [[Category:SF&SC]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Buttermilk Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Baby lima bean Recipes]] [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Green onion Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 cup diced, cooked [[chicken]] * 1 cup diced [[celery]] * 1 tbsp [[mayonnaise]] * 1 tbsp finely chopped [[pickles]] * 1 cup chopped [[hard-boiled egg]]
== Directions == # Mix well and serve. # You may also use tuna fish or ham in place of the chicken.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Chicken Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Pickle Recipes]] [[Category:Hard-boiled egg Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 1 medium-sized [[red bell pepper]] * 1 medium-sized [[yellow bell pepper]] * 1 medium-sized [[green bell pepper]] * ½ cup [[salad dressing|creamy garlic dressing]] * ¼ tsp [[black pepper]] * 2 tsp [[capers]], rinsed drained
== Directions == # Preheat broiler. # Place [[bell pepper]]s under broiler and lightly char. # Turning to grill all sides. # Remove from broiler to a paper bag. # Close paper bag and set aside. # When [[peppers]] cool, peel, core, seed and cut into strips. # Arrange [[peppers]] on a platter, alternating colors so they form a petal, and spoon dressing over them. # Sprinkle with [[black pepper]]. # Garnish with [[capers]] and serve warm or chilled.
== Nutritional information == Per serving: * Calories: 30 | cho: 0mg | pro: 2g | sod: 67gm | fat: 0g * Food exchanges: 1 vegetable
[[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Caper Recipes]] [[Category:Green bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Red bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Yellow bell pepper Recipes]] [[Category:Prepared salad dressing Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/World_Recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 cup [[mayonnaise]] * ½ cup [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * ¼ cup [[vinegar]] * 2½ lbs [[broccoli]] (or 2 big bunches) * 1 cup shredded sharp [[cheddar]] cheese * ½ lb [[bacon]], crisp fried and crumbled
== Directions == # Whisk together [[mayonnaise]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[vinegar]] and set aside. # Cut [[broccoli]] into florets and combine in large bowl with [[cheese]] and [[bacon]]. # Toss with [[mayonnaise]] dressing. # Cover and chill overnight before serving.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Broccoli Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Vinegar Recipes]]

== Ingredients == * 2 each [[apple]]s, red, small, thinly sliced * 2 tsp [[lemon juice]] * 2 cups [[celery]], thinly sliced * 3 oz [[cheese]], [[cheddar]], cubed * ¼ cup [[mayonnaise]], light * 1 pinch [[salt]] * 1 pinch [[pepper]] * 1 [[lettuce]]
== Directions == # Place [[apple]]s in small bowl; toss with [[lemon juice]]. # Add [[celery]] and next 4 ingredients; toss to coat. # Serve on lettuce-lined plate.
[[Category:Low-calorie Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Apple Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]] [[Category:Celery Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/world_recipes/ World Recipes Y-Group]
== Ingredients == * 1 lb [[ground turkey|turkey]], [[ground beef|beef]] or [[ground pork|pork, ground]] * ½ cup [[onion]], finely chopped * 1 tbsp [[Worcestershire]] * 2 tsp [[seasoning]] of choice * 8 oz [[cheddar]], sharp, garlic, herb, horseradish * 1 cup [[pickles]], drained * 3 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 4 tbsp [[cider vinegar]] * ⅔ cup [[olive oil]]
== Directions == # Combine meat, onion, Worcestershire, seasoning. # Form in mini patties and drizzle with olive oil. # Grill or sauté till almost done # Add slices of cheese and broil till melted. # Arrange salad greens on platter. # Toss with dressing and top with mini burgers and pickles and drizzle mustard over all. # Enjoy.
[[Category:World Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Ground turkey Recipes]] [[Category:Ground beef Recipes]] [[Category:Ground pork Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Cheddar Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Cider vinegar Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: my old recipes
== Ingredients == * enough [[lettuce]] leaves for 4 people (use [[butter lettuce]], [[red-leaf lettuce|red-]] or [[green-leaf lettuce]]) * 1 tbsp [[granulated sugar|sugar]] * 1 tbsp [[vinegar]] * about ½ cup [[sour cream]] * fresh [[chives]], cut fine '''or''' finely sliced [[onion]]s * [[salt]] * [[pepper]]
== Directions == # Wash and drain [[lettuce]]. # Stir other ingredients together and pour over the [[lettuce]]. # Mix lightly. # A sliced [[hard-boiled egg]] may be used as a garnish if desired, to be fancy or give it more body. # This salad won't keep long. # It should be served at once or the [[lettuce]] will wilt and be miserable. # Don't use the [[iceberg lettuce]] in this recipe, if you can help it. Use the kind listed in the ingredients. Only if they aren't available, then you may use the iceberg.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Red-leaf lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Green-leaf lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Chives Recipes]] [[Category:Onion Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]]

page.title: Tip of the Iceberg Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing

revision.text:
== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: ''The Last Minute Party Girl''
== Ingredients == * ⅓ cup [[mayonnaise]] * ⅓ cup [[sour cream]] * 1½ oz [[blue cheese]], at room temperature * 1 tbsp fresh [[lemon juice]] * freshly ground [[black pepper]] (lots) * ½ head [[iceberg lettuce]] * 1 tbsp finely chopped fresh [[chives]] * 2 slices cooked [[bacon]], chopped '''or''' ¼ cup toasted [[walnuts]] (optional)
== Directions == # In a bowl, whisk the [[mayonnaise|mayo]], [[sour cream]], [[blue cheese]], [[lemon juice]] and [[pepper]] until well combined. # Cover and refrigerate. # Slice the [[lettuce]] into four equal wedges, without letting each wedge fall apart. # When you're ready to serve, place one wedge vertically on a salad plate with the outside larger leaves down and the center of the [[lettuce]] pointing up. # Add a hefty dollop of dressing, sprinkle with [[chives]] and [[bacon]] or nuts and repeat with three more plates.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Iceberg lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Sour cream Recipes]] [[Category:Bacon Recipes]] [[Category:Chives Recipes]] [[Category:Blue cheese Recipes]] [[Category:Walnut Recipes]] [[Category:Mayonnaise Recipes]] [[Category:Lemon juice Recipes]]

== Description == Contributed by [http://Groups.Yahoo.Com/Group/Catsrecipes/ Catsrecipes Y-Group] * Source: my old recipes * Serves 6
== Ingredients == * ½ lb [[butter lettuce]] (2 small heads) * 2 tbsp [[wine vinegar]] * 1 tbsp [[Dijon mustard]] * 2 tbsp minced [[shallot]]s * ¼ tbsp [[salt]] * 7 tbsp [[oil]] * [[red-leaf lettuce]] leaves
== Directions == # Arrange 3 to 4 red [[leaf lettuce]] leaves on each of 6 plates. # Separate [[butter]] [[lettuce]] into individual leaves and distribute on each plate. # Mix [[vinegar]], [[mustard]], [[shallot]]s, [[salt]] and [[oil]]. # Blend well. # Spoon dressing equally over each salad.
[[Category:Cathy's Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Red-leaf lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Boston lettuce Recipes]] [[Category:Dijon mustard Recipes]] [[Category:Shallot Recipes]] [[Category:Wine vinegar Recipes]]

revision.comment: clean up, typos fixed: swiss → Swiss
revision.text:
[[File:Autumn greens and soup.jpg|right|250px|link=]] ==Ingredients== ===Salad=== *8 cups mixed greens, such as [[arugula]], dandelion, frisee, red oak lettuce, Swiss chard, etc. *6-8 figs *1 cup roasted [[nuts]] of your choice (we like candied [[walnuts]])
===Vinaigrette=== *5 Tbs. [[plum]] preserves *1/4 cup [[wine vinegar]] *1 Tbs. [[Dijon-style mustard]] *1 cup [[olive oil]] *1 tsp. grated [[ginger]] *1 Tbs. minced [[lemongrass]] *Kosher [[salt]] and freshly ground [[pepper]]
===Soup=== *2 tablespoons [[butter]] *2 [[onions]], peeled and chopped *6 cups [[chicken broth]] *2 pounds [[carrots]], peeled and sliced *2 tablespoons grated fresh [[ginger]] *1 cup whipping [[cream]] *[[Salt]] and [[pepper]]
==Directions== For the salad, simply mix all the ingredients for the dressing together, and drizzle over a bowl of tossed greens. Garnish your salad with figs and nuts.
To make the soup, add butter and onions to a 6-quart pan, over medium high heat and cook them, stirring often, until onions are limp. Add broth, carrots, and ginger and cover the pan. Bring it to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer until carrots are tender when pierced.
Remove your pan from the heat and transfer to a blender. Do not fill the blender more than half way and place the lid on. Cover the top with a dish towel, and pulse the blender to start it and then puree until smooth.
Return the mixture to the pan, add cream, and stir it over high heat until the soup is uniformly hot. Add salt and pepper to taste.
To serve the soup, ladle it into bowls and garnish with parsley sprigs.
==External links== *[http://www.innatthecrossroads.com/2011/12/07/autumn-greens-and-ginger-soup/ Inn at the Crossroads] __NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Soup Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian Soup Recipes]] [[Category:Game of Thrones Recipes]]

page.title: Salad of Green Beans, Onions and Beets

revision.text:
[[File:Medievalsalad.jpg|right|300px|link=]] ==Ingredients== *2 large [[beets]] *2 [[red onions]] *1/4lb [[green beans]], trimmed and cleaned *2 Tablespoon [[olive oil]] *your favorite [[vinegar]] *[[Salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste
==Directions== Trim and wash the beets and boil for 30 minutes, or until tender. After that, plunge them into cold water and slough off outer skin. Set the beets aside and allow them to cool completely.
Next, slice the onions into rings and separate. Pour 1 tablespoon olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat and add the onions. Cook them until they are tender but still vibrantly colored. Swap the onions with the green beans and cook until tender.
Slice the beets into large discs and begin layering the beets and onions. Top it all off with green beans. Finally, drizzle on your choice of vinegar and olive oil and add salt and pepper to taste.
==External Links== *[http://www.innatthecrossroads.com/2011/04/17/salad-of-green-beans-onions-and-beets/ Inn at the Crossroads] *[[w:c:iceandfire:List of Food and Beverages|A Song of Ice and Fire]]
__NOTOC__ __NOEDITSECTION__ [[Category:Vegetarian Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Appetizer Recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian appetizer Recipes]] [[Category:Game of Thrones Recipes]]

A julienne salad is similar to its Caesar salad cousin in terms of ingredients. The main difference is that the ingredients in a julienne salad is the type of cutting technique used.
==Ingredients== * 4 cups [[lettuce]] * 2 large [[eggs]] * 20 g [[onions]] * 100 g [[chicken]] * 100 g [[ham]] * 60 g [[mozzarella]] cheese * 100 g [[tomato]]es * 1/4 cup [[mayonnaise]] or 1/4 cup sour [[cream]] * 1 tablespoon prepared [[mustard]] * 1 tablespoon [[honey]] * 1/2 tablespoon [[lemon juice]]
==Directions== # Cut up the lettuce as you like and put the lettuce in a bowl. # Cut the onion into rings and put in bowl. # Cut the tomatoes as you like best and put in bowl. # Boil the eggs, peel and cut into long thin strips put on top of veggies. # Cut the meat and cheese into long thin strips and put on top of the veggies. # Mix dressing ingredients to your liking and if you want, make more!
==Source== * http://www.food.com/recipe/julienne-salad-483461 [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:American Salads]]

[[File:Sweet And Spicy Shrimp - Recipe|thumb|right|335 px]] If you’re tired of the commonly available Nicoise salad, you can try other salad recipes from Nice such as this shrimp and mesclun salad by French Chef Arthur Dorshner. For this recipe, French Dorshner makes use of Royal red shrimp. Unlike regular shrimp which is pale when raw, royal shrimp is already pinkish in color even if uncooked. It has a flavor and texture similar to lobster and cook faster than normal shrimp.
Mesclun is a term used for a mixture of young salad greens. It includes different kinds of lettuce such as Romaine, Chicory, Escarole, Arugula, Iceberg, and Lola Rosa. Other leafy vegetables can also be added in the mix as long as they can be eaten raw, such as mustard, watercress, and spinach. Others even add edible flowers. In this recipe, Chef Dorshner mixes arugula, chervil, and endive, which are abundantly grown in Nice. Besides salad greens, you can also add herbs to the mix to make the salad more dynamic. Different textures and shapes can be quite appealing to the eyes and will make the dish all the more appetizing. Tons of easy cooking videos are made available within the link, so feel free to drop by. Basically, this cooking recipe can be broken down into three parts: making the mesclun by mixing the greens together, making the dressing, and cooking the shrimps. You can start with peeling and gutting the shrimps and making the dressing. Mix the greens while the shrimps are being cooked. The contrast of the warm shrimp and the cool salad produces an appealing experience in the mouth.
==Ingredients== * 28 oz. of royal [[shrimp]] * 10-12 oz. of [[mesclun]] (young chervil, arugula, leafy lettuce, and endive leaves) * 1 oz. royal [[caviar]] (optional) * 2 [[green onion]]s * minced * herbs ([[basil]], [[chervil]], [[dill]]) ; [[Vinaigrette]] * 1 1/2 oz. [[vinegar balsamic]] * 1 ½ oz. cl extra virgin [[olive oil]] * 1 ½ oz. [[hazelnut oil]] * ½ oz. [[white wine]] * a spoonful of [[mustard]] * [[salt]] * freshly ground [[pepper]] * [[truffle juice]]
==Directions== # Remove the shells of the shrimps by first pulling out the heads and the legs and then peeling off the remaining shell. With a small paring knife, gut the shrimps by cutting a quarter of an inch deep along the edge of the back of the shrimps and remove the dark vein just under the surface. You can leave the shrimp tails intact for a better presentation. # Sautee the shrimps in a pan with a little olive oil and chopped onions until they turn a nice rosy color. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with some fresh thyme. In a salad bowl, mix all the salad greens together. #To make the dressing, whip together the rest of the ingredients: olive oil, hazelnut oil, balsamic vinegar, white wine, mustard, truffle juice, minced herbs of basil, chervil, and dill, and season with salt and pepper. # Arrange the bed of mesclun on the center of the plate and place the shrimps around the greens. Put some caviar (optional) on the side, decorate with thyme, drizzle with some dressing, and serve. [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Shrimp Recipes]]

[[File:Images23.jpeg|right|300px|link=]] ==About== This recipe is great for warm Spring nights or to bring to a neighbor's BBQ. It is a quick and easy recipe that you will use time and time again.
Servings: 4 (side dish)
==Ingredients== * 4 pieces of [[corn]] (uncooked) * 1/2 red [[onion]] * 1 [[avocado]] * 1 1/2 cups [[cherry tomato]]es * 1/2 tsp. [[mustard]] * 1 clove [[garlic]] * 3 tbsp. [[balsamic vinegar]] * 1/2 cup [[olive oil]] * [[salt]] & [[pepper]] to taste
==Directions== # Shuck the fresh corn (cut it off of the rind) and put it in a bowl. Chop up the red onion, cut the avocado into cubes, and chop the cherry tomatoes in half. Put everything into the bowl. # To make the dressing you cut up 1 clove of garlic very finely. Mix the garlic with the mustard and the balsamic vinegar. Whisk in the olive oil and the salt and pepper. # Mix altogether and serve! [[Category:Corn Recipes]] [[Category:Red onion Recipes]] [[Category:Avocado Recipes]] [[Category:Tomato Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Warm Quinoa Salad with Edamame & Tarragon

revision.text:
[[File:Warm-quinoa-salad-with-edamame-tarragon-4708-l.jpg|thumb|warm quinoa salad]] ==Ingredients== * 1 cup [[quinoa]] * 2 cups [[vegetable broth]] * 2 cups (10oz) frozen shelled [[edamame]], thawed * 1 tablespoon freshly grated [[lemon zest]] * 2 tablespoons [[lemon juice]] * 2 tablespoons extra-virgin [[olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons chopped fresh [[tarragon]] or 2 teaspoons dried * 1/2 teaspoon [[salt]] * 1/2 cup (3oz) drained and diced jarred roasted [[red pepper]]s * 1/4 cup chopped [[walnuts]], preferably toasted
==Directions== # Toast quinoa in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring often, until it becomes aromatic and begins to crackle, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a fine sieve and rinse thoroughly. # Meanwhile, bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add the quinoa and return to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to a simmer and cook gently for 8 minutes. Remove the lid and, without disturbing the quinoa, add edamame. Cover and continue to cook until the edamame and quinoa are tender, 7 to 8 minutes longer. Drain any remaining water, if necessary. # Whisk lemon zest and juice, oil, tarragon and salt in a large bowl. Add peppers and the quinoa mixture. Toss to combine. Divide among 4 plates and top with walnuts.
Note: Quinoa is a delicately flavored grain that was a staple in the ancient Incas' diet. A good related recipe would be crayfish and prawn salad, it's made of prawn salads and crayfish. It is available in most natural-foods stores and the natural-foods sections of many supermarkets. Toasting the grain before cooking enhances its flavor and rinsing removes any residue of saponin, quinoa's natural, bitter protective covering. [[Category:Quinoa Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

==Ingredients== * 8 fresh [[crawfish]] * 8 fresh [[crayfish]] * 100 G of [[mussels]], shelled * 100 G of [[shelled clams]] * 100 G of [[octopus]] * 100 G of fresh [[squids]] * 5 G of fresh [[marjoram]] * 5 G of fresh [[parsley]] ;Court-bouillon * 1 [[carrot]] * 1 [[celery]] * 1 [[onion]] * 2 [[bay leaves]] ;Dressing * 250 G of [[olive oil]] * 20 G of water * 1 [[fresh lemon juice]] * [[Salt]]
==Directions== # Prepare the court-bouillon in salted water, with the carrot, celery, onion and bay leaves. # Cook the seafood in the court-bouillon prepared earlier. # Drain and season with the dressing, chopped parsley and marjoram. [[Category:Crayfish Recipes]] [[Category:Shellfish Recipes]] [[Category:Octopus Recipes]] [[Category:Squid Recipes]] [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "==Ingredients== 6 cup diced ripe tomatoes, cut into wedges (use an assortment of colours and sizes) 3 Tbsp fresh lime juice 1 clove minced garlic ¼ cup minced red onion 1..."
revision.text:
==Ingredients== 6 cup diced ripe [[tomato]]es, cut into wedges (use an assortment of colours and sizes)
3 Tbsp fresh [[lime juice]]
1 clove minced [[garlic]]
¼ cup minced [[red onion]]
1 cup finely diced [[celery]]
½ cup diced [[cucumber]]
2 tsp celery [[salt]]
1 Tbsp prepared [[horseradish]]
3 dash [[Worschestershire sauce]]
1 dash [[Tabasco]] sauce
[[salt]] and ground [[black pepper]]
==Directions== 1. Toss the tomato, lime juice and garlic, then cover and let sit 30 minutes.
2. Strain liquid from the tomatoes into a small pot and reduce to 2 Tbsp. Add this reduction back to the tomatoes and toss with the onion, celery, cucumber, celery salt, horseradish, Worschestershire sauce and Tabasco. Season to taste and chill until ready to serve. [[Category:Salad Recipes]]

page.title: Grilled Watermelon Salad with Goat Cheese

revision.comment: Created page with "==Ingredients== [[File:Grilledwatermelonsalad.png|right|link=]] *1/2 (5-pound) seedless watermelon *1/4 cup balsamic vinegar *Extra-virgin olive oil *Kosher salt (specialty sa..."
revision.text:
==Ingredients== [[File:Grilledwatermelonsalad.png|right|link=]] *1/2 (5-pound) [[seedless watermelon]] *1/4 cup [[balsamic vinegar]] *Extra-virgin [[olive oil]] *Kosher [[salt]] (specialty salt is great here, if on hand) *2 cups fresh [[baby arugula]], washed and dried *1 cup [[goat cheese]], crumbled, preferably a French Chevre *Fresh finely cracked [[black pepper]] ==Directions== #Stand the watermelon half cut side down on a cutting board and slice away the rind, leaving a solid block of melon. Turn the block on its side and cut it into 8 squares, roughly 3 by 3 inches and 1-inch thick. #Pour the vinegar into a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Cook until reduced to a thick syrup consistency. Set aside. #Heat a nonstick grill pan over medium-high heat. Drizzle just enough olive oil over watermelon slices to thinly coat and place on hot grill pan. Grill each side about 2 minutes until grill marks appear; transfer to a plate and season with salt. #To assemble the salads, put about 1/4 cup of baby arugula on a serving plate, followed by a grilled slice of watermelon in the center, and top with a tablespoon of crumbled cheese and another 1/4 cup arugula. Add another watermelon slice and another tablespoon of cheese. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Finish each salad with a very light drizzle of olive oil and balsamic syrup. Dust with black pepper and serve immediately.
[http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/claire-robinson/grilled-watermelon-salad-recipe.html?oc=linkback SOURCE: Food Network] [[Category:Salad Recipes]] [[Category:Watermelon Recipes]] [[Category:Goat cheese Recipes]]

{{Wikifiedrecipe}}
== Ingredients == * 2 cups each: [[watermelon]] balls, [[cantaloupe]] balls, [[honeydew melon|honeydew]] balls, sliced [[peach]]es, sliced [[pear]]s, quartered [[orange]] sections, sliced [[plum]]s * 1 cup each: fresh [[blueberries]], fresh [[strawberries]], cubed [[pineapple]] * 2 dozen (21 – 25) count boiled [[shrimp]] * 2 cups [[crawfish]] tails * 1 recipe fruity [[yogurt]] dressing * ½ cup chopped [[pecans]]
== Directions == # In a large glass serving bowl, layer fruit by alternating stratas of color. # Once all the fruit has been layered, line [[shrimp]] and [[crawfish]] in a decorative pattern around the edge of the bowl. # Top with fruity [[yogurt]] dressing and toss the mixture to blend the dressing into the fruit. # Sprinkle with [[pecans]] and serve immediately.
